original: Affiliation: Villainy
translation: 人脉：恶棍

original: Your associations among thieves, outcasts, and pirates.
translation: 你在小偷、流氓以及强盗中的合作者。

original: Agravain-Class Juggernaught
translation: 阿格规文级主宰

original: A thundering puissance. The terror of the skies, the harbinger of conflict.
translation: 其威能堪比轰雷掣电。它是空域中游荡的恐惧，是引爆冲突的急先锋。

original: Airs of Beach
translation: 海滩的时景

original: {"Stroll":{"0":"Your sojourn across the shore, along with your biological lifespan, is almost cut short when the earth rises from beneath your feet. As it turns out, those weren't pebbles, but a migration of emerald-striped crabs.","80":"Flying fish! How fortuitous! No. Wait. These are something else. Flesh molded into the shape of fish, with keratin scales, gills of human hair. The bodies flop onto the shore, twitching for a moment before they go still.","1":"Your sojourn across the shore, along with your biological lifespan, is almost cut short when the earth rises from beneath your feet. As it turns out, those weren't pebbles, but a migration of emerald-striped crabs.","15":"A segmented worm with extremely large eyes stares at you mournfully as you pass it by. It is of little import. The way the mists catch and devour the starlight is enthralling.","45":"You skip pebbles along the mists. At least, you try. Instead of bouncing across the fog, the pebbles excite noises from their depths. After half an hour or so, you manage to string a melody from the sounds.","145":"You skip pebbles along the mists. At least, you try. Instead of bouncing across the fog, the pebbles excite noises from their depths. After half an hour or so, you manage to string a melody from the sounds.","180":"Flying fish! How fortuitous! No. Wait. These are something else. Flesh molded into the shape of fish, with keratin scales, gills of human hair. The bodies flop onto the shore, twitching for a moment before they go still.","101":"Your sojourn across the shore, along with your biological lifespan, is almost cut short when the earth rises from beneath your feet. As it turns out, those weren't pebbles, but a migration of emerald-striped crabs.","115":"A segmented worm with extremely large eyes stares at you mournfully as you pass it by. It is of little import. The way the mists catch and devour the starlight is enthralling.","30":"This section of the beach is unusually pallid. As you crunch along the 'sand', you discover this is because it is comprised of ground-up bones. All from birds and mice, as far as you can tell.","160":"Ah, isn't this nice? Inhale that crisp air. Ignore the way the liquorice-stink clots in your lungs, viscous as a swallow of black oil.","130":"This section of the beach is unusually pallid. As you crunch along the 'sand', you discover this is because it is comprised of ground-up bones. All from birds and mice, as far as you can tell.","60":"Ah, isn't this nice? Inhale that crisp air. Ignore the way the liquorice-stink clots in your lungs, viscous as a swallow of black oil."}}
translation: {"Stroll":{"0":"当地球从你脚下升起时，你在岸边的逗留时间与你的生物学寿命几乎一同被缩减了。 事实证明，那些东西不是卵石，而是一群移居的翡翠条纹蟹。","80":"飞鱼！真走运！不。等等。这些是别的东西。血肉被塑造成鱼的形状，有着角质的鳞片，人类发丝组成的鳃。它们的身体跌落在海滩上，抽搐片刻后便静止不动了。","1":"当地球从你脚下升起时，你在岸边的逗留时间与你的生物学寿命几乎一同被缩减了。 事实证明，那些东西不是鹅卵石，而是一群移居的翡翠条纹蟹。","15":"当你路过时，一只眼睛极大的分段蠕虫悲哀地凝视你。它无足轻重。迷雾捕捉并吞食星光的方式真是令人着迷。","45":"你沿着迷雾跳过卵石。至少，你在尝试这样做。这些卵石在自己的深度激起了声响，而不是在雾中反弹。大约半小时后，你成功用这种声音组成了一段旋律。","145":"你沿着迷雾跳过卵石。至少，你在尝试这样做。这些卵石在自己的深度激起了声响，而不是在雾中反弹。大约半小时后，你成功用这种声音组成了一段旋律。","180":"飞鱼！真走运！不。等等。这些是别的东西。血肉被塑造成鱼的形状，有着角质的鳞片，人类发丝组成的鳃。它们的身体跌落在海滩上，抽搐片刻后便静止不动了。","101":"当地球从你脚下升起时，你在岸边的逗留时间与你的生物学寿命几乎一同被缩减了。 事实证明，那些东西不是鹅卵石，而是一群移居的翡翠条纹蟹。","115":"当你路过时，一只眼睛极大的分段蠕虫悲哀地凝视你。它无足轻重。迷雾捕捉并吞食星光的方式真是令人着迷。","30":"沙滩的这一部分异常地苍白。当你踏过这些‘沙子’时，你发现这是因为它由磨碎的骨组成。据你所知，它们全部来自鸟和老鼠。","160":"啊，这难道不好吗？呼吸那新鲜的空气。不去思考甘草的恶臭如何于你肺中阻塞，黏稠地像吞下一口黑油。","130":"沙滩的这一部分异常地苍白。当你踏过这些‘沙子’时，你发现这是因为它由磨碎的骨组成。据你所知，它们全部来自鸟和老鼠。","60":"啊，这难道不好吗？呼吸那新鲜的空气。不去思考甘草的恶臭如何于你肺中阻塞，黏稠地像吞下一口黑油。"}}

original: Airs of Blind Hermits
translation: 盲人隐士的时景

original: They see nothing, except hidden truths.
translation: 他们什么也看不到，除了隐藏的真相。

original: {"HermitDescription":{"51":"The Hermit's puckered skin is a mass of fungal blooms and the purple-leafed flowers of twilight. They tend to them with a sliver of obsidian, delicately carving weeds from their flesh.","76":"The air hangs heavy with the ancient stench of blood, gristle and decaying flesh. The Hermit kneels by the still breathing body of some no longer identifiable animal, their sticky fingers questing for whatever wisdom may lie within flesh and bones.","26":"The Hermit drags a sharp rock through their flesh, carving spiral patterns on already bloodied skin. Their milky-grey eyes stare at something beyond the cave wall. Their whispers could as easily be prophecy or madness.","0":"The Hermit lingers at the edge of sight, their rags the remnants of a zee-captain's uniform. Two of their eyes are closed tight. The third, carved with scars into their arm, seems to stare through you."},"HermitObserve":{"51":"The Hermit sits motionless, meditating under a steady drip of water that feeds their garden of flesh. Their unblinking eyes pay you no attention as you take the candle deeper into the cave. Roses bloom in the dark, curling up and dying in the presence of the light.","0":"The Hermit whispers to the darkness. They pay you no mind as you look at their few remaining possessions. A trading log from a place far away, a faded photo of a love last seen in Old London. A diary that begins with scholarly descriptions of Eleutherian wonders and ends with nothing but scribbles of the same eye carved into their flesh. The last coherent entry is dated November 1886. ","76":"The Hermit works their haruspicy on the dying beast, occasionally pausing to stroke its fur and close its eyes to the pain. Their cave is filled with bones and rotting meat and a smell that makes your eyes water. Amongst them is the wreckage of what appears to be a zubmarine. A second glance at the bones reveals that not all of them are from animals.","26":"The Hermit finishes carving their latest spiral and takes a drink from a gentle trickle of water running down from the roof of the cave. Their milky-grey eyes stare past you; their mouth occasionally forms a coherent word. Sweat builds on their brow. Their words might be truth, falsehood, or any flavour of madness in between."},"HermitSecret":{"26":"The Hermit cups their hands beneath a gentle trickle of foul smelling water. They drink, then their words flow freely. They speak of the great charnel houses of Europe. How the Eagle will fight the Bear. How the Clockwork God will fall. A whisper of your own future too, never intended for your ears. A warning of what you may become in the dark.","0":"The Hermit's words are rapid in pace and low on coherence. They speak while painting a picture on the wall; another eye, like the one in their tattoo. Now your vision has adjusted, just a little, to the darkness, you can see the same symbol emblazoned a thousand times across the walls, sometimes open, often closed. Just for a moment, you understand. Just for a moment, you see.","51":"The Hermit cuts a purple flower from their shoulder, licking the blood from the stem. They wrap it tight and place it in an old chipped cup full of gathered rainwater, stirring with the obsidian shard until it runs dark. They offer it. There is no refusing. When you wake up, only blessed fragments of nightmare remain. Burning at their core is an eye; the same one you now see repeated again and again in the Hermit's garden of flesh.","76":"The Hermit accepts your offering and gestures for you to join them; to soothe the dying animal's pain in its last moments. They sift their fingers through its insides, plucking out organs and placing them on the ground in a careful but indecipherable pattern. When it is complete, the Hermit rests a compassionate hand on the beast's head and slits its throat in a smooth, practised manner. What they hoped to learn from this goes unspoken, but as you stand to leave, you see the pattern. An eye."}}
translation: {"HermitDescription":{"51":"隐士那皱缩的皮肤是由一团团菌落般的，在暮色映衬下叶色艳紫的花朵相接而成。他乐于以黑曜石的细条在血肉上精心雕刻，去除芜杂。","76":"空气中弥漫着血液、软骨和腐烂肉体的衰朽的恶臭，隐士跪坐在一些早已停止呼吸，躯体难以识别的动物旁，用他黏糊糊的手指在残存的骨骼和血肉中寻求任何可能的知识。","26":"隐士拉拽着一块锋利的石片穿过他的身体，在已经鲜血淋漓的皮肤上雕刻出螺旋式的图案。他乳灰色的眼睛似乎盯着洞穴外的什么东西。他的低语似乎能轻易做出预言，抑或是招致疯狂。","0":"隐士徘徊在视界的边缘，他身上的破布是海泽船长制服的残余部分。他双眼紧闭，而刻满疤痕的手臂上的第三只眼睛好似紧紧注视着你。"},"HermitObserve":{"51":"隐士一动不动地坐着，在源源不断的水滴下冥想，这滴水滋养了他的血肉之园。当你持着蜡烛深入洞穴时，他那不眨的双眼没有注意到你。玫瑰在黑暗中绽放，却光明面前蜷缩着枯萎。","0":"隐士对着黑暗低语，并不在乎你看到他仅剩的资产——一份遥远地区的交易日志，一张在旧伦敦最后一次与爱人相见所拍的褪色的照片。一份以厄琉忒里亚景色的学术性描述为起点，以胡乱涂鸦其身体上镌刻的眼睛为结尾。最后一个连贯的条目日期是1886年11月。","76":"隐士在濒死的野兽上实施他的脏卜术, 偶尔停下来抚摸它的皮毛，使它在疼痛中闭上眼睛。他的洞穴里满是骨头和腐烂的肉，还有一种让你流眼泪的气味。其洞穴大致是一艘潜艇的残骸，再看一眼这些骨头，就会发现并非所有骨头都来自动物。","26":"隐士完成了他手上的螺旋图案的雕刻，并啜饮从洞穴顶部缓缓流下的细流。他乳白色的灰色眼睛凝视着你，偶尔说些什么。汗水积聚在他们的额头上。他的话可能是真的，也可能是假的，抑或是介于两者之间的呢喃疯语。"},"HermitSecret":{"26":"隐士把手放在一股散发着恶臭的细流下。他只有饮下流水，才能连贯自由的说话。他谈及欧洲最大的埋骨地，鹰如何与熊搏斗，发条之神因何陨落。一个关于你自己未来的耳语，从未想过会出现在你的耳边；一个关于你在黑暗中可能会变成什么的警告。","0":"隐士的话语节奏快却不连贯，他一边在墙上画画一边说话，而另一只眼睛，就像他们纹身上的那只。你的视力稍微适应了黑暗，可以在墙上看到同样的符号，其中有些是开放的，有些是闭合的。仅一会儿，你看到了，仅一会儿，你理解了。","51":"隐士从他的肩膀上割下一朵紫色的花，舔着茎上的血。他把它包得紧紧的，放在一个有缺口的旧杯子里，杯子里装满了收集的雨水，用黑曜石细条搅拌，直到天黑。他提供这个，无法拒绝。当你醒来时，唯有噩梦仍存。在他的心脏中燃烧着的是一只眼睛，那只你在隐士的血肉之园上反复看到的。","76":"隐士接受你的提议，打手势示意让你加入，来减轻濒死动物在最后时刻的痛苦。他用手指在动物的体内筛选，取出器官，以一种小心但晦涩难明的图案放在地上。完成后，隐士同情的将手放在野兽的头上，并以平稳、老练的方式切开它的喉咙。他希望从中学习的东西并未说明，但当你站起准备离开时，你看到了图案——一只眼睛。"}}

original: Airs of Brabazon
translation: 布拉巴宗的时景

original: There cannot be change without destruction.
translation: 没有破坏就不可能有改变。

original:
{"AirsOnWorld":{"0":"AirsOnWorld"},"AirsOffWorld":{"0":"too nice, unsettling a bit prisonerlike","1":"too nice, unsettling a bit prisonerlike"},"ChatWithGovernor":{"0":""It's a pleasure to see you. How are you enjoying Little Nice? Have you visited Brabazon proper, yet? We've been doing some marvellous work there." He doesn't give you much room for conversation. ","1":""It's a pleasure to see you. How are you enjoying Little Nice? Have you visited Brabazon proper, yet? We've been doing some marvellous work there." He doesn't give you much room to speak.","80":""Ah, welcome." He stands to shake your hand. "Always good to see a locomotive captain. Good to know the trade routes are still running. Do you smoke?" He rummages in his desk. "Oh. It appears I'm all out. My apologies."","60":""Have you been to London recently? It struck me just now that I can barely remember the place." 

He turns to look out of the window, at the ridiculous cherubim-water-feature. "I always thought it my home. But obviously it can't be." 

He harumphs loudly. "Still, it's nice to know they appreciate my work. I received word that I've been commended by some Hall or another, in my absence."","90":""I've been thinking of varying the stops on the tour of Brabazon. But I don't want to increase the strain on the workers. They always like to put on an extra effort when we have guests, and if I change their routine..." 

He shakes his head. "No, we'll stick with what we have. It's very representative, after all. Have you been on it?"","10":"The Governor has his back to you, and doesn't see you enter. He's miming conducting to some jolly little tune on the gramophone. Is that something by Gilbert and Sullivan? Best leave him to it. ","20":"The Governor stands by the window. He looks past the tasteless fountain to where an Overseer is sweeping up leaves. "This man here: came here with his parents and worked his way up. Paid off their debts entirely. In a few months, he should be able to afford to leave. I've arranged for him to visit Lustrum as soon as he can afford the fare."","30":""A pleasure to see you. I have a soft spot for locomotive captains. So much plainer speaking than merchants and lawyers." 

He stubs out his cigar. "Apparently I had an uncle who captained a locomotive. Destroyed by a scrive spinster. My mother dined off the tale for months. Everyone found it terribly romantic." He looks puzzled for a moment. "Not sure why."","40":""I'm immensely proud of our workers. Industry's up. Our hour refining is more efficient than ever. Our weavers are the best in the region. I've even heard rumours that Her Renewed Majesty commented positively on a glass piece made by one of our very own blowers." He beams at you. "Albion wouldn't be the same without them."","50":"You enter to catch the Governor performing callisthenics. You can't tell if he blushes – his face is flushed already. "It's important to exercise regularly. Keeps one young."","70":"He points out a plaque on the wall. "This is a list of the original donors, who helped us set up Brabazon Workworld. They've all contributed to this place: a place where the destitute can learn new skills, and find a home." He leans back in his desk chair. "Some donors visit Brabazon to ensure their good work continues.""},"AirsBetween":{"0":"Overseers scurry back and forth along the glass tunnel, clumping at the Little Nice end. As they enter Little Nice they remove grimy capes to reveal cheery red and white striped blazers. These are hung up to be collected on their re-entrance to the Bit Between. None seem willing to stop and talk.","7":"A middle-aged man pushes a handtruck of crates from Brabazon to the docking area. The Overseer beside him adds her weight to assist. You hear snatches of their conversation. "Mother! Stop helping. You'll be made to join us." The woman's laugh is high and nervous. "—twice my own age. And you want me to stay away?" She sees you and is instantly formal. "I'm sorry, Captain. These goods are allotted to another locomotive."","28":"The Overseer is folding his work cape up rather than hanging it. He places it in a storage bench opposite the dock. He beams when you approach him. "I've been promoted to gardener. I'll be living and working in Little Nice, from now. And to think, I was warned away from flirting with the donors."","35":""Are you one of our donors? No? My mistake." The Overseer tuts at the list in their hands. "All our major donors have expressed a wish to see the result of their good works. It's too much to ask that they arrive on time. Bl___y rich b—" Abruptly aware that you have not moved on, she blanches. "That... that was a joke. Please don't mention it."","42":"You catch the Overseer's eye just as she's putting on her work cape. She nods and comes over. "My shift's not for a couple of hours. I can spare a minute." She smiles warmly; a practised smile. "I help with the tour. The best role available off Little Nice. I thoroughly recommend it. And if you go, could you put a word in for me? With the board?" She checks her watch and sets off at a trot.","49":""I'm terribly sorry, I don't have permission to speak with you." The Overseer is supervising a small group of workers loading crates onto a locomotive docked alongside your own. They are working slowly; he seems disinclined to rush them.","21":"The Overseers have unusual walking habits. From Little Nice to Brabazon Workworld, they stroll at a measured pace. At a point some two-thirds along, they break into a run. Any Overseer leaving Brabazon does so at a sprint. At that two-thirds point they slow once more, and catch their breath. None breaks this pattern. Each ignores your attempt to waylay them.","56":"Two Overseers are engaged in a hissed argument. It silences immediately when a portly gentleman in fine tweed strolls by. "Good day, Mr B_____y," they call out in unison. They separate, glaring at each other only when they believe they're unwatched.","63":"An Overseer shoves an empty cart towards the Brabazon end of the Bit Between. It rolls to a stop beside two elderly ladies who haul it onto the workworld. No one wishes to spend any time proximate to the workworld that they are not obliged to.","70":"An Overseer checks his watch before pausing beside you. "I'm very sorry, but I can't stop. Unless you're from...? No, you aren't in uniform. Sorry. I can't dawdle – I'm only twenty, and look at me—" He does not look twenty. "I can't afford to risk demotion."","14":"Six Overseers march towards Brabazon Workworld. They almost knock you down in their remorseless rush. They do not stop. One calls back: "I'm so sorry! Please do not put in a  complaint."","84":"Overseers scurry back and forth along the glass tunnel, clumping at the Little Nice end. As they enter Little Nice they remove grimy capes to reveal cheery red and white striped blazers. These are hung up to be collected on their re-entrance to the Bit Between. None seem willing to stop and talk.","91":""Are you one of our donors? No? My mistake." The Overseer tuts at the list in their hands. "All our major donors have expressed a wish to see the result of their good works. It's too much to ask that they arrive on time. Bl___y rich b—" Abruptly aware that you have not moved on, she blanches. "That... that was a joke. Please don't mention it."","98":""I'm terribly sorry, I don't have permission to speak with you." The Overseer is supervising a small group of workers loading crates onto a locomotive docked alongside your own. They are working slowly; he seems disinclined to rush them.","77":"Two Overseers are occupied with another Captain. He is counting workers off his locomotive. They are a mixed group, all in rags – but some of their garments show the signs of once having been fashionable and expensive. This group fell down on their luck, and hard. The Captain re-boards, along one of the Overseers. The look on the other's face is filled with envy."},"AfterRevolution":{"0":"AfterRevolution"},"PubChat":{"0":""I enjoy my work here. Count it as a rest, not more work. Could go on longer of course, but I shouldn't complain. Got a thorn embedded in my arm yesterday, this gives it time to heal."","50":""We've just beer at the moment. A few of us are working on acquiring the taste for it. I'm a cider woman, myself. Though I suppose, in my position, perhaps it's best if I'm not tempted by the beverages?"","75":""Last I saw of my son, he was older than me. That was a... strange sensation, certainly." She moves away to pour a pint; no one has ordered one. On her return: "But you can get used to anything, right? What'll you have?"","90":""I won't hear a word said against the new Governor. Life here isn't perfect, but it's a damn sight better. We were naive to think everything could be fixed, just like that."","25":""Have you ever just lain in the grass and looked up? At the Wilderness? There are so many stars – it makes me dizzy, almost. You can't see the sky from Brabazon itself, you know. I'd forgotten what it was like."","85":""I petitioned for this job. Thought we'd get a few more captains in. Wanted to hear tales of far away from here. Can't leave till— Can't leave yet. But I just wanted to hear about them, you know? But seems most are still frightened of the time thing. Pity."","35":""Spent yesterday wrestling – literally wrestling – a begonia. Or it looked like one, at least. Anyway, don't know what was up with it, acting as if it came from the Reach. Quietened down now, thank goodness." Is she teasing you? She smiles, but that doesn't help.","60":""Excuse me one moment." She darts around the bar to fold a toppling Overseer into his seat. "Sorry about that. It's as likely to be exhaustion as the booze, and I like to give them the benefit of the doubt.""},"PubDrink":{"0":""...and that's when I realised, I'd been flirting with me own daughter! And there was me thinking I was safe with older women." There is a burst of laughter, and stamping of feet. The woman continues. "Still, we had a lovely reunion, and she appreciated the present anyway. I'll be swapping shifts so I can see her more often, too." The crowd 'aww's in delight.","50":""My first day as an Overseer and I'm already being given drinks. B____y hell! This is the good life." Another pats the boy on the shoulder: "Wait till tomorrow. You're on sewage duty." Everyone but the boy chuckles.","25":"The Overseer is too drunk to do more than blink at you. She frowns, then heads for the pile of blazers in the corner. On the third try she finds one that fits. No one calls out to claim it as theirs. The chap nearest you explains: "It's not like we own anything, is it?"","40":"Three Overseers are competing to see how many drinks each can keep down. There are dark mutterings in the corner about waste, but as a gregarious Overseer says, it'll be someone else's turn some day.","85":"A drunk Overseer plops himself down beside you. "Dunno if I should thank you or punch you, for all you've done here." He opts for an awkward hug, before beginning to snore loudly. Eventually, you extract yourself.","10":"A hush descends on the Knackered Horse. The Governor enters. Drinks are on him tonight. Although, as he says, given all is now owned equally, drinks are technically always on him. Polite laughter follows.","60":""Homebrew!" A chorus of groans go around the Hours. "Again?" The elderly Observer's eyes are wet with disappointment. 

"Until Her Maj lifts the sanctions, it'll be homebrew for days yet," the landlord roars, "So you'd best learn to enjoy it!"","75":""...so the new Governor. You knew the guv before he was the guv, right?" All eyes turn to you. "Has he changed? Was this what he said he wanted? Really wanted? But they're all still st—" 

A more sober Overseer hushes the speaker. "Of course it is. Isn't this better?""},"Committee":{"95":""Bronzewood. That's the ticket. If we could establish contact with the camp on Traitor's Wood, or the clever chappies in the Nature Reserve, we'd be in business." 

"Still gotta bring it through Albion. Never get past the Ministry's engines." 

"Not unless we had a friend on the inside." 

"And do we?" 

"We might. We just might."","85":""Did we come to an agreement on whether the Governor would be attending these sessions?" 

"I'll check the minutes for last session." 

"Oh don't bother. The Governor has given us his answer already in his absence."","75":""I have a complaint about the food." 

"We all have a complaint about the food."","65":""Compared to how things were before, are you... happy?" 

"You're honestly asking me that? Whether I'm happy? Of course I'm not. But this isn't about me, is it?"","55":""It's not fraternising." 

"No? Then what would you call it, pray tell?" 

"Excuse me, would you like that last remark to be italicised?"

"What?" 

"For the minutes, you see. It sounded pointed and I have made a very concerted effort to italicise any and all pointed remarks." 

"Oh for pity's sake. Good thing we haven't any pressing business to discuss." 

"Same question, I'm afraid."","50":""Visiting hours would be good." 

"I agree." 

"So you'd come down to the w—" 

"God no. We'll arrange for small groups to come to the Bit Between. Or Little Nice, if we can persuade the Governor. I'm not going down there ever again, if I can help it."","40":""Right. So we'll arrange a rotation of younger workworlders into the empty dormitory of Little Nice." 

"Why younger? The old ones have less time left. That's hardly fair." 

"I thought we wanted to give some a chance. Not remove it from everyone." 

"Oh."","35":""Oh,this is intolerable! We cannot go on like this." 

"I could not agree more. Committee! Votes to eject the honourable member from proceedings. He is evidently suffering." 

"You can't remove everybody who disagrees with your proposals." 

"Oh? Watch me. Votes!" 

"Oh for goodness' sake. Sorry, Hubert. We'll see about getting you elected again next month."","25":""So... have you seen them recently? Your son? He left, left proper, right?" 

"Yes, and no." 

"You saw him or you didn't?" 

"I— Look, this isn't committee business. It's not like we have time to waste."","10":""Could you up the production of glassware? It's one of our most valuable exports and if we had more money we could fund—" 

"Fund more booze ups at your little pub? We have heard about it, you know. You could at least invite me if you're going to—" 

"No, you fool. I thought we could fund a couple of tickets away from here."","0":""I think that Overseers and workers should swap roles every other day." 

"I see your point. I disagree. Strongly." 

"Because you're scared?" 

"Of course not. Because we all have specialised roles that benefit from continuous practice.""},"School":{"50":"Two Overseers nearby join you in waving. They plaster false smiles on their faces. Once the children are gone, one says: "Some of them won't stop crying about the nannies. But the alternative was so much worse. To see your parents wither into old age? They are too young to understand."","75":"A girl at the edge of the group makes eye contact with you. She slowly contorts her face into something grotesque. It's impressive that she can keep walking in a straight line, with her eyes like that. An Overseer near you laughs: "That one's destined for the circus. I hope she gets there."","25":"The acoustics of the Bit Between seem to have been perfectly designed to amplify the shouts and shrieks of children. It is cacophonous. Fortunately, there is no need for manners – all Overseers present are covering their ears. You join them till the flock has passed.","65":"A group of teenagers startle their schoolmistress. "Goodness!", she cries, dropping her chalk. "I remember you lot when you were running round on scraped knees, like it was just yesterday." Her charges do not bother to respond.","40":"A clock strikes three: the end of the school day. A stern schoolmistress is saying farewell to her charges. "I shall see you tomorrow – I mean, well, in a month. Do be good!" ","85":"An Observer is attempting to teach economics. Supply, demand, the trade routes that chain the two together. He demonstrates the theory through arranging the children around the classroom.

"What are we, sir?" A small girl asks plaintively. 

"To London, supply. Others would say we supply too little and demand too much." He smiles with all of his teeth. "Others, not enough at all."","10":"An Overseer is escorting a gangly young man away from the school. "I'm afraid you've outgrown us," she is saying. The man hangs his head.

"Only started shaving Tuesday last," he says, mournfully.","0":"One of the youngest, a particularly grubby looking creature, rushes over to hug your leg. "'ello," he says, shyly. 

"Get back here you manipulative monster!" calls the Overseer trying to herd them."},"ChatWithGovernor2":{"10":"Going by the sounds, the Governor is sitting at his desk. He is also remarkably proficient at profanities. He is, however, entirely concealed by stacks of paperwork. "Whoever you are, you'll just have to go away. I can do nothing else till I've resolved this nonsense."","20":"When you enter the front room where the Governor does his official business, he is not there. A note on his desk – in poorly formed cursive – suggests that he will be back 'in a while'. There is no indication of where he might be. While you are reading, he arrives. He looks tired. His hair is dusted with rust-brown motes.","30":"The Governor hastily puts away a handkerchief as you come in. His face is oddly puffy, his eyes red. "Can I help you?" When you inquire after his well-being, he dismisses your apparent concern with a wave. "Time catches up with us all. Well. In my case it caught up with an old friend."","40":"The door to his office is shut. There is muffled shouting from inside. "—don't you think I'm trying? Perhaps one of those lot should try being b____y Governor, then! I—" An Overseer stands beside you, smiling pointedly. You are seen outside before you can hear any more.","50":"The Governor has his nose buried in a thick book. You have to cough twice before he glances up. "Oh! Sorry. Completely oblivious. Ha!" He moves the book out of sight, beneath his desk. "It's part of a donation from London. I couldn't resist. I'll have the box taken to Brabazon as soon as I've finished." He stares pointedly till you leave.","60":"The Governor is sitting opposite an Overseer. She is middle-aged, her russet hair streaked with grey. She is concentrating ferociously on a chess set. "It's her second game," says the Governor conspiratorially. "Shhh!" she hushes, briefly oblivious to her status. He smiles avuncularly.","70":""What do you think about wine?" The Governor is considering a recently-empty glass before him. "I'm not sure I understand all the fuss. Apparently this one tasted like flint. Just tasted like wine to me." He raises one eyebrow. "I suppose that's the kind of thing I shouldn't be admitting." He sighs.","80":"An Overseer is sitting at the Governor's desk. "Please do leave a message with me. The Governor's in the bath. He'll be a while." The Overseer's grip on his pencil is rigor mortis-like. It would be safest for both nib, paper and quite possibly the man's hand if you just came back later.","90":"He smiles at you. He looks exhausted. "It's good to see you. It's good just to spend a moment with someone who saw me in the thick of it." He shakes his head. "Not all of them understand. Think I should be rescuing them, somehow. I'm doing my best – but I can't get the ships to take them away. And then where would they go?"","1":"When you come in, the Governor is peering into the mouth of a young worker. "Ah, you must allow me to explain." He gestures to the worker that he may close his mouth. "Some of the workers have been complaining of searing tooth pain. Some are so bad they're unable to work. I feel there must be something that can be done to relieve it."","0":"When you come in, the Governor is peering into the mouth of a young worker. "Ah, you must allow me to explain." He gestures to the worker that he may close his mouth. "Some of the workers have been complaining of searing tooth pain. Some are so bad they're unable to work. I feel there must be something that can be done to relieve it.""}}
translation:
{ "AirsOnWorld": {"0": "AirsOnWorld"},"AirsOffWorld": {"0": "过于美好，弥漫着令人不安的囚徒感","1": "过于美好，弥漫着令人不安的囚徒感"},"ChatWithGovernor": {"0": ""幸会。您在小奈斯过得可好？去过真正的布拉巴宗了吗？我们在那里完成了一些非凡的工程。"他并未给您留下多少交谈的余地。","1": ""幸会。您在小奈斯过得可好？去过真正的布拉巴宗了吗？我们在那里完成了一些非凡的工程。"他几乎没给您开口的机会。","80": ""啊，欢迎。"他起身与您握手，"见到机车车长总是件乐事。知道贸易航线仍在运转真好。抽烟吗？"他在桌屉里翻找着，"哦，看来我的存货告罄了。失礼。"","60": ""您最近去过伦敦吗？说来奇怪，此刻我竟几乎想不起那地方的模样。"

他转身望向窗外荒唐的丘比特喷泉，"我总以为那是故乡，但显然并非如此。"

他重重地清了清嗓子，"不过得知他们赏识我的工作总是好的。听说在我缺席期间，某个殿堂授予了我嘉奖。"","90": ""我考虑过调整布拉巴宗导览路线的停靠点，但不愿增加工人负担。每当有访客，他们总会额外卖力。若我打乱他们的作息..."

他摇摇头，"罢了，保持现状吧。毕竟现有的路线最具代表性。您体验过吗？"","10": "总督背对着您，未察觉您已入内。他正随着留声机里欢快的小调模仿指挥动作——像是吉尔伯特与沙利文的作品？最好别打扰他。","20": "总督伫立窗边，目光越过俗气的喷泉望向正在清扫落叶的监督者："这人随父母来此，凭自己努力晋升。不仅偿清全部债务，再过几月就能攒够路费离开。我已安排他一旦凑够车资便前往伍载镇。"","30": ""幸会。我对机车车长总怀有特殊好感，比起商贾讼棍，你们的言辞要坦率得多。"

他碾熄雪茄，"据说我曾有位担任车长的叔父，被纺书人摧毁了机车。家母将这故事佐餐数月，众人都觉浪漫非常。"他面露困惑，"不知缘由何在。"","40": ""我为工人们深感自豪。产能提升，时间提炼效率空前，纺织工技艺冠绝此域。甚至听闻新生的女王陛下盛赞过我们某位吹制工的玻璃作品。"他容光焕发，"没有他们，阿尔比恩将不复今日荣光。"","50": "您撞见总督正在练习健美操。不知他是否脸红——他的面庞早已涨得通红。"定期锻炼很重要，能让人永葆青春。"", "70": "他指向墙上的铜匾："这是布拉巴宗工作世界初创时的捐助者名录。他们都为这个能让赤贫者习得新技能、找到归属之地的地方做出了贡献。"他向后仰靠在椅背上，"有些捐助者会亲临视察善款去向。""},"AirsBetween": {"0": "监督者们在玻璃隧道中来回奔忙，聚集在小奈斯出口处。进入小奈斯前，他们脱下污渍斑斑的斗篷，露出红白条纹的鲜艳外套。这些外套被挂起，待重返工作世界时取回。无人愿驻足交谈。","7": "中年男子推着装满板条箱的手推车从布拉巴宗驶向泊区，身旁的女监督者搭手相助。您听见零碎对话："母亲！别帮忙。您会被迫加入我们的。"妇人的笑声尖锐而紧张，"——年纪是我的两倍，却要我避嫌？"她发现您后立刻端肃："抱歉车长，这批货物已分配给他车。"","28": "监督者将工作斗篷折叠而非悬挂，放入泊区对面的储物长凳。见您靠近，他喜形于色："我被提拔为园丁了！从今往后常驻小奈斯。当初他们还警告我莫要与捐助者调情呢。"""35": ""您是捐助者吗？不是？恕我唐突。"监督者咂嘴翻动手中名单，"所有主要捐助者都表示想见证善款成果。要他们准时抵达简直强人所难。那些天杀的阔佬——"意识到您仍在场，她霎时面无血色，"那...只是个玩笑。请勿提及。"","42": "您与正在披挂工作斗篷的女监督者四目相对。她点头走来："离当值还有两小时。可以闲聊片刻。"她展露训练有素的温暖笑容，"我负责导览——这是小奈斯之外最好的岗位。衷心推荐。若您参加导览，能否在委员会替我美言几句？"她瞄了眼怀表疾步离去。","49": ""万分抱歉，我未被授权与您交谈。"监督者正监督工人向邻车装载货箱。工人们动作迟缓，他却毫无催促之意。","21": "监督者们的行走习惯颇为奇特：从小奈斯到布拉巴宗工作世界时，他们以标准步速徐行；行至三分之二处突然奔跑。任何离开工作世界者皆全速冲刺，至三分之二处复归缓行调息。无人打破此规，亦无人理会您的拦阻。","56": "两名监督者正激烈低语争吵，直到身着精致粗花呢的胖绅士经过才噤声。"日安，B_____y先生。"他们齐声问候。分开后，仅在自认无人注视时才互相瞪视。","63": "监督者将空推车猛推向布拉巴宗方向。推车停驻于两位老妇人身旁，由她们拖入工作世界。无人愿在非必要时刻接近此地。","70": "监督者查看怀表后驻足："很抱歉无法停留。除非您来自...？不，您未着制服。恕难奉陪——我才二十岁，但看看我这模样——"他绝无二十岁样貌，"实在不敢冒降级风险。"","14": "六名监督者列队冲向工作世界，几乎将您撞倒亦不停步。一人回头喊道："万分抱歉！请勿投诉。"","84": "监督者们在玻璃隧道中来回奔忙，聚集在小奈斯出口处。进入小奈斯前，他们脱下污渍斑斑的斗篷，露出红白条纹的鲜艳外套。这些外套被挂起，待重返工作世界时取回。无人愿驻足交谈。","91": ""您是捐助者吗？不是？恕我唐突。"监督者咂嘴翻动手中名单，"所有主要捐助者都表示想见证善款成果。要他们准时抵达简直强人所难。那些天杀的阔佬——"意识到您仍在场，她霎时面无血色，"那...只是个玩笑。请勿提及。"","98": ""万分抱歉，我未被授权与您交谈。"监督者正监督工人向邻车装载货箱。工人们动作迟缓，他却毫无催促之意。","77": "两名监督者正与另一位车长交涉。他清点着下车的工人——这群衣衫褴褛者中，某些破布依稀可见昔日华贵痕迹。他们定是遭遇了重大变故。车长携其中一名监督者返车时，留守者眼中满溢嫉妒。"},"AfterRevolution": {"0": "AfterRevolution"},"PubChat": {"0": ""我享受在此的工作，权当休憩而非劳役。当然还能坚持更久，但我不该抱怨。昨日胳膊扎进根刺，正好趁机养伤。"","50": ""目前只有啤酒。我们几个正培养对它的品味。我本是苹果酒爱好者，不过以我的处境，或许不宜受酒精诱惑？"","75": ""上次见到我儿子时，他比我还要苍老。那种感觉...着实怪异。"她转身去倒无人点的啤酒，回来时续道："但人总能适应任何事，对吧？您要点什么？"","90": ""我不允许任何人诋毁新总督。这里的生活虽不完美，却比往昔强上百倍。以为能瞬间解决所有问题，是我们太天真。"","25": ""您可曾躺在草地上仰望高空？群星璀璨得令人目眩。要知道在布拉巴宗是看不见星空的，我都快忘记这般景象了。"","85": ""我申请来酒馆工作，以为能多见几位车长，听听远方传说。在攒够时间离开前——我的意思是暂时还不能离开——但听听故事也好。可惜多数人仍畏惧时间乱流。憾事啊。"","35": ""昨天和秋海棠搏斗——字面意义的搏斗！至少它长得像秋海棠。总之不知那株来自外野的植物发了什么疯，现在总算安分了。"她挂着戏谑微笑，您却难辨真假。","60": ""失陪片刻。"她闪出吧台，将瘫软的监督者扶上座椅，"请见谅。他们多半是累垮而非喝醉，我总愿往好处想。""},"PubDrink": {"0": ""...直到那时我才发现，自己竟在勾引亲闺女！还以为找年长女士就安全了呢。"哄笑与跺脚声中，妇人继续道："不过我们重修旧好，她也很喜欢礼物。我已调班好多陪陪她。"人群发出羡慕的唏嘘。","50": ""首日上任就有酒喝！真他娘是神仙日子。"旁人拍打少年肩头："等明天让你通下水道。"除少年外众人皆笑。","25": "醉酒的监督者只知朝您眨眼。她皱眉走向角落成堆的外套，试到第三件才合身。无人认领，邻座汉子解释："我们本就不配拥有任何东西，不是吗？"","40": "三名监督者比赛谁能喝下更多酒水。角落传来谴责浪费的嘀咕，但某位开朗监督者说："迟早轮到别人享受这种特权。"","85": "醉汉瘫坐您身旁："不知该感谢还是揍你，为这一切改变。"他选择笨拙拥抱后鼾声大作，您最终挣脱出来。","10": "破马酒馆倏然寂静。总督步入宣布："今晚酒水由我买单——虽然现在一切公有，严格来说酒水本就属于我。"众人报以礼节性笑声。","60": ""家酿酒！"满屋哀嚎，"又是这个？"老观察员眼含泪花。

店主咆哮："在新生的女王解除禁运前，你们最好学会享受它！"","75": ""...所以说新总督。您在他上位前就认识他吧？这是他真正想要的吗？可他们明明还——"

清醒者捂住说话人的嘴："当然是。现在这样不好吗？""},"Committee": {"95": ""青铜木才是关键。若能联络叛徒之林的营地或自然保护区的聪明人，我们就有戏。"

"但得运过阿尔比恩，绝对躲不过公德部的机车。"

"除非有内应。"

"我们有吗？"

"或许真有。"","85": ""我们是否达成过总督列席会议的协议？"

"我查查上次会议记录。"

"不必，总督的缺席已是答案。"","75": ""我要投诉食物问题。"

"我们对食物都有意见。"","65": ""比起过去，你现在...快乐吗？"

"你真这么问？快乐？当然不快乐。但这事与我无关，不是吗？"","55": ""这不叫私通。"

"哦？那该称之为什么？"

"需要我为这句讽刺标注斜体吗？"

"什么？"

"会议记录需要。您刚才的发言充满机锋，我已努力将所有带刺言论斜体化。"

"看在时间晶体份上！幸好我们没什么正事要议。"

"恐怕刚才的问题我还得再问一遍。"","50": ""开放探视时间是个好主意。"

"我同意。"

"所以你会下到工——"

"天啊不！安排小团体来过渡区，或说服总督开放小奈斯。能不去我绝不再踏足那里。"","40": ""那么安排年轻工人轮流入住小奈斯空置宿舍。"

"为何是年轻人？年长者时日无多，这不公平。"

"我以为要给人机会，而非剥夺所有人的机会。"

"哦。"","35": ""这无法容忍！不能继续下去了！"

"附议。提议将这位可敬的成员逐出会议——显然他正承受痛苦。"

"不能把所有反对者都赶走。"

"是吗？走着瞧。表决！"

"天啊。抱歉，休伯特，下个月再帮你竞选回来吧。"","25": ""最近见过你儿子吗？他彻底离开了，对吧？"

"见过，也没见过。"

"到底见没见过？"

"这...与委员会无关。我们没时间浪费。"","10": ""能否增产玻璃器皿？这是最值钱的出口物，若有更多资金就能——"

"资助你小酒馆的狂欢？我们都知道这事。至少该邀请我——"

"不，蠢货！我想资助几张离开此地的车票。"","0": ""建议监督者与工人隔日轮换岗位。"

"明白你的意思。坚决反对。"

"因为害怕？"

"当然不。因我们各司其职方能高效运转。""},"School": {"50": "两名监督者假笑着随您向学童挥手。人潮退去后一人道："有些孩子总为保姆哭泣。但他们太年幼，无法理解看着父母衰老的恐怖。"","75": "队列边缘的女孩与您对视，缓缓将面孔扭曲成骇人模样。令人惊叹她竟能保持直线行走。身旁监督者发笑："这孩子该去马戏团。但愿她能抵达。"","25": "过渡区的声学设计完美放大了学童的尖叫。震耳欲聋的噪音中，所有监督者都捂起耳朵——您也加入其中，直至人潮经过。","65": "一群少年惊得女教师摔断粉笔："天啊！记得你们昨天还膝盖带伤乱跑呢。"学生们懒得回应。","40": "三点钟声敲响，刻板的女教师正与学童道别："明天见——我是说，下个月见。务必乖些！"","85": "观察员正通过排列学童演示经济学原理：

"先生，我们的职责是什么？"小女孩哀声问道。

"对伦敦而言，我们是供给者。有人说我们供给太少而索求太多。"他露出满口白牙微笑，"也有人说我们毫无价值。"","10": "监督者领着瘦高少年离开学校："恐怕你已超龄。"少年垂首：

"我上周二才开始刮胡子。"","0": "最年幼的脏兮兮小鬼冲来抱住您的腿："泥嚎。"，他害羞地说。

"回来！你这狡诈的小怪物！"监督者呵斥道。"},"ChatWithGovernor2": {"10": "从声响判断，总督正埋首案牍。其咒骂造诣令人惊叹，但完全被文件山遮挡。"不管你是谁，请回吧。解决这堆荒唐事之前我无法会客。"","20": "总督办公室空无一人。桌上潦草字条写着'稍后即归'，未注明去向。你阅读时他恰好归来，发间沾着铁锈色尘埃，面容疲惫。","30": "总督匆忙收起手帕。他双眼通红面容浮肿："有何贵干？"你问候其健康时，他挥手驱散关切："没人跑得过时间。好吧，就我而言，我没跑得过时间。"","40": "办公室门紧闭，传出闷吼："——你以为我不在努力？让那帮人来试试当这该*的总督！我——"一位监管者站在你身边，尴尬地微笑着，你还没听到后续，就被请出去了。","50": "总督沉浸于厚书中，你咳嗽两次才抬头："啊！抱歉。完全入神了。"他将书藏到桌下，"伦敦的捐赠品，实在忍不住。看完就送去布拉巴宗。"他紧盯你直至离开。","60": "总督正与中年监管者对弈。她灰发间杂银丝，全神贯注于棋盘。"这是她第二次下棋。"总督密语道。"嘘！"她忘形呵斥，旋即惶恐。总督报以慈祥微笑。","70": ""你对葡萄酒怎么看？"总督端详空杯，"据说这款有燧石风味，我只尝出酒味。这种话本不该承认。"他挑眉叹息。","80": "监管者僵坐总督席位："请留言。总督正在沐浴，耗时颇久。"他握笔姿势如尸僵，你决定择日再来。","90": "他疲惫微笑："很高兴见到亲历过动荡的人。他们总觉得我该拯救谁，但我已竭尽全力——无法让火车带他们离开，况且他们能去哪呢？"","1": "总督正在检查年轻工人的口腔："请容我解释。部分工人抱怨牙齿灼痛，严重者无法工作。我认为必有缓解之法。"","0": "总督正在检查年轻工人的口腔："请容我解释。部分工人抱怨牙齿灼痛，严重者无法工作。我认为必有缓解之法。""}}

original: Airs of Carillon
translation: 钟琴区的时景

original: What is the weather at Carillon?
translation: 钟琴区的天气怎么样？

original: {"enlightenment_punishment":{"0":"is having a foot surgically removed.","50":"has been forcibly dressed in a feathered ballgown.","25":"is being subjected to a series of drum beats and erratic bells, just when falling asleep.","80":"has been exposed to a disease that causes intense fevers and wicked dreams.","10":"is having an arm removed at the elbow.","20":"is being forced to perform arias in public.","45":"is receiving lessons in the conversational tongue of the Blue Kingdom.","40":"has been restricted to a diet of crocodile jerky.","55":"is wearing a headdress made of chicken bones.","15":"has been required to sing continuously, without respite, for over three hours.","65":"has to wear a hat lined with needles for the next several hours.","5":"is having a sixth finger grafted to the left hand.","95":"is being forced to read a scandalous classic of First City literature.","52":"is being forced to wear a necklace of rats.","51":"has been dressed, willy-nilly, in a striped purple and green suit, and ordered to invite people to the carnival.","42":"is eating a salad made of nothing but peppercorns.","30":"has been given a viper in a velvet sack, and told to keep it from squirming.","75":"is drinking the sort of poison that makes your lips go numb if properly dosed, and kills you in minutes if not.","33":"has been put in charge of a violent dog.","58":"is having scales grafted to the skin.","60":"has to wear nettle-flax gloves.","90":"has been given five volumes of erotic drawings from the land of the Pentecost Apes.","70":"has been dosed with a tea that induces memories of one's time in the womb.","38":"is being made to gnaw an uncooked horseradish.","85":"has been dressed in the signature paisley of the Worshipful Company of Vermin Exterminators.","62":"has been dressed in the historical armour of the Third City.","2":"is receiving the application of a seventh toe.","28":"is receiving tutelage in the use of a unicycle.","78":"has been stabbed with a needle that causes one to feel someone else's regrets.","44":"is eating a preparation of giggling mandrake; it is hilarious when bitten.","7":"is enduring an old-fashioned cupping.","22":"is being made to play a trombone without having had any lessons.","17":"has been required to perform an amateur bagpipe recital in the presence of infamous critics.","97":"is receiving a lecture in the portraiture traditions of Rubbery Men.","35":"has been forbidden to take tea or scones, and forced to indulge in Empyrean curries instead.","48":"is receiving a tattoo of Empyrean sigils."},"ordeal_punishment":{"0":"is being menaced by kittens.","90":"has been locked alone in an icy cage, but seems not to mind as much as the Devils might have hoped.","80":"has been made to sit at the top of a tall pole.","70":"is being prodded with pitchforks, though the Devils involved look a bit worn out.","60":"has been swaddled very tightly in bandages like a small baby.","50":"has been shackled at one side of the garden, on the grounds of being too dangerous.","40":"has been tied to one of the trees in the grove.","30":"is bound, face down, to a huge block of ice.","20":"is being forced to copy out the obituaries of departed wives and beloved husbands.","10":"is having tea with a Supervising Devil and a Penitent from the Terrace of Glass Statues. None of them appears to be enjoying the experience, least of all the Devil."},"deprivation_punishment":{"0":"has been shut up in a giant clock.","50":"is allowed to eat only boiled grains and the breast meat of virgin hens.","75":"must go without water, tea, or beer.","25":"is being scrubbed head to toe every fifteen minutes with a harsh carbolic soap.","90":"is following a discipline of fasting and abstinence on every day except seventh Sundays.","10":"eats only three bites of leafy vegetable and four bites of prepared meat at each meal.","40":"is responsible for copying down the pattern of the bells on a scroll many feet long, and punished for each error.","60":"is allowed to sleep in two hour stretches twice a day, inside a silk cocoon insulated from the sound of the bells.","5":"follows a personal calendar of feast days, fast days, and days of abstinence. This calendar has been plotted a full century from the present.","80":"is not allowed to hear music or see the light of day.","30":"may only wear clothing of undyed linen and nettle-flax.","95":"breathes only through a fine mesh that keeps out both scent and smoke.","55":"has been forbidden the use of chairs, seats, chaises, and divans.","45":"may speak, eat, or drink only while kneeling on the left knee.","20":"has been given a regimen of bowing each time the seventh bell rings its change.","35":"sleeps in a cupboard, wrapped in heavy wool, and is not allowed a fan.","15":"wears a blindfold at all times.","85":"may eat only after having swallowed a preparation that numbs the tongue and nose.","65":"is forced to stand for hours at a time under a dripping pipe. The drips correspond with the ringing of the second bell.","8":"may speak no adjectives, and is restricted to nouns of Roman derivation.","22":"is calculating a list of the first 3000 prime numbers.","12":"chews a sprig of mint before speaking.","18":"sees the world through frosted white glasses.","28":"cannot go out without a veil.","38":"may sit only on one buttock, never squarely on both.","48":"may not sleep except with the supervision of another Penitent.","52":"consumes only food that has first been soaked for thirty hours in vinegar.","58":"is not allowed ever to lie down.","62":"is not permitted ever to stand up straight.","42":"wears a heavy chain for a belt, and a ball at each ankle.","82":"is not allowed any reading material except a timetable of trains.","72":"wears only clothes that have been thoroughly bleached.","70":"bathes seven times a day and cleans their teeth fourteen times; has a shaved head beneath a paper cap; and eats nothing containing mushroom."},"endurance_punishment":{"0":"has been locked in a lightless box.","10":"has been buried alive.","20":"has been put in the sand up to the neck.","90":"is reading through a manual illustrating the decay of bodies.","80":"is hearing readings about the effects of plague and similar miseries.","30":"is meditating on the nature of nonexistence.","70":"is sitting motionless and staring into an empty glass bowl.","60":"is lying on the sand in the pose of one deceased.","40":"is listening to a series of lectures on the pointless misery of the grave.","50":"is copying out a list of registered deaths."},"conversion_punishment":{"0":"has been stripped of garments and possessions and given an entirely new name.","50":"has a locked tongue to prevent so much as speaking the name of a superior.","80":"is being told glamorous stories of parties, but never invited to them.","20":"is doing vigorous exercises in a sweaty room.","40":"is being subjected to daily readings on the importance of knowing one's place.","70":"suffers consistent nightmares of having devolved into a lower creature, such as a Fluke."},"excess_punishment":{"0":"has been tied to a banquet table and not allowed to leave until everything is eaten.","50":"is buried under a hundred banned volumes, none of them even slightly legal to bring into London.","70":"is being made to read the Unexpurgated History of the Worshipful Company of Cooperers, all 17 volumes.","90":"is being tutored in Parabolan mathematical proofs from non-existence.","20":"has been confined to a shed containing the archived confessions of the 270 nuns of Saint Guthlac.","40":"has been provided with an etiquette guide to the entry rituals of the Blue Kingdom.","60":"is tasked with sorting undelivered post from throughout the Reach.","30":"is required to copy out a dictionary of words that, though obscene in English, carry a holy significance in another tongue.","10":"has been served a vat of small beer and required to consume it completely.","80":"is being forced to copy out the map of a city forbidden to human visitors.","45":"is being forced to trace line drawings of Blue Kingdom fashions.","15":"has been tied to a whirling carnival ride and not allowed to get down for three days.","25":"has been fitted with a pair of intensifying goggles that present everything at extreme magnification.","55":"is copying out the names of prisoners awaiting trial for crimes whose very nature is censored.","35":"is being forced to mix by hand a thousand pots of black ink and two thousand pots of red ink.","75":"is having to sort documents into fifteen piles according to the reason they are censored.","85":"is grudgingly eating through a hundred and fifteen almond cakes.","65":"is being made to read a Empyrean dictionary aloud from cover to cover."},"inescapable_truth_punishment":{"0":"is posed naked before a portraitist of pitiless accuracy.","50":"has been made to wear a suit of iron armour all day long.","70":"has had a second skeleton implanted alongside the first.","80":"is being made to copy out a heap of encyclopedias, word for word, and begin again whenever there is an error.","90":"is being kept in isolation in a small chamber at one side of the Garden.","60":"is being made to eat every past untruth, written out on tiny parchments.","20":"has been dressed in a skin-tight garment with every body part labelled in gold ink.","30":"is memorising the deaths of kings, the births of bishops, and the wording of encyclicals.","40":"is chained to a chair with a practitioner of the psychological arts, who keeps asking questions about hidden desires and buried traumas.","45":"is being forced to make a handwritten copy of every informational article in The Seasonal since it began printing.","55":"has been locked in conversation with a Penitent from the Garden of Insatiable Roses. Neither looks happy."}}
translation: {"enlightenment_punishment":{"0":"正在接受足部切除外科手术。","50":"被迫穿上羽毛舞会礼服。","25":"每当快要入睡时，就会听到一连串的鼓声与疯铃声。","80":"接触一种导致高烧与诡异梦境的疾病。","10":"手臂被截至肘部。","20":"被迫在公众场合演唱咏叹调。","45":"正在学习蓝色王国的会话语言。","40":"只能以鳄鱼肉干为食。","55":"戴着鸡骨制成的头饰。","15":"被迫连续唱歌三个多小时。","65":"必须在接下来的几个小时里佩戴内衬针尖的帽子。","5":"左手被移植第六根手指。","95":"被迫阅读第一城市文坛丑闻作品中的经典之作。","52":"被迫佩戴由老鼠制成的一串项链。","51":"被随意要求穿上一套紫绿条纹西装，还收到邀请路人参加嘉年华的命令。","42":"正在吃一种由胡椒粒做成的沙拉。","30":"收到一个装着毒蛇的天鹅绒袋子，并被要求让蛇停止蠕动。","75":"正在饮鸩，适量的毒药会令嘴唇麻木，但稍有不慎便会致命。","33":"收到照看一条恶犬的任务。","58":"皮肤上被移植了鳞片。","60":"必须戴上刺挠的荨麻手套。","90":"收到五卷来自五旬猿之地的情色画册。","70":"饮用了能唤醒胎中记忆的茶。","38":"被迫啃咬生辣根。","85":"穿上了苍天上国害虫灭除公会招牌样式的佩斯利花纹服装。","62":"穿上了第三城市的古代盔甲。","2":"正在接受第七趾的移植手术。","28":"正在学习独轮车的骑行技巧。","78":"被一根会让人感知他人悔恨的针刺中。","44":"正在吃会咯咯笑的曼德拉草，这东西被咬时确实令人发笑。","7":"正在接受老式拔罐的折磨。","22":"虽未学过长号，但被迫吹奏。","17":"被要求在臭名昭著的评论家面前进行业余风笛演出。","97":"正在聆听有关软体人传统肖像的讲座。","35":"不能饮茶，不能享用司康饼，被迫改食苍天上国的咖喱。","48":"正在接受刺青，纹着苍天上国的符印。"},"ordeal_punishment":{"0":"面临应激的猫咪。","90":"被单独关在冰冷的牢笼里，但没有魔鬼们期待的那般痛苦。","80":"被迫坐在高高的杆子顶端。","70":"被看似疲劳的魔鬼用干草叉刺戳。","60":"像婴儿一样被包裹得严严实实。","50":"因过于危险而被锁在花园一隅。","40":"被绑在林中的树上。","30":"脸朝下地绑在一块巨大冰块上。","20":"被迫誊写过世配偶与挚爱之人的讣告。","10":"与一位魔鬼监工及一位来自玻璃雕像露台的忏悔者共饮茶水。二人并不享受，尤其是魔鬼。"},"deprivation_punishment":{"0":"被关进了一座巨型钟表中。","50":"只能进食煮熟的谷物和未受精母鸡的鸡胸肉。","75":"不得饮用水、茶或啤酒。","25":"每过十五分钟就要用刺激性石碳酸皂从头到脚刷洗一遍。","90":"每天都要禁食与禁欲，每七周的最后一个星期天除外。","10":"每餐仅能吃三口绿叶菜与四口熟肉。","40":"需将钟声的节律抄写至数米长的卷轴上，每出一错即遭惩罚。","60":"每天只能在隔音的丝绸茧中睡觉两次，每次两小时。","5":"遵循一份长达百年的节日、禁食与节制历法。","80":"不闻丝竹，不见天日。","30":"只能穿着未染色的亚麻与荨麻布衣物。","95":"只能通过一层过滤气味与烟雾的细网呼吸。","55":"禁止使用任何坐具，包括椅子、座位、躺椅与长沙发。","45":"只有左膝下跪时才能讲话、进食与饮水。","20":"每当第七口钟敲响时就必须鞠躬。","35":"只能在橱柜中睡觉，外裹厚羊毛毯，且不得使用风扇。","15":"必须全天佩戴眼罩。","85":"进食前必须吞下一种令人失去嗅觉与味觉的药剂。","65":"必须在漏水的水管下站上数小时。滴水频率与第二口钟一致。","8":"不得使用任何形容词，只能使用含拉丁语词源的名词。","22":"正在数前3000个质数。","12":"必须咀嚼一枝薄荷再说话。","18":"通过蒙白的磨砂眼镜看世界。","28":"外出必须佩戴面纱。","38":"只能单臀坐着，不能双臀平放。","48":"只能在另一名忏悔者监督下才能入睡。","52":"食物必须先在醋中浸泡三十小时才能食用。","58":"永世不得躺卧。","62":"永世不得站直。","42":"以沉重铁链作腰带，脚踝各悬一球。","82":"只能阅读列车时刻表。","72":"只穿经过彻底漂白的衣物。","70":"每日洗浴七次、刷牙十四次，头发剃光并戴纸帽；饮食中不得包含蘑菇。"},"endurance_punishment":{"0":"被锁进伸手不见五指的箱子中。","10":"被活埋。","20":"全身被埋入沙中，只露出脑袋。","90":"正在阅读描绘尸体腐烂过程的图解手册。","80":"正聆听朗读，痛苦与感染瘟疫不相上下。","30":"正冥想虚无的本质。","70":"一动不动地坐着，凝视着一个空玻璃碗。","60":"按尸体的姿势躺在沙地上。","40":"正在听取关于坟墓中无意义苦楚的一系列讲座。","50":"正在誊写一份死亡人员登记表。"},"conversion_punishment":{"0":"衣物与资产被剥夺，被赋予全新姓名。","50":"舌头被锁，连上级的名字也不能说出。","80":"不断听闻有关派对的美妙故事，但永远不得受邀。","20":"在一间闷热的屋子里做激烈运动。","40":"每天都要听有关认清自己位置的重要性朗读。","70":"噩梦不断，梦中自己堕化为锚虫那样的低级生物。"},"excess_punishment":{"0":"被绑在宴席桌前，直到把所有食物吃光为止。","50":"被埋在一百本禁书之下，这些书都不能合法带入伦敦。","70":"被迫阅读《酒桶匠尊会未删史》，共十七卷。","90":"正在接受帕布拉数学证法的授课，内容来自不存在之地。","20":"被锁在一个堆满圣古斯拉克修女告解档案的小棚子里。","40":"获得一本蓝色王国入境礼仪指南。","60":"负责整理外野全境的所有未投递邮件。","30":"被要求誊写一本字典，收录的词汇在英文中猥琐下流、在其他语言中却含义神圣。","10":"收到一缸淡啤酒，必须全部喝完。","80":"被迫誊绘一座人类禁入的城市地图。","45":"被迫描摹蓝色王国服饰的线描图。","15":"被绑在旋转飞椅上，三天内不得落地。","25":"被迫戴上一副高倍放大镜，观察万物的大小细节。","55":"正在誊写候审囚犯的名单，其罪名已被审查删除。","35":"被迫手工调制一千罐黑墨与两千罐红墨。","75":"必须将文件分成十五堆，每堆对应一个审查缘由。","85":"正在勉强吞下一百一十五块杏仁蛋糕。","65":"被迫从头到尾大声朗读一本苍天上国词典。"},"inescapable_truth_punishment":{"0":"一丝不挂地站在一位毫无怜悯的肖像师前。","50":"被迫穿戴铁甲一整天。","70":"体内被植入第二副骨架。","80":"被迫逐字誊抄一堆百科全书，一有差错便要重头来过。","90":"被单独关押在花园一角的小间里。","60":"正在吞咽写满所有过去谎言的微型羊皮纸。","20":"穿着紧身衣，身体各个部位都涂以金墨。","30":"正在背诵国王的死讯、主教的出生与通谕的措辞。","40":"被锁在椅子上，面对一位心理咨询师，他不断提问，个个关于内心深处的欲望与深埋心底的创伤。","45":"被迫手抄《季刊》创刊以来的每一篇资讯文章。","55":"正与贪婪玫瑰花园的一位忏悔者交谈。你们两人神情都很痛苦。"}}

original: Airs of Clockwork
translation: 发条的时景

original: The gears grind on.
translation: 齿轮在转动。

original: {"0":"Time keeps on slipping..."}
translation: {"0":"时间在不断地流逝..."}

original: {"NewWinchester":{"1":"As you finish, a Dignified Gentleman of Leisure passes by, back from several months spent circumnavigating the known Wilderness. \"Have no fear, gentle Pasporto. When I made my grand wager, I was sure to factor in that New Winchester is typically a full day behind Albion time. We have-\" He looks up at the clock and falls to his knees. \"No!\" he screams. \"I am ruined!\"","3":"As you return from the clock, you pass an Usurious Landlord waving his chalk at a desperate family. \"Three of the clock, I said, and not a second later! Is it my fault that the clocks today are as reliable as your word? Humbug! To the poorhouse with the lot of you!\"","2":"As you finish, the Murderous Sort in the court looks up at the clock with a smug expression. \"Where was I at the time of the murders, mi'lud? Why, I will be right here, mi'lud. And so will all of you.\" By law, the alibi stands."},"PortAvon":{"1":"As you pass the small schoolhouse, a bored child slumps at an uncomfortable wooden desk. Just another ten minutes until freedom. Five minutes. But no. Suddenly the hands on the port clock begin turning backwards; the afternoon and the morning peeling away hour by hour. The Stern Schoolmistress raps her cane against the table. \"Enough! Back to the start of today's lesson...\"","2":"You return to the train past the now exhausted farmhand, earnestly trying to milk a cow that was milked only a few hours ago and is frankly little happier at the whole affair. He stifles a yawn just long enough to shoot you a foul look.","3":"You climb down from the clock into a bitter wedding argument. It appears that both bride and groom are already married - to each other. The paperwork does not lie! In shame, both families call the whole thing off, with the unlucky couple left to work out whether they are or not now living in sin."},"Magdelenes":{"1":"With the clock fixed, the business of the place ticks on. Once a treatment begins, time flows on its own schedule anyway, be clients distracted by the pleasure of massage, the pain of loss, or the confusion of seeing the Empress staring in horror at a mirror, rubbing her face as if in a desperate attempt to rub away something that has been fixed in place for just a little too long.","2":"The clock is fixed, though none pay it much attention. The clouds of hookah smoke emerging from the quieter rooms do more to toy with the passing of time than a crate of fresh Hours, never mind a little tinkering around with something as banal as a clock.","3":"Having fixed the clock, you hunt down the members of your crew who are enjoying the facilities. Most look relaxed and able, save for one who has to be carried back to the train on a stretcher. His face is locked in a rictus grin; still trembling, with eyes wide and requiring regular drops of salt-water to remain moisturised. His worried attendant refuses to divulge the precise nature of his requested treatment. It can however be assumed that he found the exact moment it became too much of a good thing."},"Brabazon":{"3":"You climb down from the clock, overhearing one of the overseers tell your guide, \"I'm sorry, but your indentured service was due to end on February 29th, and it appears, ah, that you missed it. Still, think how lucky you are to have a guaranteed job for the next four years!\"","1":"As you leave, your job complete, a small riot is breaking out. It would be larger, but most of the workers are too exhausted and in need of a little rest and recreation. Your adjustments should ensure their working conditions remain arduous rather than torturous, at least for a while.","2":"You leave to find the exhausted miner being wheeled away, twenty-three hours into what now shows on the paperwork as an eight hour shift. He is fined for not seeing it through to the end."},"Carillon":{"1":"Not far from the clock, you spy a diligent deviless checking on one of her charges. Their therapy and penance is listed as spending five minutes sealed in a mahogany box with a hundred and seventy seven spiders. Those five minutes are due to be over in... she checks... yes, another fourteen hours. Idly humming, she continues her rounds.","2":"The Presiding Deviless is waiting for you outside the clocktower, already dealing with a new set of prospective patients arriving before the previous penitents have parted. \"Order them all packed into the brimstone sauna,\" she tells an assistant. \"Then lock the door.\"","3":"You leave the clock as a strait-jacketed penitent is dragged kicking and protesting from the peace of the gardens to the screams of the dining hall. Through blistered lips, she protests she already ate a thousand nettles today. The devils ignore her obvious excuses. The lunch bell, they respect."},"Eagles":{"1":"Leaving the clock, you see the Khan's collectors arrive to demand the Embassy's taxes. \"But they were paid yesterday!\" protests the Ambassador. But as yesterday now no longer officially existed according to the Embassy's records, all paperwork to that effect is a clear forgery. He is dragged off by the guards to explain himself to the Khan.","3":"As you conclude your work, members of the Empyrean Foreign Office watch in quiet amusement as the Londoners scrabble to adjust. Later, they will see which contracts and deals with the Embassy can be most profitably broken. For now, however, the show is enough.","2":"As you finish your work, the Khan's enforcers are wasting no time tracking down London diplomats whose domicile rights have expired. The richest are welcomed to settle the matter with the currency of their choice. The rest soon find their visas claimed by the Eagle, and are deported on the first available trains with little but the clothes on their backs, and no thought given to the damage to the London Embassy's schedules."},"Worlebury":{"2":"Deep in the mists, the two lovers in their diving bell begin wondering exactly when it will be time to return to the surface. They have no way of knowing that the attendant above has clocked off, assuming his replacement will be there in minutes rather than the hours it will actually be. They tell each other not to worry and curl up happily in each others' arms, breathing each others' scent until they can no longer keep their eyes open.","1":"Miserable holiday-makers shuffle past you in a mood of gloom, their holidays abruptly ended and the real world calling again. You have not made any friends here today.","3":"You return to the pier to find guests who had been looking forward to celebrating the Festival of the Sea instead surrounded by half-painted decorations, bunting still in its crates, and tables laden with undercooked meats that ooze when pierced. Worlebury rumbles to the sounds of disappointment, displeasure, and later, intense food poisoning."},"Prosper":{"2":"As you return from your duties, a Windward Inspector is smiling unpleasantly at the Captain from Lustrum. \"Due this morning, these were. If you didn't want your kids starving, should've stuck to your schedule.\" He sucks happily on a boiled sweet. \"Shall we start the bribery at 20 per cent?\"","3":"Adjusting the clock back to Albion Standard Time proves the Windward Company's case. The mob is forced to admit that their hard work was merely an interesting statistical anomaly and disperses, grumbling, to talk of revolutions, walls, and who should be first against the latter once the former begins. Your name comes up more than once in this discussion.","1":"With the clock fixed, a team of cleaners begin scrubbing away the painted protests. They will no doubt be back again soon. Port Prosper is getting large enough to chafe against London's more arbitrary demands, especially ones as inconvenient as an Albion Standard Time that bears no relation to how the people here actually carry out their days."},"NatureReserve":{"1":"Glancing up, a well meaning apprentice sees that technically, the food for the animals has passed its date of best use. He ejects it all into space, not realising that the train carrying replacements is still working to Port Avon time and will not be with the Reserve for at least a couple of weeks. The animals begin baying for their dinner considerably sooner.","3":"Meanwhile, an apprentice finishes a survey and concludes, seeing the same counts doubled, that there are now twice as many animals in the Reserve's care as previously suspected. There is an immediate culling, to avoid over-population. Later, realisation puts a real pall on what is otherwise a quite splendid banquet.","2":"Out in the reserve, the researchers begin making all sorts of discoveries. A whole family of apparently diurnal owls, for instance. A badger set that can be observed without having to stay up all night in a damp ditch watching badgers conspicuously not doing anything everyone isn't already quite aware that badgers do. \n\nThe mood is quite positive, until someone points out that the animals probably haven't taken note of the recent time change. Torn up notes and aborted monographs flutter from the edges of the reserve."},"PortAvonIntro":{"3":"Wedding bells ring out over Port Avon. The clocks are running fast, not that the happy couple walking towards the church cares.","2":"\"You here for the clocks?\" The tired looking farmhand rolls his eyes at you. \"Couldn't you have been here sooner? Could've had me another couple of hours in bed.\"","1":"The port's clock is running eight hours fast. That makes for a whole day's work that, technically, shouldn't have happened."},"MagdalenesIntro":{"1":"The clocks here all run slightly fast. Clients rarely notice, but over the course of a day it works out to an extra hour's break for their attendants.","2":"Time is running slow here, though that could be the sleepy atmosphere as much as banal matters of clockwork.","3":"The clocks are running fast. Fixing them would be a several hour long boon for anyone in the more pleasant treatments."},"CarillonIntro":{"3":"The Presiding Deviless almost registers an emotion at your presence. \"Do be quick about your business. Our clientele have suffered enough. Some of them. Others, insufficiently.\"","2":"The clock is running fast. One of the clients spots you looking at it and grabs your arm. \"No,\" she begs, before being dragged away by a pair of expressionless nurses. \"No more, please!\"","1":"Devils have an infamously loose relationship with conventional time. At Carillon, however, they pay it grudging lip-service."},"BrabazonIntro":{"2":"The clock is fast. Sabotage. Someone has wound it ahead. The culprit soon reveals himself as an exhausted miner. \"Please, I've done two shifts already,\" he whispers. \"I got to sleep sometime, right?\"","1":"The overseers look awkward as you approach the clock. By your estimation, they've been slowing them down to extend workers' shifts. Fixing that would give the workers a much needed break.","3":"Your guide is a cheerful fellow, oblivious to the fact that the clock is a week slow. \"It's my last day here,\" he tells you. \"Tomorrow, I go back to London. First thing I'm doing, getting a big steak.\" "},"EaglesIntro":{"3":"Officially, Albion Standard Time doesn't exist in the Empyrean. In the Embassy, however, the clocks still run slow.","1":"The clocks in London's Embassy are running slow, though it matters little to most of the port. The Eagle has no interest in Albion Standard Time, but it's playing merry hell with the London Ambassador's timekeeping.","2":"The staff at the London Embassy look worried at your arrival. Today is the start of the new Empyrean tax year, and their clocks are running slow."},"WorleburyIntro":{"1":"Happy holiday-makers flock past you as you approach the clock, unaware that you fixing it would cut their revelry short.","2":"The clocks on the pier are running a few hours slow. \"Explore the mists! Trip of a lifetime!\" calls a diving bell attendant, one eye fixed on the slow tick of the minutes hand.","3":"Festival preparations are in full swing. A glance up at the clock tells you at once that they had better speed up. The three days they think they have left is closer to three hours."},"ProsperIntro":{"3":"A mob has gathered outside the Windward Company, protesting unpaid wages for the last week. The Company's representative assures them that officially, last week never happened.","2":"The clocks are running several hours slow, much to the relief of a fellow Captain with a shipment of Hours from Lustrum. \"Thought I was going to be late again,\" he tells you, quickly unloading his cargo.","1":"The central port clock is fast. It has also been vandalised by protesters against Albion Standard Time. \"NO TIME LIKE THE PRESENT\" has been scrawled over the clockface."},"NatureReserveIntro":{"1":"There is only one clock here, and everything runs by it. It is poorly maintained, often leaving the Reserve days off from Albion Standard Time.","2":"The researchers look up at the clock, running fast. They beg you to hurry up. Their statistics rely on proper timekeeping.","3":"The researchers are busy in a meeting, leaving their apprentices to handle Reserve business. One offers to show you to the clock."},"NewWinchesterIntro":{"1":"The clocks are running slow here. A whole day, by your quick calculation. Still, it should be a small inconvenience for most.","2":"The clock is next to the courthouse, where a Murderous Sort is in the dock before Judge 'Hang All The Filthy _______' Stacks. They have blood on their clothes and no alibi.","3":"The clocks are running slow. \"Please, not yet,\" whispers a nervous tenant. \"I still have to pay this month's rent! My landlord...\""}}
translation: {"NewWinchester":{"1":"当你检查完时钟，一位从外野已勘明区域的数月环游之旅中归来的悠闲绅士从你身边路过。\"别害怕，温柔的帕斯波托。我大赌特赌时，当然考虑到了新温彻斯特的时间通常比阿尔比恩晚上一整天。我们有——\"他抬头看了看钟，然后吓得跪倒在地。\"不！\"他惊叫道，\"我完蛋了！\"","3":"当你检查完时钟，你与一个放高利贷的房东擦肩而过，他正冲着一家绝望的人挥舞着粉笔。\"我说过，三点整，一秒钟也不多等！今天的表就和你那时的话一样信不过，但这是我的错吗？满嘴谎话！你们这帮人都给我滚去救济院吧！\"","2":"当你检查完时钟，法庭上的凶手抬头看着钟，脸上露出得意的表情。\"法官大人，谋杀案发生时我人在哪儿？看看表吧，等谋杀案发生时，我就待在这里，法官大人，和你们待在一起。\"根据法律，不在场证明成立了。"},"PortAvon":{"1":"当你走过一所小学校时，一个百无聊赖的孩子瘫坐在一张硬邦邦的木桌旁。再过十分钟就要下课了，再过五分钟就好了，但是最终没有下课。突然，车站时钟的指针开始逆时针旋转，时间倒退了一个又一个小时，从下午回到了早上。严厉的女校长用手杖敲着桌子。\"安静！回到今天的课刚开始的地方……\"","2":"你返回火车时，与一个筋疲力尽的农场工人擦肩而过，他正认真地尝试给一头几个小时前才挤过的奶牛再次挤奶，看起来他对工作有点烦。他忍住了哈欠，随后狠狠地瞪了你一眼。","3":"你从时钟上下来时，正好赶上一场激烈的婚礼争论。原来新郎新娘竟早已结为夫妻，合法的配偶正是彼此！结婚文件白纸黑字，铁证如山。双方家族羞愧难当，取消了重婚婚礼，只留下这对倒霉的夫妇苦思冥想：如今的他们，是否正生活在不伦之中？"},"Magdelenes":{"1":"随着时钟的修复，这里的业务也开始恢复正常。 一旦治疗开始，时间便按照自己的节奏流淌——无论是顾客沉醉于按摩的愉悦，沉浸于失去的痛苦，还是因目睹女皇惊恐地凝视镜中自己、用力揉搓脸庞，仿佛拼命想要抹去某种停留得过久的痕迹而困惑不已。","2":"时钟被修复了，尽管无人会对此多加留意。 从静谧房间中飘出的水烟雾气，比一箱新挖出的时间矿更能戏弄时间的流逝，更不用说在一座普通时钟上那点微不足道的修修补补了。","3":"修复时钟后，你开始寻找那些正在享受这里设施的列车员。他们大多看上去放松而精神，唯独一人不得不被抬上担架送回列车。他脸上凝固着一抹僵硬的笑，身体仍在微微颤抖，双眼圆睁，需要定期滴盐水来保持湿润。他身旁那位忧心忡忡的侍者拒绝透露他所接受治疗的具体内容。然而，可以想见，他恰好找到了那个“幸福过了头”的瞬间。"},"Brabazon":{"3":"你从时钟上爬下来，恰巧听到一位监督者对你的向导说道：\"很抱歉，但你的契约劳役本应在2月29日结束，而看来，呃，你错过了那个日子。 不过想想吧，你多幸运啊！接下来的四年里，你至少有一份稳定的工作！\"","1":"当你完成工作离开时，一场小规模的骚乱正在爆发。若非大多数工人已疲惫不堪，急需些许休息与消遣，动乱本可能更为激烈。你的调整应该能确保在一段时间内，他们的工作强度能被称作艰苦，而非全然折磨的程度。","2":"你离开时，看到有人推走了一名筋疲力尽的矿工。此刻他的工时已达二十三个小时，而在文件上却只被记录为八小时的轮班。由于未能坚持到“正式”结束，他受到了罚款。"},"Carillon":{"1":"离时钟不远处，你瞥见一位勤勉的女魔鬼正在检查她的一名受托者。对方的疗程与忏悔方式被记录为：在一口红木箱中，与一百七十七只蜘蛛共处五分钟。而这五分钟预计将在——她看了看钟——没错，再过十四个小时才会结束。她随口哼着小调，继续巡查着其他人。","2":"女魔鬼主管正在钟楼外等你，还没等上一批忏悔者离开，她便已经开始处理新来的一批潜在病人。\"把他们都塞进硫磺桑拿房，\" 她对一名侍者吩咐道，\"然后把门锁上。\"","3":"你离开时钟时，一位身穿紧身衣的忏悔者被拖着从宁静的花园走到餐厅，她刚开始一边踢腿一边抗议，到最后就变成了尖叫。她嘴唇起泡，辩称说自己今天已经吃了一千颗荨麻。魔鬼们无视了她明显无比的借口。他们唯一尊重的是午餐的铃声。"},"Eagles":{"1":"离开时钟，你看到汗国的收税员前来要求大使馆缴税。\"但他们昨天已经付过了！\"大使抗议道。但鉴于大使馆的记录里根本找不到昨天那一天，所有的相关文件显然都是伪造的。他被卫兵拖去向可汗解释这一切。","3":"当你完成工作时，苍天上国外交部的成员们静静地、饶有兴致地看着伦敦人努力适应校正后的时间。随后，他们会找出解除与大使馆的哪些合同和交易最有利可图。然而，就目前而言，品鉴眼前的场面就足够让他们满足了。","2":"当你完成工作时，汗国的执法者毫不犹豫地开始追捕居住权已过期的伦敦外交官。最富有的那些人可以用金钱来摆平此事。其余的人很快发现他们的签证已被雄鹰汗收回，只能带着身上的衣物，乘坐最近一班火车驱逐出境，连伦敦大使馆日程的影响也顾不上了。"},"Worlebury":{"2":"在浓雾深处，坐在潜水钟里的两位恋人开始琢磨，究竟何时才是回到水面的时刻。他们浑然不知，上方的随行者已经下班，误以为他的替代者会在几分钟内到达，但实际上还需要几个小时。两人相互安慰着不要担心，幸福地依偎在一起，直到彼此的气息交织，直到再也无法睁开眼睛。","1":"一群沮丧的度假者愁眉苦脸地从你身边走过，他们的假期突然结束，现实再次向他们招手。在这一天，你在这里没有交到任何朋友。","3":"你回到码头，发现原本期待庆祝海洋节的宾客们此时却被四处凌乱的半成品装饰、仍在箱子里的彩旗，以及满桌未熟透的肉类围绕着，那些肉在被刺破时还会渗出奇怪汁液。沃伯瑞到处都是失望与不满的抱怨声，这些声音过了一会就变成了严重食物中毒的呻吟。"},"Prosper":{"2":"当你完成任务返回时，一名迎风公司的检察官正带着不怀好意的笑容看着来自伍载镇的车长。\"这些货物今早就该送到了。如果不想让你的孩子挨饿，你本该按时送达。\"他自得地含着一颗糖果。\"咱们的贿赂就从20%开始谈起吧？\"","3":"将时钟调整回阿尔比恩标准时间后，你正好证实了迎风公司的说法。暴动的人群被迫承认，他们的辛勤工作不过是一个有趣的统计异常。他们随后在不满中散去，转而讨论起革命、围墙，以及一旦前者开始，谁应该第一个被推到后者的前面。在这场讨论中，你的名字不止一次被提及。","1":"随着时钟的修复，一队清洁工开始擦洗那些涂在各处的抗议标语。毫无疑问的是，它们很快就会再次出现。兴荣港的规模正在不断变大，它已逐渐对伦敦那些武断的要求感到不满，尤其是像阿尔比恩标准时间这样的规定——它与这里人们的实际作息毫无关系，反而带来了诸多不便。"},"NatureReserve":{"1":"一名好心的学徒抬头瞥了一眼，发现从技术上讲，动物的饲料已经过了最佳食用期。于是，他毫不犹豫地将其全部抛入太空，丝毫没有意识到运送替代饲料的列车仍按照埃文港时间行驶，至少还要几周才能抵达保护区。动物们在比预想早得多的时间便开始嚎叫，索要它们的晚餐。","3":"与此同时，另一名学徒完成了一项调查，发现统计数据中出现了重复，将保护区内的动物数量多计算了一倍。为了防止过度繁殖，此处立即开展了一场大规模捕杀。后来，当真相大白时，原本盛大丰盛的宴会顿时蒙上了一层阴影。","2":"在保护区内，研究人员开始陆续发现各种奇妙的现象。比如，一族似乎是昼行性的猫头鹰。又比如，一群獾，它们的巢穴可以在白天轻松观察，而无需研究员整夜蜷缩在潮湿的沟渠里，只为目睹獾做一些大家早已知道它们会做的事情。\n\n场面一度令人十分振奋，直到有人指出，这些动物大概并未注意到最近的时间变更。随即，被撕碎的笔记和被放弃的论文草稿如落叶般从保护区的边缘飘散开来。"},"PortAvonIntro":{"3":"婚礼的钟声在埃文港回荡。时钟走得比正常快，但正缓步走向教堂的新人对此毫不在意。","2":"\"你是来修时钟的？\"一名满脸倦意的农场工对你翻了个白眼，\"你就不能早点来吗？我本可以多睡上几个小时。\"","1":"港口的时钟快了八个小时。 这意味着从技术上讲，有整整一天的工作原本就不该有人去做。"},"MagdalenesIntro":{"1":"这里的时钟全都略微快了一些。顾客们很少察觉，但一天下来，这些微小的时间偏差最终为侍者们争取到额外一小时的休息时间。","2":"这里的时间走得很慢，尽管着有可能是因为此处让人昏昏欲睡的环境，而非平常的机械问题。","3":"时钟走快了。修正它们会给接受较愉悦治疗手段的病人带来几小时的额外享受。"},"CarillonIntro":{"3":"女魔鬼主管的铁面在见到你时几乎显现出一种不满的神情。\"请尽快把它修好。我们这里的某些顾客已经受了足够的折磨，另外一些则受的还不够多。\"","2":"时钟走快了。一名顾客注意到你在检查它，立刻抓住你的手臂。\"别，\" 她哀求道，随后便被两名面无表情的护士拖走，\"求你了，别再来了！\"","1":"魔鬼与常规时间的关系素来松散得声名狼藉。然而，在钟琴区他们却勉强对时间表露出些许尊重。"},"BrabazonIntro":{"2":"时钟被调快了。人为破坏。有人在故意把它往前拨。罪魁祸首很快败露——是一名筋疲力尽的矿工。\"求你了，我已经连上了两班，\"他虚弱地说，\"总得让我睡会儿吧，对吗？\"","1":"当你走近时，监督者们显得有些不自在。根据你的判断，他们一直在故意放慢时钟的速度，以延长工人的工时。修复时钟会让工人们得到一次急需的休息。","3":"你的向导是个性格开朗的家伙，丝毫没有意识到时钟已经慢了整整一周。\"今天是我在这儿的最后一天，\"他兴奋地告诉你，\"明天我就回伦敦了！我回去第一件事就是去吃一大块牛排。\""},"EaglesIntro":{"3":"从官方上讲，阿尔比恩标准时间在上国境内并不存在。然而，在大使馆内，仍然能说这里的时钟走慢了。","1":"伦敦大使馆的时钟慢了，不过对港口的大多数人来说，这无关紧要。雄鹰汗对阿尔比恩标准时间毫无兴趣，但这却彻底搅乱了伦敦大使的时间安排。","2":"当你抵达伦敦大使馆时，那里的工作人员们神色紧张。今天是上国新税年的开始，而他们的时钟却走慢了。"},"WorleburyIntro":{"1":"当你走近时钟时，欢快的度假者们成群结队地从你身边经过，浑然不知在你修好时钟后，他们的狂欢将提前结束。","2":"码头的时钟慢了几个小时。\"探寻迷雾！一生难忘的旅程！\"一名潜水钟的工作人员喊道，一只眼睛紧盯着缓慢移动的分针。","3":"节日的筹备工作正如火如荼地进行着。你抬头看了眼时钟，马上意识到他们应该加快速度——他们以为还剩三天，实际上只剩下不到三小时。"},"ProsperIntro":{"3":"一群愤怒的工人聚集在迎风公司门外，抗议他们上周的工资尚未发放。而公司的代表则信誓旦旦地向他们宣称——从官方记录来看，上周根本不存在。","2":"一位从伍载镇运送时间矿的车长对着慢了几个小时的时钟松了口气。\"还以为又要迟到了，\"他对你说道，同时迅速地卸下车上货物。","1":"中心港口的时钟走得过快，而且还被抗议阿尔比恩标准时间的示威者破坏了。钟面上潦草地写着：\"什 么 时 间 都 不 如 当 下 的 时 间\"。"},"NatureReserveIntro":{"1":"这里只有一座时钟，一切活动都仰仗它进行。由于维护不善，保护区的时间经常与阿尔比恩标准时间存在数天的差错。","2":"研究员们抬头望向那走得过快的时钟，恳求你快点修好它。他们的统计数据全都依赖于准确的时间记录。","3":"研究员们正忙着开会，于是由他们的学徒负责处理保护区的事务。其中一人主动提出带你查看时钟。"},"NewWinchesterIntro":{"1":"这里的时钟走慢了。根据你的快速计算，慢了有整整一天的时间。不过，对大多数人来说，这应该只是个小小的不便。","2":"时钟建在一所法院的旁边，在那里一个看上去像是杀人犯的人正站在被告席上，面对着那位号称‘绞死所有肮脏的______’的斯塔克斯法官的审判。那人的衣服上沾了血，并且没有不在场证明。","3":"时钟走慢了。\"请别现在就修好它，\"一位紧张的租户低声说道，\"我还没交这个月的房租！我的房东……\""}}

original: Airs of Crossroads
translation: 十字路的时景

original: Your worth will be measured. So will your debts.
translation: 你的价值将被衡量。你的债务亦然。

original: {"Identity":{"0":"Mistress Fathom","20":"Mistress Poppyseed","40":"Mistress Grain","60":"Mistress Perch","80":"Mistress Drachm"},"DealAccepted":{"0":"\"How splendid,\" declares Mistress Fathom. \"Something you need, in exchange for something that I may one day want.\" ","40":"Whatever hides behind Mistress Grain's veil chitters in appreciation. \"Good, good. Our deal is struck. Be ready to repay it.\"","80":"Mistress Drachm does not speak, but produces a lengthy contract. Only after signing do you notice the smallest print hidden in the letterhead, stating that you are not agreeing to charity, but a loan.","20":"Mistress Poppyseed grips your hand with a sharp, insectoid claw. \"How you do this. Yes? Good. Deal made. Will collect debt in time.\"","60":"Mistress Perch extends a leg from under its skirt, curling it around your hand to seal the deal. \"I have taken your measure. Repay me when I demand or I will take more.\""}}
translation: {"Identity":{"0":"英寻太太","20":"罂粟籽太太","40":"谷粒太太","60":"栖木太太","80":"打兰太太"},"DealAccepted":{"0":"\"太好了，\"英寻太太大声地说，\"你所需之物，与我未来可能索求之物，交换成立。\"","40":"谷粒太太面纱后的某个部位发出咔嗒声，似在表示赞许。\"很好，很好。交易达成。作好偿还的准备。\"","80":"打兰太太一言不发，只是拿出了一份冗长的契约。签字后，你才注意到信头隐藏的极小字体，声明你接受的并非施舍，而是一笔贷款。","20":"罂粟籽太太用锐利的虫爪握住你的手。\"你会做到的，对吧？很好。交易已定。债务会在适当的时候收取。\"","60":"栖木太太从裙下伸出一条腿，缠绕住你的手，以此缔结契约。\"我已衡量你的分量。待我索求时偿还，否则，我将索取更多。\""}}

original: Airs of Dog
translation: 狗的时景

original: Airs of Donkey
translation: 驴子的时景

original: {"Donkey":{"0":"You enjoy a pleasant donkey-ride along the shore. The rolling motion of the beast's four unequal legs is soothing, and the complimentary earplugs block out all but their most shrill hunting-screams.","20":"It takes you a minute but you eventually adapt to your donkey's stilted gait. Halfway through the experience, the beast shucks its limbs, begins undulating smoothly instead along the sand. How fortunate!","30":"Your donkey today is uncommonly skittish, spooking at every sound, but at least its distended belly makes for a cushioned ride. If only it could move faster than a crawl.","90":"Thanks to your donkey's multitude of taloned legs, you find yourself enjoying an unusually scenic ride along the shore. Who knew that donkeys were such expert climbers?","75":"The donkey you've been assigned is petite and even-tempered, its heads mostly well-formed. Pity about the one that had failed to correctly bud. It drags along the sand, its flesh in ribbons.","45":"What an unpleasant ride. No matter how many sugar cubes you sacrifice to its appetites, your donkey insists on remaining truculent. You can't even make faces at it. Not even with its watchful halo of glittering insect eyes.","10":"This donkey-ride is more momentous than others. The herd spots something small and broken-backed on the shore. With a scream, they lurch towards their prey, leaving you to cling for dear life. On the bright side, at least they're quick about the kill.","1":"You enjoy a pleasant donkey-ride along the shore. The rolling motion of the beast's four unequal legs is soothing, and the complimentary earplugs block out all but their most shrill hunting-screams.","100":"You enjoy a pleasant donkey-ride along the shore. The rolling motion of the beast's four unequal legs is soothing, and the complimentary earplugs block out all but their most shrill hunting-screams.","110":"This donkey-ride is more momentous than others. The herd spots something small and broken-backed on the shore. With a scream, they lurch towards their prey, leaving you to cling for dear life. On the bright side, at least they're quick about the kill.","120":"It takes you a minute but you eventually adapt to your donkey's stilted gait. Halfway through the experience, the beast shucks its limbs, begins undulating smoothly instead along the sand. How fortunate!","130":"Your donkey today is uncommonly skittish, spooking at every sound, but at least its distended belly makes for a cushioned ride. If only it could move faster than a crawl.","145":"What an unpleasant ride. No matter how many sugar cubes you sacrifice to its appetites, your donkey insists on remaining truculent. You can't even make faces at it. Not even with its watchful halo of glittering insect eyes.","175":"The donkey you've been assigned is petite and even-tempered, its heads mostly well-formed. Pity about the one that had failed to correctly bud. It drags along the sand, its flesh in ribbons.","190":"Thanks to your donkey's multitude of taloned legs, you find yourself enjoying an unusually scenic ride along the shore. Who knew that donkeys were such expert climbers?","200":"You enjoy a pleasant donkey-ride along the shore. The rolling motion of the beast's four unequal legs is soothing, and the complimentary earplugs block out all but their most shrill hunting-screams.","60":"What an unpleasant ride. No matter how many sugar cubes you sacrifice to its appetites, your donkey insists on remaining truculent. You can't even make faces at it while it's not looking. Not with its watchful halo of glittering insect eyes.","160":"What an unpleasant ride. No matter how many sugar cubes you sacrifice to its appetites, your donkey insists on remaining truculent. You can't even make faces at it while it's not looking. Not with its watchful halo of glittering insect eyes."}}
translation: {"Donkey":{"0":"你享受着沿着海岸骑驴的乐趣。这头野兽的四条不一样长的腿舒缓地划着圈。赠送的耳塞阻挡了所有声音，除了它们最尖锐的狩猎尖叫声。","20":"你花了一分钟，但最终适应了驴子的僵硬步态。在走过一半路程的时候，这头野兽收起了它的四肢，开始在沙地上平稳地滑动前进。多么幸运啊！","30":"你的驴子今天异常胆小，一听到声音就会惊慌失措，但至少它膨胀的腹部给骑行提供了缓冲。如果它能走得比爬行的速度更快就好了。","90":"多亏了你的驴子长着的许多带爪子的腿，你发现自己正享受着一段非同寻常的海岸骑行之旅。谁知道驴子是这样的登山专家？","75":"你分到的驴子身材娇小，脾气平和，头的大部分区域形状良好。可惜了那个没能正确发芽的。它正在沙地上拖行，身上的肉像丝带一样。","45":"真是一段不愉快的旅程。无论你为了满足它的胃口而牺牲多少块方糖，你的驴子都坚持保持凶猛。你甚至不能对它做鬼脸。甚至在它那一圈闪亮的昆虫眼睛的监视下也不行。","10":"这次骑驴之旅比别的那几次更有意义。驴群在岸边发现了一些小小的，背部断裂的东西。随着一声尖叫，它们向猎物冲去，你只能紧紧抓住身下的驴子不放。从好的方面看，至少它们对杀戮反应很快。","1":"你享受着沿着海岸骑驴的乐趣。这头野兽的四条不一样长的腿舒缓地划着圈。赠送的耳塞阻挡了所有声音，除了它们最尖锐的狩猎尖叫声。","100":"你享受着沿着海岸骑驴的乐趣。这头野兽的四条不一样长的腿舒缓地划着圈。赠送的耳塞阻挡了所有声音，除了它们最尖锐的狩猎尖叫声。","110":"这次骑驴之旅比别的那几次更有意义。驴群在岸边发现了一些小小的，背部断裂的东西。随着一声尖叫，它们向猎物冲去，你只能紧紧抓住身下的驴子不放。从好的方面看，至少它们对杀戮反应很快。","120":"你花了一分钟，但最终适应了驴子的僵硬步态。在走过一半路程的时候，这头野兽收起了它的四肢，开始在沙地上平稳地滑动前进。多么幸运啊！","130":"你的驴子今天异常胆小，一听到声音就会惊慌失措，但至少它膨胀的腹部给骑行提供了缓冲。如果它能走得比爬行的速度更快就好了。","145":"真是一段不愉快的旅程。无论你为了满足它的胃口而牺牲多少块方糖，你的驴子都坚持保持凶猛。你甚至不能对它做鬼脸。甚至在它那一圈闪亮的昆虫眼睛的监视下也不行。","175":"你分到的驴子身材娇小，脾气平和，头的大部分区域形状良好。可惜了那个没能正确发芽的。它正在沙地上拖行，身上的肉像丝带一样。","190":"多亏了你的驴子长着的许多带爪子的腿，你发现自己正享受着一段非同寻常的海岸骑行之旅。谁知道驴子是这样的登山专家？","200":"你享受着沿着海岸骑驴的乐趣。这头野兽的四条不一样长的腿舒缓地划着圈。赠送的耳塞阻挡了所有声音，除了它们最尖锐的狩猎尖叫声。","60":"真是一段不愉快的旅程。无论你为了满足它的胃口而牺牲多少块方糖，你的驴子都坚持保持凶猛。你甚至不能对它做鬼脸。甚至在它那一圈闪亮的昆虫眼睛的监视下也不行。","160":"真是一段不愉快的旅程。无论你为了满足它的胃口而牺牲多少块方糖，你的驴子都坚持保持凶猛。你甚至不能对它做鬼脸。甚至在它那一圈闪亮的昆虫眼睛的监视下也不行。"}}

original: Airs of Dousers
translation: 熄光者的时景

original: Airs of Grievers
translation: 哀恸者的时景

original: Airs of Guests
translation: 寄客虫的时景

original: {"Find":{"67":"A shriek in the night. A crewman was awoken by a Guest crawling like an inquisitive slug into his bunk. It was after the locket he keeps around his neck, which holds a picture of his children. ","0":"A commotion in the cabins! A stoker has discovered a creature wrapped affectionately around his Toby jug (a gift from his aunt). The creature is as long as your arm, and looks like a leech bred with an eel. It is one of the Guests.","34":"You have Guests. A distressed engineer found one of the creatures coiled in the lockbox where she keeps her letters from home. It has since wriggled into some hidden cranny. It could be anywhere."}}
translation: {"Find":{"67":"夜间尖叫。一个过分好奇的蛞蝓一样的寄客虫爬进了一名列车员的铺位，吵醒了他。就为了他脖子上的吊坠，里面有他孩子们的照片。","0":"车厢里的骚乱！”一名司炉发现一只被他的托比酒壶(他姨妈送他的礼物)深情地包裹的生物。这种生物和你的手臂一样长，看起来像水蛭和鳗鱼杂交的产物。它是一只寄客虫。","34":"你有寄客虫。一位悲痛的工程师在她存放家信的锁箱里发现了一只盘踞其中的生物。从那以后，它就钻进了某个隐藏的缝隙。它可能在任何地方。"}}

original: Airs of Langley Hall
