original: Ambition: The Martyr-King's Cup
translation: 野心：殉道王圣杯

original: You will find the unfindable, even if it means breaking the sky in two.
translation: 你定将觅得那寻无可寻之物，哪怕撕裂天空也在所不惜。

original: {"5":"Return to the Unseen Queen and present her with the Minute to Midnight.","6":"Prove yourself worthy of finding the Cup","7":"Meet the Grey Conformer in Piranesi and ask her for the true location of the Cup.","9":"Return to the Unseen Queen in London and relay what the Conformer told you.","10":"Return to the Unseen Queen in London in 15 days and win the Grand Tournament.","11":"You won the Grand Tournament.","100":"You have failed the quest for the Martyr-King's Cup. Perhaps a more worthy quester will take up your mantle one day.","50":"You found the Martyr-King's Cup and achieved a form of immortality, living forever as a knight within the endless Golden Day.","60":"You found the Martyr-King's Cup and achieved a form of immortality, taking all the Hours of the eternal Golden Day and adding them to your lifespan. You will thunder across the skies until the end of time itself.","70":"You found the Martyr-King's Cup and helped the Unseen Queen rise again from the ashes of her father. You chose not to achieve immortality, but the Queen has promised immortality for us all, one day.","4":"Travel to the Brabazon Workworld and claim the Dismal Chamberlain's sword as your own.","12":"Return in two weeks, when the Minutes to Midnight will have been reforged as one.","15":"Return to the Unseen Queen in London with the final Minute to Midnight.","16":"Defeat three different kinds of Logoi in the Blue Kingdom and recover a vestige of their flames.","17":"Head to the Shadow of the Sun, in Death's Door, and break into the Arbiter's vault to finally retrieve the Martyr-King's Cup.","18":"The Minute to Midnight has kept you safe. Now steal the Martyr-King's cup from the vault.","19":"Abscond!","20":"Once you are safely back on your locomotive, talk to the Unseen Queen.","21":"Hunt down either the Dismal Chamberlain (last seen in Brabazon) or the Final Champion (last seen in London).","22":"You must travel to the Storm That Speaks and have a dying quester speak the words that killed him.","23":"Wait for the ritual to take effect.","30":"You killed the Unseen Queen in the moment of her triumph.","1":"Collect your inheritance from your predecessor at one of three major ports (New Winchester, London or Pan).","2":"Collect 5 Sky-Stories in order to decipher the Chamberlain's Journal.","3":"Search for the Unseen Queen in the world beneath London.","8":"The Grey Conformer wishes to receive either a Captivating Treasure or 5 Casks of Navaratine Gemstones before she will divulge the Cup's location.","24":"The Storm That Speaks is dying. You must make a decision.","13":"Gather 1 Cryptic Benefactor and 500 Sovereigns and head to London to arrange matters for your upcoming heist at the Tower of Chimes.","14":"Steal the minute hand from the Tower of Chimes, near the Floating Parliament in Albion."}
translation: {"5":"回访无形女王并向她展示午夜来临之刻。","6":"证明你自己有资格去寻找圣杯","7":"在皮拉内西与灰暗的顺应者碰面并询问她圣杯所处的真正地点。","9":"回访身处伦敦的无形女王，传达灰暗的顺应者与你所说的一切。","10":"在十五天内回访无形女王并在大骑士会武中拔得头筹。","11":"你已在大骑士会武中获胜。","100":"你已在殉道王圣杯的寻求中落败。或许某一天会有一位更具能力的探寻者继承你的衣钵。","50":"你已寻获殉道王圣杯，并达成了某种形式的永生。好似一位永远生活在辉金白昼的骑士。","60":"你已寻获殉道王圣杯，并达成了某种形式的永生。攫取辉金白昼中的所有时辰并将它们化为你寿命的一部分后，你将如雷霆般轰鸣于天穹之上直至时间尽头。","70":"你已寻获殉道王圣杯，并帮助无形女王从他父亲留下的灰烬中崛起。你放弃了永生，但女王承诺总有一天会为我们寻得永恒。","4":"前往布拉巴宗工作世界并认领阴沉宫廷内侍的剑。","12":"两周后，午夜来临之刻重铸为一的时候返回。","15":"带上最终的午夜来临之刻回访身处伦敦的无形女王。","16":"在蓝色王国战胜三种圣言并收回他们的残焰。","17":"前往日影殿，迈入死亡之门，闯入仲裁员的宝库，取回殉道王的圣杯。","18":"午夜来临之刻会确保你的安全。现在你可以从宝库中窃取殉道王的圣杯。","19":"速速潜逃！","20":"当你安全回到机车上后，与无形女王交谈。","21":"寻找阴沉的宫廷内侍（最近一次出现于布拉巴宗）或成为大骑士会武的冠军（上一次举办于伦敦）。","22":"你必须前往言语之风暴神所在之处，并让一位垂死的探寻者说出能杀死他的话语。","23":"等到仪式生效。","30":"你在无形女王即将胜利之时杀害了她。","1":"在三大主车站（新温彻斯特，伦敦，潘城）之一的某处收集你前任的遗产。","2":"收集五个高天轶事以破解阴沉的宫廷内侍的日记","3":"在伦敦的地下世界找寻无形女王。","8":"灰暗的顺应者在透露圣杯的真正位置前希望收到一个迷人的财宝或五箱曩縛咤宝石","24":"言语之风暴神渐渐死去，你必须做出选择。","13":"收集一份隐秘的人脉和500金镑，用以前往伦敦筹划即将在泰晤士塔进行的盗窃。","14":"窃取在阿尔比恩的浮空议会旁的泰晤士塔的分针。"}

original:
{"cup_description":{"0":"","15":"The faded portrait of the Unseen Queen now hangs in the corridor just outside your quarters. The crew still don't quite understand your ambitions, and resent the portrait for both suspicious and superstitious reasons.

"What do you have to tell me?" asks the Queen sharply as you approach. You suspect she misses her moonlit court.","16":"The faded portrait of the Unseen Queen now hangs in the corridor just outside your quarters. The crew still don't quite understand your ambitions, and resent the portrait for both suspicious and superstitious reasons.

"What do you have to tell me?" asks the Queen sharply as you approach. You suspect she misses her moonlit court.","17":"The faded portrait of the Unseen Queen now hangs in the corridor just outside your quarters. The crew still don't quite understand your ambitions, and resent the portrait for both suspicious and superstitious reasons.

"What do you have to tell me?" asks the Queen sharply as you approach. You suspect she misses her moonlit court.","18":"The faded portrait of the Unseen Queen now hangs in the corridor just outside your quarters. The crew still don't quite understand your ambitions, and resent the portrait for both suspicious and superstitious reasons.

"What do you have to tell me?" asks the Queen sharply as you approach. You suspect she misses her moonlit court.","19":"The faded portrait of the Unseen Queen still hangs in the corridor just outside your quarters. 

She is now depicted holding a stone goblet in one elegant hand. Her face, as ever, is scratched beyond recognition.","20":"The faded portrait of the Unseen Queen still hangs in the corridor just outside your quarters. 

She is now depicted holding a stone goblet in one elegant hand. Her face, as ever, is scratched beyond recognition.","21":"The faded portrait of the Unseen Queen still hangs in the corridor just outside your quarters. 

She is now depicted holding a stone goblet in one elegant hand. Her face, as ever, is scratched beyond recognition."},"drinking_from_the_cup":{"0":"","22":""Are you ready to experience the last moments of my father?" asks the Unseen Queen. 

Your chosen vessel nods solemnly, approaching the Cup. Tendrils of light dance across their brow.","23":"As the poisoned words take effect, the souls within the Cup whirl faster. A pillar of lightning roars from the Cup and cuts the sky in two.

Too late, the Storm That Speaks takes notice of you. Too late, the voices on the wind start to shriek.

The Queen takes a step forward (now fully escaped from her frame). "You erased me from time, father. But not thoroughly enough. A vestige remained. A painting."","24":"The Storm falls ominously quiet. 

"I promised that after you found the Cup you would have immortality," says the Unseen Queen. She is a giantess now, with quicksilver skin. "I didn't say how soon.

"First, of course, I will have to destroy the Blue Kingdom and usurp the throne of the Sapphir'd King. When I have done so, your entire species will be immortal. That is my promise."","30":"The Queen stares down at you in horror. The moon vanishes from the sky, and you find yourself back beneath the gathering storm.

"Why – why would you—" The Unseen Queen is fading. The very fact of her existence is still too fragile to cope with the Minute to Midnight's onslaught of weaponised time.

As she convulses, the Storm That Speaks swells, gathers strength. It seems it wasn't quite yet destroyed; and now it senses weakness in its would-be conqueror.","25":"The Unseen Queen is ascending to the sky and donning the flayed ghost of her father's torment. A crown of lightning has begun to dance across her brow; a robe of roiling clouds is wrapping her in an embrace. With each passing second, she strengthens her claim on existence. Soon, Albion will have a moon again."},"vault_description":{"17":"As you walk into the antechamber, you hear the tolling of a distant bell. The ceiling erupts into flame, and a wall of horizontal fire descends upon you with unstoppable finality.","18":"The vault is truly vast, larger than any cathedral you've seen. Every inch is stacked with glittering treasures and dusty relics. 

"There," says the Queen.

In pride of the place at the vault's centre is the Martyr-King's Cup. 

It is not a mere cup, of course. It is a whirling, spitting, shimmering vortex, flashing with lightning and fire, as wide and deep as a well.

How can you possibly take this back to the engine?","0":"","19":"The moonlight fades, and you find yourself back in the vault. 

The swirling pit at the vault's centre has vanished; and when you examine the portrait of the Unseen Queen, you realise she is now holding a stone cup in her hands. Her face is mostly scratched out still, but you think you can perceive a smile.

Before you can question her, a distant bell begins tolling rather urgently."},"journal_description":{"0":"","2":"The Journal is a fascinating but frustrating document, written in both terrible handwriting and a near-impenetrable code. Much of what you can painstakingly decipher is meaningless without context. Scattered phrases like 'chimeric moonlight', 'a Golden Day', and 'death in amber'. Most of all, that same alluring phrase again and again: 'The Martyr-King's Cup.' 

You study it through the night. You feel on the verge of a tantalising realisation.","3":"With the journal finally cracked, you sit back, bleary-eyed. You realise that you've been working for almost two days without food or sleep."}}
translation:
{"cup_description": {"0": "","15": "那幅褪色的无形女王肖像如今挂在你舱室外的走廊上。列车员们仍不太理解你的野心，并因各种可疑或迷信的理由对这幅肖像心存芥蒂。

"你要告诉我什么？"当你靠近时，女王严厉地问道。你怀疑她在怀念她那月光笼罩的宫廷。","16": "那幅褪色的无形女王肖像如今挂在你舱室外的走廊上。列车员们仍不太理解你的野心，并因各种可疑或迷信的理由对这幅肖像心存芥蒂。

"你要告诉我什么？"当你靠近时，女王严厉地问道。你怀疑她在怀念她那月光笼罩的宫廷。","17": "那幅褪色的无形女王肖像如今挂在你舱室外的走廊上。列车员们仍不太理解你的野心，并因各种可疑或迷信的理由对这幅肖像心存芥蒂。

"你要告诉我什么？"当你靠近时，女王严厉地问道。你怀疑她在怀念她那月光笼罩的宫廷。","18": "那幅褪色的无形女王肖像如今挂在你舱室外的走廊上。列车员们仍不太理解你的野心，并因各种可疑或迷信的理由对这幅肖像心存芥蒂。

"你要告诉我什么？"当你靠近时，女王严厉地问道。你怀疑她在怀念她那月光笼罩的宫廷。","19": "那幅褪色的无形女王肖像仍挂在你的舱室外走廊上。

她现在被描绘成优雅地持着一只石制酒杯。她的脸，如往常一般，被划得面目全非。","20": "那幅褪色的无形女王肖像仍挂在你的舱室外走廊上。

她现在被描绘成优雅地持着一只石制酒杯。她的脸，如往常一般，被划得面目全非。","21": "那幅褪色的无形女王肖像仍挂在你的舱室外走廊上。

她现在被描绘成优雅地持着一只石制酒杯。她的脸，如往常一般，被划得面目全非。"},"drinking_from_the_cup": {"0": "","22": ""你准备好体验我父亲生命中的最后时刻了吗？"无形女王问道。

你选定的容器庄重地点了点头，缓缓走向圣杯。光之触须在那人的额头上舞动。","23": "当毒语生效，杯中灵魂旋转得更快了。一道雷霆自圣杯中喷涌而出，将天空撕裂成两半。

太迟了，言语之风暴神注意到你。太迟了，风中的低语化作尖啸。

女王向前迈出一步（此刻，她已完全挣脱画框）。"你把我从时间中抹去，父亲。但你做得还不够彻底。你还留下一块残迹。一幅画。"","24": "风暴陷入不祥的寂静。

"我承诺过，在你找到圣杯后，你将获得不朽，"隐秘女王说道。她现在已化作一位身披流银的巨人。"但我没说你还要等多久。"

"当然，我得先摧毁蓝色王国，并篡夺蓝宝石之王的王座。当我做到这一点后，你们整个人类种族都将获得永生。这是我的承诺。"","30": "女王惊恐地凝视着你。月亮从天空中消失，你发现自己再次置身于聚集的风暴之下。

"为什么——你为什么——"无形女王正在消散。她的存在本就过于脆弱，无法承受“午夜来临之刻”那化作武器的时间洪流。

当她抽搐挣扎时，言语之风暴神开始膨胀、凝聚力量。它似乎并未完全被毁灭，而现在，它察觉到了本该征服它的对手的虚弱。","25": "无形女王正在升向天空，披着她父亲受尽折磨后的剥皮幽魂。一顶雷霆王冠开始在她的额上跃动，一袭翻滚的云雾披风正将她环绕怀抱。每过一秒，她的存在都变得愈加坚定。不久，阿尔比恩将再度迎来它的月亮。"},"vault_description": {"17": "当你步入前厅时，远方传来钟声的回响。天花板骤然爆裂出火焰，一道火墙从每个方向以无可阻挡的气势向你席卷而来。","18": "这座宝库庞大无比，远超你见过的任何一座大教堂。每一寸空间都堆满了璀璨的珍宝与尘封的遗物。

"在那里，"女王说道。

在宝库正中央的荣耀之地，摆放着殉道王圣杯。

它当然不仅仅是一只杯子，而是一个翻腾、喷溅、闪烁着雷电与火焰的漩涡，宽阔而深邃，如同一口井。

你如何才能把它带回你的列车？","0": "","19": "月光渐渐褪去，你发现自己又回到了宝库之中。

宝库中央的漩涡已然消失。当你细看无形女王的肖像时，你意识到她的双手如今正捧着一只石制圣杯。她的脸依旧被严重划损，但你似乎能察觉到一丝微笑。

在你来得及质问她之前，一阵急促的钟声从远处响起。"},"journal_description": {"0": "","2": "日志是一份令人沮丧的文献，用糟糕的笔迹和一种几乎无法破解的密码写就。你费尽心思破译的大部分内容在没有上下文的情况下毫无意义。短语散乱，如“嵌合月光”、“辉金白昼”和“琥珀中的死亡”。最重要的是，同样的短语重复了一次又一次：“殉道王圣杯”。

你彻夜研究，感觉自己正接近某个令人垂涎的顿悟。","3": "当日志最终被破解时，你睡眼惺忪地向后靠去，意识到自己已经工作了近两天，既没有吃过饭，也没有睡过觉。"}}

original: Ambition: The Song of the Sky
translation: 野心：天野之歌

original: You will write your name across the skies.
translation: 你的名字将传遍天宇。

original: {"16":"Find a publisher for the First Canto of the Song of the Sky.","18":"Visit the address of a potential publisher for the Song of the Sky.","20":"Perform a Momentous Exploit, and write about it in the Second Canto of the Song of the Sky.","26":"Publish the Second Canto of the Song of the Sky.","30":"Write the Third Canto of the Song of the Sky.","36":"Publish the Third Canto of the Song of the Sky.","40":"Perform a Momentous Exploit, and write about it in the Fourth Canto of the Song of the Sky.","46":"Publish the Fourth Canto of the Song of the Sky.","50":"Write the Fifth Canto of the Song of the Sky.","56":"Publish the Fifth Canto of the Song of the Sky.","58":"Meet the Omnivorous Publisher in London.","60":"Perform a Momentous Exploit, and write about it in the Sixth Canto of the Song of the Sky.","66":"Publish the Sixth Canto of the Song of the Sky.","68":"Find a way to publish the Sixth Canto of the Song of the Sky, despite the Ministry's interference.","70":"Write the Seventh and Final Canto of the Song of the Sky.","76":"Publish the Seventh and Final Canto of the Song of the Sky.","25":"Publish the Second Canto of the Song of the Sky.","45":"Publish the Fourth Canto of the Song of the Sky.","55":"Publish the Fifth Canto of the Song of the Sky.","65":"Publish the Sixth Canto of the Song of the Sky.","10":"Become the High Wilderness' most venerated explorer, and write the story that defines the era.","11":"Gather Tales of Terror and Sky-Stories to begin the Song of the Sky."}
translation: {"16":"为《天野之歌》的第一章寻找一位出版商。","18":"拜访《天野之歌》的潜在出版商。","20":"进行一次伟大探险，然后把它写进《天野之歌》的第二章。","26":"出版《天野之歌》的第二章。","30":"写下《天野之歌》的第三章。","36":"出版《天野之歌》的第三章。","46":"出版《天野之歌》的第四章。","50":"写下《天野之歌》的第五章。","56":"出版《天野之歌》的第五章。","58":"拜访伦敦的包罗万象的出版商。","60":"进行一次伟大探险，然后把它写进《天野之歌》的第六章。","66":"出版《天野之歌》的第六章。","68":"在公德部的阻挠下，设法出版《天野之歌》的第六章。","70":"写下《天野之歌》的第七章，也是最后一章。","76":"出版《天野之歌》的第七章，也是最后一章。","25":"出版《天野之歌》的第二章。","45":"出版《天野之歌》的第四章。","55":"出版《天野之歌》的第五章。","65":"出版《天野之歌》的第六章。","10":"成为天野中最受人崇敬的探险家，并写下定义这个时代的故事。","11":"收集恐怖故事与高天轶事，开始撰写《天野之歌》。"}

original: {"decision_description":{"55":"Are you going to speak the secrets you've learned, even those that anger the powerful? Or will you keep silent?","75":"Are you going to encourage other would-be explorers to follow in your footsteps?","16":"You write until you need to sleep. Then you sleep until you need to write. When you resurface, the first canto is complete. What now? You've not nearly finished the Song, not yet. But perhaps you've written enough to show to a publisher.","0":"Are you writing about a fictional character, merely drawing inspiration from your own experiences, or are you writing an explicit memoir?","15":"Are you writing about a fictional character, merely drawing inspiration from your own experiences, or are you writing an explicit memoir?","25":"There are many ways to tell a tale. Are you writing dry journalism with a hint of dark humour? A page-turner with bounding, scintillating prose? Or yearning verse, tinged with melancholy?","26":"When you take the Second Canto to the Omnivorous Publisher, he flashes a goblin-like grin. \"We're going to set this city on fire,\" he declares with convincing menace.","36":"When you take the Third Canto to the Omnivorous Publisher, he scans it with an empty grin before handing it to one of his assistants (how long has he had assistants?). \"Another masterpiece,\" he says. \"You never cease to amaze.\"","35":"Are you depicting your actions as purely heroic, or are you going to be honest?","46":"The Omnivorous Publisher puffs his cigar and holds your manuscript up to the light. A jewelled watch sparkles on his wrist (how long has he had that?). \"You should celebrate tonight,\" he says, pouring you a generous helping of whiskey. \"Then I want you to go straight home and start the next one. No detours.\"","56":"You find the Omnivorous Publisher at his paper-drowned desk, flanked by two large gentlemen with shoulders wide as anvils and guns at their hips. \"Protection,\" explains the Publisher, tossing back a glass of whiskey. \"Some of your readers are rather... fanatical.\" He briefly skims your manuscript before handing it to an assistant. ","66":"The Omnivorous Publisher sends a lackey to collect your manuscript. \"The Publisher is attending some very important parties, promoting your work,\" says the assistant, tucking the Sixth Canto beneath her arm without reading it. \"He sends his apologies.\"","45":"Your attempts to capture the sky in words have tended to return, again and again, to a similar theme:","65":"Perhaps now is the time to tell their stories in more detail? Or are they just going to remain your supporting cast?","76":"You instruct your assistant to begin printing a collected edition of all seven Cantos. The Song of the Sky is complete, and with it, your legacy assured."},"writing_description":{"16":"At first each word must be individually wrestled from your recalcitrant mind, and somewhere between brain and paper they lose their lustre. Finally, just as the mountain of crumpled paper beside your desk has reached your knees, you strike something. A match, a vein, a melancholy chord.","0":"Before you can truly begin the Song of the Sky, you must make a decision:","15":"Before you can truly begin the Song of the Sky, you must make a decision:","35":"A pause in your fevered typing. Before you write any further, you must make a decision:","25":"A pause in your fevered typing. Before you write any further, you must make a decision:","36":"You stare at the half-empty page in panic. For a moment, you fear you've lost your terrible momentum. But then the story catches you in its arms again, and you are a golem, a conduit, a ghost desperate to relay its final message. You write until your fingers are blistered, until the ending catches you by surprise. You recline, sweat-drenched. The Third Canto is complete.","46":"Themes that had once lurked in the recesses of your mind now rise unbidden to the surface, shaking the last vestiges of your subconscious from their flanks. You finally get the sense that you know what you're doing, and more importantly, where you're going. You sit to write, fingers flying, that shining spectre of an ending blazing like a beacon in your head... until finally, you reach it. The Fourth Canto is complete.","45":"Before you launch yourself into writing the Song of the Sky, you re-read the previous three Cantos. You're surprised to find that its ethos, its purpose, are taking shape with a clarity you hadn't noticed or planned.","55":"As you write, words coming unbidden, you realise that you're about to launch into an anecdote that could destroy some formidable reputations. The words squirm in your head, anxious to make it to the page. You must make a decision:","65":"As you contemplate the blank page, awaiting inspiration, you realise that throughout the course of the Song you've written of your crew only when necessary. ","75":"You return to your office and write. It's as easy as breathing. The Song of the Sky was a tangled beast at times, but you always knew how it would end, and for once it doesn't surprise you. You get there in no time at all. The Seventh Canto is complete, and you have a final decision to make:","76":"You finish writing the postscript and tear off the final page of the Song of the Sky. Your typewriter immediately falls apart in a clatter of exhausted metal. You rather feel like following suit.","26":"Words spit like lightning from your fingertips. The typewriter shudders and clanks in protest under the strain. You write in a kind of fury, your mind's eye raging with images of gloating stars and endless burning emptiness – and then you sit back, exhausted, as you realise you've run out of words. The Second Canto is complete.","56":"The tale has grown in the telling, and grown, and grown. In its vastness, it has become impossible to control. You find yourself searching through previous Cantos to ensure consistency of character and detail – stumbling unexpectedly upon narrative dead ends – writing yourself into terrible tangles that cannot be salvaged. With the grim determination of Hercules facing the hydra, you cut. And cut. Until the story lies bleeding, but better, at your feet. The Fifth Canto is complete.","66":"A moment of hesitation, and then a dam bursts in your mind. Words flood the page and carry you forward in an irresistible current, until you are flung into an ending as though dashed upon rocks. The result is rushed and imperfect. Grimly, you go back. You knock the story down and rebuild it, brick by painstaking brick, working with the nihilist fury of a master blacksmith forging his own guillotine. Finally, just as you are ready to throw your entire manuscript into the fire, you realise that you no longer need to – there's nothing left to fix. The Sixth Canto is complete."}}
translation: {"decision_description": {"55": "你会吐露出你知道的秘密，即便它们会激怒当权者，还是会保持沉默呢？","75": "你是否会鼓励其他有志的探险者追随你的脚步？","16": "你在长期伏案的辛劳中入睡，又在创作巨著的渴望中醒来。当你重新清醒时，第一章已然完成。然后呢？《天野之歌》还远没有到写完的时候。但或许，你已写下足够多的内容，可以拿给出版商看看。","0": "你是在写一名虚构角色，仅仅从自己的经历中汲取灵感？还是在撰写一部毫不掩饰的回忆录？","15": "你是在写一名虚构角色，仅仅从自己的经历中汲取灵感？还是在撰写一部毫不掩饰的回忆录？","25": "讲述一个故事有许多方式。你会选择写一篇略带黑色幽默的冷峻报道？还是行文流畅、引人入胜的小说？亦或是饱含忧郁情感的诗歌？","26": "当你将第二章交给包罗万象的出版商时，他露出狡黠的笑容。\"我们会轰动整座城市。\"他以令人信服的威胁口吻说道。","36": "当你将第三章交给包罗万象的出版商时，他扫了一眼，脸上挂着贪婪的笑，然后把稿件交给了他的助手（他什么时候开始有助手的？）。\"又是一部杰作，\"他说，\"你从不让我失望。\"","35": "你会将自己的行为美化成纯粹的英雄史诗，还是愿意袒露一切？","46": "包罗万象的出版商叼着雪茄，将你的手稿举到灯光下端详起来。他手腕上的手表珠光闪烁（他什么时候开始戴这种东西了？）。\"今晚你应该庆祝一番，\"他一边倒了一大杯威士忌，一边说道。\"然后直接回家，开始写下一篇。其他的哪里也别去。\"","56": "你在堆满文件的办公桌旁找到了包罗万象的出版商，他的两侧站着两个肩膀如铁砧般宽厚、腰间别着枪的彪形大汉。\"保护措施，\"出版商解释道，一边将手中威士忌一饮而尽，\"你的一些读者相当的……狂热。\"他快速翻阅你的手稿，然后交给了一名助手。","66": "包罗万象的出版商派了一个下手来取你的手稿。\"出版商正在参加一些非常重要的宴会，为你的作品做宣传。\"那位助手一边把第六章夹在腋下，一边说道，连一眼都没看。\"他向你表示抱歉。\"","45": "你尝试用文字捕捉天穹的形态，结果一次又一次地回归到同一个主题：","65": "或许，现在正是更详细讲述他们故事的时机？还是他们仍然只是你的配角？","76": "你吩咐助手开始印刷全部七章的合集。《天野之歌》已然完成，而你的传奇也随之确立。"},"writing_description": {"16": "起初，每一个词都像是从顽固的思绪中艰难拽出，而在落笔之间，它们似乎又失去了原有的光彩。最终，当你桌旁的废纸堆成一座小山，你终于触及到了什么。一丝火花，一条脉络，一个忧郁的音符。","0": "在真正开始创作《天野之歌》前，你必须做出决定：","15": "在真正开始创作《天野之歌》前，你必须做出决定：","35": "你停下疯狂的打字工作。在继续写下去之前，你必须做出决定：","25": "你停下疯狂的打字工作。在继续写下去之前，你必须做出决定：","36": "你惊恐地望着那半空的页面。片刻间，你害怕自己失去了那股狂热的冲劲。但随后，故事再度将你吞没，你化身为泥塑的傀儡、传讯的媒介、一个急于倾诉最后信息的幽灵。你不停地写，直到手指起泡，直到故事的终点猝然降临。你瘫倒在椅子上，浑身湿透。第三章完成了。","46": "曾经潜伏在你意识深处的主题，如今不请自来，驱散了最后的潜意识余烬。你终于有了方向，知道自己在做什么，更重要的是，知道自己要去往何方。你坐下来，双手在键盘上飞舞，那个闪耀的终点像灯塔般在脑海中燃烧……直到你终于抵达。第四章完成了。","45": "在正式投身于《天野之歌》的创作之前，你重读了前三章。你惊讶地发现，作品的意旨与主题已然逐渐成型，展现出一种你此前未曾察觉的清晰度。","55": "你正全神贯注地书写，文字源源不断地流淌而出，直到你意识到自己即将记录下一段可能毁掉某些显赫人物声誉的逸事。那些词句在你的脑海中挣扎，渴望跃然纸上。你必须做出决定：","65": "你凝视着空白的页面，等待灵感降临。你突然意识到，在《天野之歌》的整个写作过程中，你只在必要时才提及你的列车员们。","75": "你回到书房，开始写作。这就像呼吸一样自然。《天野之歌》有时曾是头难以驾驭的野兽，但你始终清楚它的终点。而这一次，它没有让你感到意外。你迅速抵达了终点。第七章完成，而你面前，还有最后一个决定。","76": "你写完了后记，撕下《天野之歌》的最后一页。你的打字机旋即在一阵疲惫的金属哀鸣中散作一堆零件。你也有些相似的感觉。","26": "文字如闪电般从你的指尖迸发。打字机在压力下咔嗒作响。你写作时仿佛陷入了一种狂热，脑海中充满了傲慢的群星与无尽燃烧的虚空——然后，你瘫倒在椅子上，精疲力竭，意识到自己已经写尽所有言辞。第二章完成了。","56": "这个故事在讲述中不断扩展，扩展，再扩展。它的广阔已经超出了你的掌控。你发现自己不得不翻阅先前的篇章，以确保人物和细节的连贯性——却意外地撞上了叙事的死胡同——陷入无法挽回的逻辑困境。你以赫拉克勒斯挑战九头蛇的坚定决心开始裁剪。砍去冗余，削减赘述，直到故事血淋淋地躺在你的脚下，却也变得更加完美。第五章完成了。","66": "片刻的犹豫后，你脑海中的闸门猛然打开。文字如洪流般席卷纸张，推动你不断向前，直至你被抛入一个突如其来的结局，如同被摔碎在礁石上。结果仓促而不完美。你咬牙回头，从头打碎重建，一字一句，如同一个狂热的工匠在锻造自己的断头台。终于，就在你几乎准备将整个手稿投入火中时，你意识到——已经无可再改。第六章完成了。"}}

original: Ambition: the Truth
translation: 野心：真相

original: Even the stars keep secrets.
translation: 即使是星星也会有秘密。

original: {"15":"Your old friend associates with a group of seasoned captains that meet at the Promise of Days in New Winchester. Seek her there.","10":"You hope to meet an old friend in New Winchester.","30":"Seek your friend at London.","33":"You are exploring the Jubilation Day festivities.","40":"Your friend missed your appointed meeting. Track down where they have been living in London.","50":"Visit the burned building where your friend lodged in London.","60":"Seek the assistance of the seasoned captains at New Winchester.","20":"Your friend left you a letter, which included a coded message. Can you decipher it? ","200":"Talk to your old friend about your locomotive. They will serve as a First Officer.","210":"Decide whether to flee the heavens or change yourselves beyond recognition.","100":"Lay the beginnings of your plans at New Winchester.","230":"Open the Avid Horizon.","220":"Take the necessary steps to open the Avid Horizon","110":"Form an alliance with the Thing in the White Well.","70":"Aid the seasoned captains in their investigations.","80":"'Spatchcocker' Meg has found a lead.","91":"There is nothing here for you, now.","95":"Carry your friend back to New Winchester, so she can recover from her ordeal in the wastes.","115":"You must establish spider-councils across the sky.","120":"Travel to the Toll-Tower at Sky Barnet."}
translation: {"15":"你的老朋友领着一位经验丰富的车长在新温彻斯特的时日之约俱乐部约定与你碰面。去那里寻找她。","10":"你希望能在新温彻斯特遇上你的老朋友。","30":"在伦敦找到你的老朋友。","33":"你正在欢庆日庆典中探索。","40":"你的朋友失约了。寻找其在伦敦的住处。","50":"探查你朋友在伦敦下榻过的那栋被烧毁的建筑物。","60":"向温彻斯特那些经验丰富的车长们寻求帮助。","20":"你的朋友留了一封信给你，其中有一段编码过的信息。你能破译它吗？","200":"告诉你的朋友你拥有一列机车，其会作为大副为你服务。","210":"作出决定：逃离天穹，抑或是改变自己至面目全非。","100":"在新温彻斯特开始你的计划。","230":开启渴求之地平线。,"220":"采取必要的行动，开启渴求之地平线的大门。","110":"与白井中的存在结成联盟。","70":"协助数位经验丰富的车长进行调查。","80":"“褪骨厨师”梅格已经找到一个线索。","91":"这里没有你要做的事了。","95":"带着你的朋友返回新温彻斯特，使她得以从无人荒漠的苦难中恢复。","115":"你必须在天穹成立蜘蛛议会。","120":"前往空中巴尼特区的渡灵塔。"}

original:
{"Gallery":{"150":"Time passes oddly in your Gallery of Hours. The loom thrums in the next room. The hours are taut and thin, like a bubble straining to pop. You read, you pace, you think. Outside, the decades pour by. 

Seventy years pass. There is a knock at the door.","160":"You return to your waiting. You have read all your books, now. You have listened to your handful of phonograph cylinders. You consider learning the oboe, which you bought in a fit of optimism when furnishing the Gallery.

Outside, thirty more years hurry by. There is a second knock at the door. ","170":"More of the pulled-tight time of the Gallery passes, in which you take up the oboe, break the oboe over your knee in frustration, learn to repair oboes, and master the oboe. A calamitous century thunders by beyond.

Then a note is pushed under your door.","180":"Time is all you have left. There is no way to distract yourself now; you can only wait, and fret, and hope. This is the worst part of scheming: when you are reliant on other parties, invisible to you, doing their work.

But eventually the time loom clatters its last. Your hours are spent. Another century or more has haunted the world outside, and it is time to claim your prize."}}
translation:
{"Gallery": {"150": "在你的时光长廊中，时间以奇特的方式流逝。隔壁房间的织机低鸣不止。时间纱紧绷、纤薄，仿佛随时会破裂的气泡。你阅读，你踱步，你沉思。而在外界，数十年岁月倾泻而下。

七十年过去。门响了。","160": "你继续等待。你已经读完了所有的书，听完了所有的留声机唱片。你考虑学习双簧管——那是你在布置长廊时，怀着乐观情绪买下的。

在外界，三十年匆匆而逝。门那里传来了第二次敲响。","170": "在长廊紧绷的时间纱中，你开始学习双簧管，然后因挫败感将其折断，又学会了修复双簧管，最终掌握了这门技艺。而在外界，动荡的百年轰然流逝。

然后，一张字条被塞进了门缝。","180": "时间是你唯一剩下的东西。如今已无事可分心，你只能等待，满怀焦虑、满怀期盼。这是谋划中最煎熬的阶段——你只能依赖那些在外界执行你意图的无形同谋。

但时织机终于发出了最后的喀嗒声。你的时间已然耗尽。在外界，或许又有一个世纪幽灵般飘逝。而现在，是时候去领取你的奖赏了。"}}

original: Ambition: Wealth
translation: 野心：财富

original: Accrue a substantial fortune, so that you may enjoy your retirement in the manner to which you mean to become accustomed.
translation: 积累一笔可观的财富，按你自己的喜好享受退休生活。

original: {"10":"Raise enough money to buy an estate at London, Pan or New Winchester.","20":"Expand your estate with a lavish extension, reflective of your personal taste.","30":"Host a major event at your estate to firmly introduce yourself into your chosen society to complete your Ambition."}
translation: {"10":"筹集资金，在伦敦、潘城或新温彻斯特购买一处房产。","20":"将你的房产扩建得更加奢华，以此来彰显你的品味。","30":"在你的房产中举办一次盛大活动，全然投身于你所选择的社交圈，完成你的野心。"}

original: Amenable Host
translation: 随和的主管

original: A beautiful amnesiac with the arrogance of a Greek god. Perhaps this is the man Lord Langley seeks.
translation: 一个美丽的失忆者，有着希腊神祗一样的傲慢。也许这就是兰利勋爵寻找的人。

original: {"0":"The Amenable Host has left your company for more salubrious climes.","1":"The Amenable Host is aboard your engine."}
translation: {"0":"随和的主管已离开你，去了更舒适的地方。","1":"随和的主管在你的机车上。"}

original: Amendment of Self
translation: 面目全非

original: You entered Piranesi. Someone else will leave.
translation: 你进入了皮拉内西。你须变成他人方可离开。

original: Amiable Vagabond
translation: 和蔼的流浪汉

original: He sings well, smokes an old clay pipe with indecent relish, and lies agreeably.
translation: 他唱得很好，不雅地抽着一个老式的土烟斗，很惬意地躺在地上。

original: {"1":"The Amiable Vagabond has joined your crew."}
translation: {"1":"和蔼的流浪汉已经加入了你的列车员。"}

original: {"0":"The Amiable Vagabond is gone."}
translation: {"0":"和蔼的流浪汉已经走了。"}

original: Amniotic Crew Containment
translation: 羊膜列车员舱

original: London ingenuity colludes with the shapeling arts! Your crew will sleep like babes in these convenient amniotic sacs. In the event of a hull breach the sacs will expand to plug the gap, then harden to provide additional protection! Remove the crew first, though.
translation: 伦敦巧思与塑形技艺的融合！你的列车员将像婴儿一样睡在这些方便的羊膜囊中。在车体破损的情况下，羊胎囊会膨胀以堵住缺口，然后变硬以提供额外的保护。不过，要先把列车员移走。

original: Amusements on Port Prosper
translation: 兴荣港的娱乐

original: The sights and sounds of dear Port Prosper. They keep themselves amused here.
translation: 亲爱的兴荣港的风景和声音。他们在这里自娱自乐。

original: {"1":"A hue and cry goes up on the Mornington-Abrathat Span. A thief at the Admiral Nelson! The guards will not be kind.","10":"The Parsimonious Chairman is out on his morning constitutional. East-Enders steer clear of his route; West-Enders track him down to make entreaties.","20":"Cheers go up from Haustus Height, where a team of patriotic mountaineers have scaled the cliff and unveiled the Union Jack.","30":"A fire at the Fulbright Factory! Windward Company representatives race past carrying heavy buckets.","40":"The air is humid and moist. The Agbonon Spring is being drained in preparation for the Season.","50":"Sparklers wheel in the sky. Lovers race across the Span. The scent of butterscotch and candyfloss is on the wind.","60":"Protesters roar outside the gates of the Fullbright Factory. The Admiral Nelson has invested in iron doors.","70":"Snow swirls around Port Prosper and settles on Mol's Table. Fur-coated West-Enders dash through the drifts.","90":"Roast chestnuts burn on open fires. East-Enders stoke the flames and tend to the charcoal burning.","100":"Singing can be heard from the Agbonon Spring, where fashionable young lords and ladies are at leisure.","80":"A gunshot in the night. Pistols in the morning. The West-Enders close ranks."}
translation: {"1":"莫宁顿-阿布拉塔特大桥上，一阵阵呼喊声响起。纳尔逊海军上将号遭窃！警卫们不会手软的。","10":"吝啬的主席正在进行他的晨间散步。东区人避开他的行进路线，而西区人却追随其后，以求讨好。","20":"欢呼声从豪斯特斯高地传来，一支爱国登山队攀上悬崖并升起了英国国旗。","30":"福布莱斯特工厂发生了一场大火！迎风公司的代表们手提沉重的水桶匆忙赶过。","40":"空气湿润而潮湿。为了迎接季节的到来，阿波农之泉正在排空。","50":"烟花在天空中绽放，恋人们跨越大桥奔跑。风中弥漫着奶油糖与棉花糖的香气。","60":"示威者在福布莱特工厂大门外高声抗议。纳尔逊海军上将号投资安装了铁门。","70":"雪花在兴荣港周围盘旋，落在莫尔之桌上。身着毛皮大衣的西区人在积雪中奔跑。","90":"明火上烘烤着栗子，东区人挑动着火苗，照料着碳火。","100":"阿波农之泉中传来歌声，时下时髦的年轻贵族在这里消遣。","80":"深夜的枪声。清晨的手枪。西区人团结一致。"}

original: An Acrobat's Wistfulness
translation: 一位杂技演员的渴求

original: How long before another runs off?
translation: 距离另一个跑掉还要多久？

original: An Advance in Time
translation: 时间的推进

original: Time runs away from you.
translation: 时间从你身旁流逝。

original: An Agent of Blue Kingdom Philosophy
translation: 蓝色王国哲学的代理人

original: An adherent of the Philosophy of Culmination, sent to spread these ideals to distant ports.
translation: 一位终焉哲学的信徒，被派往遥远的港口传播这些理想。

original: {"1":"Deliver a poet to London.","2":"Deliver a philosopher to New Winchester.","3":"Deliver a painter to Worlebury-juxta-Mare.","4":"Deliver an essayist to Port Prosper.","5":"Deliver a musician to Titania.","6":"Deliver a rabble-rouser to the Brabazon Workworld."}
translation: {"1":"把一位诗人送往伦敦。","2":"把一位哲学家送往新温彻斯特。","3":"把一位画家送往滨海沃伯瑞。","4":"把一位随笔作家送往兴荣港。","5":"把一位音乐家送往狄坦妮娅。","6":"把一位煽动者送往布拉巴宗工作世界。"}

original: An Amaranthine End
translation: 终凋的结局

original: The Clay Conductor is considering how things have gone.
translation: 粘土人列车主管正在考虑事情的发展。

original: An Artwork in the Culmination Style
translation: 终焉风格的艺术品

original: A work of art (that some would call propaganda). Its implications are subtle (but not too subtle). It promotes the reverence of stars and the conclusion of all things.
translation: 一件艺术品（有些人称之为宣传）。它的含义很微妙（但也不是太微妙）。它宣扬群星的崇敬和万物的终结。

original: {"1":"Publish a poem in New Winchester.","2":"Submit an essay in London.","3":"Deliver a work of art to Magdalene's.","4":"Nail up an argument to the door of Azimuth in the Clockwork Sun."}
translation: {"1":"在新温彻斯特发表一首诗。","2":"在伦敦递交一篇论文。","3":"向抹大拉之家送出一件艺术品。","4":"在发条太阳方位厅的门上钉一份提要。"}

original: An Assignment from the Orator
translation: 来自演说家的一项任务

original: The Mesmeric Orator has sent you to help spread Blue Kingdom influence in Albion or the Reach.
translation: 煽惑人心的演说家派你去协助在阿尔比恩或外野扩散蓝色王国的影响。

original: {"1":"Travel to London and foster anti-Empress sentiment.","2":"Travel to New Winchester and promote the Blue Kingdom.","3":"Travel to New Winchester and foster pro-Judgement sentiment.","4":"Travel to Titania and commission a statue celebrating endings."}
translation: {"1":"前往伦敦，培植反对皇后的观点。","2":"前往新温彻斯特，宣传蓝色王国。","3":"前往新温彻斯特，培植前司命的观点。","4":"前往狄坦妮娅，委托建造一座庆祝结局的雕像。"}

original: An Aunt at Work
translation: 工作中的姨妈

original: You've given her a job to do. Now she just needs time to do it.
translation: 你已经给了她一个工作。现在她只需要时间去做这件事。

original: {"0":"Your Aunt has finished her task.","1":"You have put your Aunt to work. Return to the Mausoleum in 30 days to see what's she been up to."}
translation: {"0":"你的姨妈已经完成了她的任务。","1":"你让你的姨妈去工作了。30天后回陵墓，看看她在做什么。"}

original: An Awareness of Something... Off
translation: 感觉有什么……不对劲

original: Worlebury-juxta-Mare tries to present itself as the perfect seaside town. But the longer you stay, the easier it is to spot that it never quite succeeds in this endeavour.
translation: 滨海沃伯瑞试图将自己展现为完美的海滨小镇。但你待得越久，就越容易发现它在这方面的努力从未完全成功。

original: {"1":"The longer you spend in Worlebury-juxta-Mare, the easier it is to spot the flaws in the facade. There! Another detail, not quite right.","0":"In a place so bright and joy-filled, it's easy to be distracted. Whatever it was you'd noticed about Worlebury-juxta-Mare, it's gone now."}
translation: {"1":"你在滨海沃伯瑞呆的时间越长，就越容易发现其表面的缺陷。在那里！另一个不大对劲的细节。","0":"在一个如此明亮而充满欢乐的地方，一个人很容易分心。无论你曾在滨海沃伯瑞注意到过什么，现在它已经消失了。"}

original: {"0":"In a place so bright and joy-filled, it's easy to be distracted. Whatever it was you'd noticed about Worlebury-juxta-Mare, it's gone now."}
translation: {"0":"在一个如此明亮而充满欢乐的地方，一个人很容易分心。无论你曾在滨海沃伯瑞注意到过什么，现在它已经消失了。"}

original: An Awareness of the Rules of the Mausoleum
translation: 察觉到圣宁墓的规则

original: {"Arrival":{"0":"Kensington Station is tucked into a side chapel. An elderly footman is lighting candles while waiting to guide visitors into the Mausoleum proper.","1":"The footman disappears into the gloom, leaving you alone facing a desk shaped like a baptismal font. A Cheery Registrar sits in the middle, waiting to greet you."}}
translation: {"Arrival":{"0":"肯辛顿站被塞进了一个侧教堂里。一位年长的男仆正在点燃蜡烛，同时等待引导游客进入至圣陵墓。","1":"男仆消失在黑暗中，只留下你一个人面对着一张形似洗礼池的桌子。一位热情的登记员坐在中间，等待迎接你。"}}

original: An Elaborate But Fragile Artifice
translation: 精 致 而 易 碎 的 幻 象

original: It quivers and burns in your vision.
translation: 它在你的视野中摇曳燃烧。

original: {"1":"You have found this sigil."}
translation: {"1":"你找到了这个符印。"}

original: An Embassy Regular
translation: 一个大使馆的常客

original: You know the Ambassador to the Blue Kingdom.
translation: 你认识蓝色王国的大使。

original: {"10":"You may return to visit the Ambassador when you have news."}
translation: {"10":"当你有消息时，你可以回来拜访大使。"}

original: An Encounter with a Weft of Unravelling Time
translation: 遭遇解开的时间纬线

original: You discovered a place where the weave of time had frayed.
translation: 你发现了一个时间之织已经磨损的地方。

original: {"QuestInfo":{"10":"[The Horological Office in London may be able to tell you more about your encounter.]","20":""}}
translation: {"QuestInfo":{"10":"[伦敦的时计部会告诉你更多关于这一遭遇的信息。]","20":""}}

original: An Encounter with the Eccentric
translation: 与怪人相遇

original: An Entrancing Companion
translation: 迷人的锻造同伴

original: {"Gaze":{"0":"","1":"Fragments of starlight dance around the room, scattered by the Companion's gemstone eyes."},"VolumePoetryPlates":{"0":"","1":"The Poetic Forged Companion becomes a literary sensation, and before long a series of commemorative plates is made in their honour. You receive an entire crate, so that at the end of every meal, the Companion's gemstone eyes stare up at you, smeared with gravy."},"Happy":{"0":"","1":"sparkling yet inscrutable"},"Destroy":{"0":"","1":"and the sparkling eyes in its sunken face. The eyes remain fixed on you as you prise them from their sockets, losing their lustre only once they are free from the face."},"Encounter":{"0":"","1":"faceted"},"Encounter2":{"0":"","1":"Your first punch catches them on the cheek, a gemstone eye grazing your knuckles."},"Ridding":{"0":"","1":"sparkling"}}
translation: {"Gaze": {"0": "","1": "星光在房间里舞动，被同伴的宝石眼睛散射开来。"},"VolumePoetryPlates": {"0": "","1": "诗意的锻造同伴轰动了文学界，不久之后，一系列纪念盘子就被制作出来纪念它。你收到了一整箱，因此在每顿饭结束时，都有同伴的宝石眼睛从盘子上盯着你，上面涂满了肉汁。"},"Happy": {"0": "","1": "闪闪发光却又难以捉摸"},"Destroy": {"0": "","1": "以及凹陷的脸上闪闪发光的眼睛。当你把它们自眼窝中撬出来时，眼睛仍然盯着你。它们从脸上解放出来之后便失去了光泽。"},"Encounter": {"0": "","1": "多面切割的"},"Encounter2": {"0": "","1": "你的第一拳打在它的脸颊上，一颗宝石般的眼睛擦伤了你的指关节。"},"Ridding": {"0": "","1": "闪闪发光的"}}

original: An Exchange of Burdens
translation: 负 担 的 交 换

original: It quivers and burns in your vision.
translation: 它在你的视野中摇曳燃烧。

original: {"1":"You have found this sigil."}
translation: {"1":"你找到了这个符印。"}

original: An Expedition To
translation: 远征……

original: You have embarked on an expedition into Traitor's Wood.
translation: 你已开始探索叛徒之林的探险。

original: {"1":"The Palewood: The nearer star-dappled reaches of the Wood.","2":"The Shroudwood: The starlit glades and marshes on the far side of the Wood.","3":"The Deepwood: The starless groves near the heart of the Wood.","4":"The Regent's Grave: The barrow at the Wood's beating heart."}
translation: {"1":"苍白林：森林中更接近斑驳星光的地方。","2":"寿衣林：树林深处，被星光照亮的空地与沼泽的所在地。","3":"深林：森林中心附近，不见繁星的树丛处。","4":"摄政王之墓：森林跳动心脏里的古墓。"}

original: {"Crossing":{"0":"Crossing","1":"A few stones are speckled across a laughing stream. Getting across involves much flailing of limbs and the occasional undignified leap. Trouble occurs half-way across where a stone has clearly shifted in a recent storm. Your tallest crewman is required to serve as a bridge.","2":"A bridge lies broken in the river. Bridge is perhaps a loose term. Brunel never cast his eye over this sorry assortment of slabs. They shift and creak in the water, and one crewman is almost lost to sudden concussion.","3":"A bridge, such as chariots might have thundered over, once stood here, though only pillars remain. Navigating those requires sudden feats of athleticism and fervent prayers to the prevailing wind. This place was once tamed, but now runs wild.","4":"A bridge, such as chariots might have thundered over, once stood here, though only pillars remain. Navigating those requires sudden feats of athleticism and fervent prayers to the prevailing wind. This place was once tamed, but now runs wild."},"Picnic":{"0":"Picnic","1":"You ford a steep hill and find the Feckless Theologian and the Dismal Paleographer sharing a bottle of brandy at the summit. The Paleographer twines flowers in his hair, while the Theologian corrects him: “Violets, never roses. And never, ever ever, lilies. There, I look half Elagabalus already.” They do not bother to notice you, lost in quiet bickering.","2":"The Feckless Theologian is lying in the Vituperative Classicist’s lap. She reads out her favourite passages from Virgil, in between swigs from a large amphora. The Theologian drinks even more fervently, as he laments the poet’s treatment of Turnus. The discussion soon turns to debate, and then disappointment, as the Classicist storms away. Neither notices you, lost in wine and vitriol.","3":"The Dismal Paleographer and the Vituperative Classicist are sat over a book of sketches. They share a flask of some amber liquid, passing it between them. “This is of you, I think.” “I always thought it was you; he always represented you as a hawk.” “And you a swallow.” “He preferred eagles.” They lapse into silence, either not seeing or ignoring you.","4":"The remnant of a picnic basket sits empty in the pouring rain. Empty glasses fill with water. A plate is washed away."},"Lost":{"0":"Lost","1":"You’re able to find your way to a steep hill, covered in an avalanche of leaves. You pull your way to the top, and the way ahead is clear, just a few miles to the south. The shadow of the barrow falls over you.","2":"You have to go back. You ignore all complaints, doubts, and shrieks of anguish. Back across that river, right at the dead yew, thrice up the hill when you thought you were lost again. But - at last - the trail you were following is before you once more. The fires of the camp are very far away.","3":"The shadows of the trees fall all around you. Twigs snap under your feet as you make your way on, almost blind through the dark. The lighting of a lantern almost starts a fire. An unexpected pond ruins boots and morale. Something lows in the copse just beside you. But – eventually – you find your way to a familiar spot.","4":"You can’t even hear your crew. Alone in the dark of the wood. Neither sign nor compass to guide your way. You fumble through the blind wood for what seems hours. Every time you look behind, all signs of your passage have seemingly vanished, swept away. Could you find your way back? And then, like the rising of the first star in the evening, you find yourself in a wooded glade. Your crew is waiting. All speak of eery trails and sudden silences opening before them."},"Glade":{"0":"Glade","1":"The little glade is marshy and wets your boots, yet affords a quick short-cut through the high birches on either side. A babbling brook cutting through the middle affords you the change to slake your thirsts.","2":"The forest opens onto a large grove, where great hagwood trees vye with storm ashes for dominion of the skies. Someone has attempted to cultivate beds of flowers here, once long ago. Wildflowers now run wild in the deep hollows of the grove.","3":"The glade is more of a valley, which chases a river that courses laughing through the wild of the wood. Two lines of bronzewood trees mighty and terrible form the spine of the glade, like the pillars of a cathedral.","4":"The glade is as deep and dark as the bottom of a well. Fireflies guide your way through the hollows and hidden places contained therein. At one point, the path narrows so tightly that you are forced to go two by two through the dark."}}
translation: {"Crossing":{"0":"Crossing","1":"些许石块点缀着喧腾的溪流，想要穿过它恐怕需要些许并不体面的跳跃和大幅度的动作。麻烦之处往往在于半途上因涡流而快速移动的石块。你最高的那位列车员需要承担桥梁一般的角色。","2":"一座破旧的桥梁横架在小溪上，或许将其称之为桥梁也有些勉强。布鲁内尔并未看向那些组成桥梁的各式各样的可悲木板——它们在水流的冲刷下漂荡，发出嘎吱嘎吱的声音，并差点失去了一位因此脑震荡的列车员。","3":"桥梁好似被雷击后的双轮敞篷马车，结构曾经完整，但雷击过后只留下残破支架，想要带领列车员们通过这座桥梁需要有着应付突发情况的运动技能和对常规风向的虔诚祈祷。这个地方曾经繁盛，但如今罕有人迹。","4":"桥梁好似被雷击后的双轮敞篷马车，结构曾经完整，但雷击过后只留下残破支架，想要带领列车员们通过这座桥梁需要有着应付突发情况的运动技能和对常规风向的虔诚祈祷。这个地方曾经繁盛，但如今罕有人迹。"},"Picnic":{"0":"Picnic","1":"你登上一座陡峭的小丘，发现软弱的神学家和阴郁的古生物家在山顶分享着一瓶白兰地。古物学家将鲜花盘绕在神学家的头发上，他纠正道："用紫罗兰将我掩埋，而非玫瑰，更不能是百合，我现在看上去就像半个埃拉伽巴路斯。"他们甚至懒得理睬你，沉浸在他们那安静的小小争论之中。","2":"软弱的神学家躺在挑剔的古典学者的大腿上。她朗诵着维吉尔诗集中神学家最喜爱的那部分，大口畅饮着一个双口细颈瓶。神学家甚至更加豪放，好似正为那诗人笔下的图尔努斯的结局哀叹。但是对情节的讨论不久就演变成了争吵，古典学家大发雷霆后离开，这一切都变得扫兴至极。两个人都没有理睬你，神伤在葡萄酒和尖酸刻薄的言语中。","3":"阴郁的古物学家和挑剔的古典学者坐在一本素描集上，他们传递着一个盛有琥珀色液体的瓶子，一起使用它。“我猜这或许是你。” “我一直以为是你。他总是把你描绘成一只老鹰。” “而你则是那只燕子。” “他更喜欢雕些。”他们陷入了沉默，要么是没看到你，抑或是无视了你。","4":"空荡荡的野餐盒遗落在滂沱大雨之中，玻璃杯中盛满了雨水，一个碟子被冲走了。"},"Lost":{"0":"Lost","1":"你找到了一条通往陡峭小丘的路，被雪崩般滚下的树叶掩盖。你沿着路攀至山顶，前方的路视野十分清晰，就在南边几英里处，而古冢的阴影也荫蔽了你。","2":"你不得不返回。你无视了所有的抱怨，怀疑和痛苦的叫声，回到了小溪边。你怀疑自己迷了路，并在那棵枯死的紫衫树旁开始第三次的登山。不过最终你所寻找的道路再次出现在你面前，而营地的大火仍离得很远。","3":"树的阴影笼罩了你。当你沿着路前行时，细枝在你脚下断裂，在如黑暗般的荫蔽中你几乎看不清前方，而灯笼的火光差点酿造了一场火灾。一个意料之外的小池塘损坏了你的靴子和岌岌可危的士气，你察觉到旁边的树林里有什么低矮的东西。但最终你找到了一个熟悉的地点。","4":"你甚至听不到你的列车员的声音。沿着灌木的阴影， 视线与罗盘都不能为你指引方向。你在令人头晕目眩的树林中摸索了几个小时， 每当你回头看去，所有曾踏过的道路的标志似乎都已消失扫净。你能找到回去的路吗？之后，当夜晚的第一颗星星升起，你发现自己身处一片树木繁茂的林间空地。你的列车员们正在等待，所有人都在谈论他们面前出现的诡异的痕迹和突然的沉默。"},"Glade":{"0":"Glade","1":"这片林间的空地是一块沼泽地，很可能会弄湿你的靴子，但你可以选择快速穿过两边的高桦树。一条潺潺的小溪从中间流过，让你有机会解渴。","2":"林区通向另一片树林，宏伟的哈格伍德树在风暴的灰烬中摇曳，统治着天穹。曾经有人试图在这里培育一个花坛，野花如今在树林深深的空洞里肆意生长。","3":"这片空地更像是一个山谷，追逐着一条在荒野中欢快流淌的河流。两排高大而可怕的青铜色泽的树形成了林间空地的脊梁，就像大教堂的柱子。","4":"这片空地像井底一样深而黑，萤火虫会指引你穿过洞穴和其中隐藏的地方。在某处，这条路突然变得十分狭窄，你不得不两两结队穿过黑暗。"}}

original: An Experimental Engine
translation: 一个实验性的引擎

original: You have heard of an experimental engine being developed at the wreck of the Berrenger.
translation: 你听闻在贝伦格号的残骸上有人正在研发一台实验性的引擎。

original: {"10":"Seek the Diabolical Contriver at the wreck of the Berrenger.","20":"The Diabolical Contriver requires a number of exotic components to create her experimental engine.","50":"You have assisted in the creation of the Devourer of Distance. Good luck.","15":"You have introduced yourself to the Diabolical Contriver."}
translation: {"10":"在贝伦格号的残骸中寻找恶魔发明家。","20":"恶魔发明家需要一些奇异的部件来制造实验性引擎。","50":"你协助了路距食客的创造。祝你好运。","15":"你向恶魔发明家介绍了自己。"}

original: An Eye on your Arm
translation: 你胳膊上的眼睛

original: Did it just blink? No. Impossible.
translation: 它刚刚眨眼了吗？不，不可能的。

original: {"1":"You have accepted a tattoo from Mr Barleycorn.","0":"You are no longer tattooed by the Halved."}
translation: {"1":""你接受了麦寸先生的纹身。"","0":"你身上不再具有半分者的印记。"}

original: An Icon
translation: 一个图像

original: A fragment of evidence that points to the sleeping king's identity as that of Charlemagne.
translation: 一份证据的残片，表明沉睡的国王正是查理曼大帝本尊。

original: An Identity Lost in Lustrum
translation: 在伍载镇丢失的身份

original: The Amenable Host had vivid memories of being a prospector captain.
translation: 随和的主管对自己作为一个探矿者队长的经历记忆犹新。

original: {"1":"You have not yet checked at Lustrum.","2":"You have found no conclusive evidence of the Amenable Host's identity at Lustrum."}
translation: {"1":"你还没有在伍载镇检查过。","2":"你在伍载镇没有发现随和的主管的身份的确凿证据。"}

original: An Identity Lost in New Winchester
translation: 在新温彻斯特丢失的身份

original: The Amenable Host had vivid memories of being a titan of industry.
translation: 随和的主管对自己作为一个工业泰斗的经历记忆犹新。

original: {"1":"You have not yet checked at New Winchester.","2":"You have found no conclusive evidence of the Amenable Host's identity at New Winchester."}
translation: {"1":"你还没有在新温彻斯特检查过。","2":"你在新温彻斯特没有发现随和的主管的身份的确凿证据。"}

original: An Identity Lost in Port Prosper
translation: 在兴荣港丢失的身份

original: The Amenable Host had vivid memories of being an heir to a fine house.
translation: 随和的主管对自己是一所光鲜大宅的继承人记忆犹新。

original: {"2":"You have found no conclusive evidence of the Amenable Host's identity at Port Prosper.","1":"You have not yet checked at Port Prosper."}
translation: {"1":"你还没有在兴荣港检查过。","2":"你在兴荣港没有发现随和的主管的身份的确凿证据。"}

original: An Illusive Companion at Polmear & Plenty's
translation: 一个在波尔梅尔&普伦蒂的不可思议马戏团的虚幻的锻造同伴

original: An Inconvenient Great Aunt
translation: 令人困扰的伟大姨妈

original: Another one!?!
translation: 另一个！？！

original: {"1":"Your interview is, mercifully, over."}
translation: {"1":"幸运的是，你的面试结束了。"}

original: An Ineffable Quality of Geese
translation: 鹅们难以言喻的品质

original: Cuddles and Ruffles will always destroy their costumes. It's only a matter of time.
translation: 抱抱和荷叶边迟早会弄坏它们的服装。这只是时间问题。

original: An Initiate of the Cult of the Saints
translation: 圣徒异教的新教徒

original: Eleven or Twelve be their number. Crowned be their heads. All hail. All hail.
translation: 11或12是他们的数字。他们的头被加冕。万福。万福。

original: {"5":"You heave learnt the names of the Saints and drunken of the bounty of their King.","2":"You have feasted and feasted well. Gain favour with the Sanctified and the Displeased to learn the names of the Lost Saints to advance.","3":"You have spoken the names of the dead. Bring a Roll of Thirsty Bombazine to the Jolly Anchorite. And a willing crewhand.","4":"You brought sacrifice to the saints. Bring a Cask of Navarantine Gemstones, A Gourd of Chorister Nectar and a Sack of Verdant Seeds to the Jolly Anchorite.","1":"You have been initiated into the Sanctified. Provide Fuel and Supplies for a Feast."}
translation: {"5":"你已习得圣徒的名字，饮了他们国王的赏赐。","2":"你已饱食。若要学习失落的圣人的名字来推进故事，你需要取得圣化结会和不悦离人的声望。","3":"你已说出死者之名。叫上一位愿意前去的列车员，把一卷渴光的邦巴辛布带给快哉隐士。","4":"你已为圣人带来祭品。把一桶曩縛咤宝石、一瓢唱诗蜂蜜和一袋青翠的种子带给快哉隐士。","1":"你已加入了圣化结会的行列。为宴会提供燃料和补给。"}

original: An Initiate of the Displeased
translation: 不悦离人的新教徒

original: Hold no hope in the cavities of your heart.
translation: 不要在你的心腔中抱有希望。

original: {"4":"You had wasted time, the purest commodity of Albion, in service of the Displeased.","5":"You murdered the Careful Masquerader. She has taught you all that she was going to.","2":"You have betrayed the trust of the Sanctified. Gain a Royal Dispensation to advance.","1":"You have been initiated into the Displeased. Gain the trust of the Sanctified to advance.","3":"You have betrayed the confidence of Albion. Provide five Barrels of Unseasoned Hours to advance."}
translation: {"4":"你浪费了阿尔比恩至为纯粹的资源——时间——来为不悦离人服务。","5":"你谋杀了谨慎的覆面者。她已将意欲传授的一切都教给了你。","2":"你背叛了圣化结会的信任。获取一份皇家特许状来继续。","1":"你已被引入不悦离人。获得圣化结会的信任来继续。","3":"你已背叛阿尔比恩的信任。提供五桶未加工的时间来继续。"}

original: An Initiate of the Supralapsarians
translation: 先定论者的新教徒

original: For London has not risen and shall not rise. You are safe in the deep and the dark and the marvellous.
translation: 因为伦敦没有崛起，也不会崛起。在深渊、黑暗和玄妙中，你是安全的。

original: {"5":"You have understood the Word.","6":"You have denied the Word, though you understood its lesson.","1":"You have been initiated into the Supralapsarians. Bring Five Sheafs of Ministry Approved Literature to the Illuminated Archivist.","2":"You have read a little of the Word. Provide a Moment of Inspiration for the Illuminated Archivist.","4":"Discuss your progress with the Illuminated Archivist.","3":"You have studied more of the Word. Bring Supplies, A Crate of Nostalgic Crockery and A Caddy of Dried Tea to the Illuminated Archivist."}
translation: {"5":"你已经理解了圣言。","6":"你否认了圣言，尽管你理解了它的教训。","1":"你已经加入了先定论者的行列。带上五份已审批的文学作品给明光档案员。","2":"你已经读了一点圣言。为明光档案员提供一个瞬间的灵感。","4":"与明光档案员讨论你的进展。","3":"你已经学习了更多的圣言。把补给、一箱引人怀旧的瓷器和一盒干茶带给明光档案员。"}

original: An Inspector Thaws
translation: 与检察官的关系缓和

original: The Fastidious Inspector opinion of you has improved.
translation: 一丝不苟的检察官对你的评价有所提高。

original: {"1":"It's possible the Inspector is pleased. It's rather hard to tell."}
translation: {"1":"有可能检察官很高兴。这一点很难说。"}

original: {"Departure":{"1":"\"And thank you for the pleasant conversation, captain. The sky can be a lonely place. You enlivened it. I have included a small additional sum in your remuneration, as a token of my gratitude.\""}}
translation: {"Departure":{"1":"\"谢谢，和你谈话很愉快，车长。天空可是一个孤独的地方。你让它充满活力。为表示我的感激之情，我在你的报酬中额外增加了一笔小费。\""}}

original: An Unnerving Companion
translation: 令人不安的锻造同伴

original: {"Gaze":{"0":"","1":"The Companion's seedling eyes have germinated. Pale green sprouts worm their way through the delicate skin around the sockets."},"VolumePoetryPlates":{"0":"","1":"The Poetic Forged Companion becomes a literary sensation, and before long a series of commemorative plates is made in their honour. You receive an entire crate, so that at the end of every meal, the Companion's sprouting eyes stare up at you, smeared with gravy."},"Happy":{"0":"","1":"gnarled, inscrutable"},"Destroy":{"0":"","1":"and the overgrown eyes in its sunken face. The eyes remain fixed on you as you prise them from their sockets. As soon as they are free from the face, the verdant shoots wither, and go black."},"Encounter":{"0":"","1":"tendrilled"},"Encounter2":{"0":"","1":"Your first punch catches them on the cheek, a gnarled eye grazing your knuckles."},"Ridding":{"0":"","1":"tendrilled"}}
translation: {"Gaze":{"0":"","1":"锻造同伴的眼睛幼苗已经发芽了。苍绿色的嫩芽在眼眶周围的精致皮肤中蠕动。"},"VolumePoetryPlates":{"0":"","1":"诗意的锻造同伴成为文学界的轰动，不久之后，人们为他们制作了一系列的纪念版。你收到了一整箱，因此在每顿饭的最后，同伴发芽的眼睛盯着你，上面沾满了肉汁。"},"Happy":{"0":"","1":"粗糙的,神秘的"},"Destroy":{"0":"","1":"以及它沉甸甸的脸上那双长满了的眼睛。当你把它们从眼眶里抠出来时，眼睛一直盯着你。一旦它们从脸上挣脱出来，翠绿的嫩芽就会枯萎，变成黑色。""},"Encounter":{"0":"","1":"卷须的"},"Encounter2":{"0":"","1":"你的第一拳打在他们的脸颊上，一只参天的眼睛擦着你的指关节。"},"Ridding":{"0":"","1":"卷须的"}}

original: An Unwelcome Truth
translation: 一个不受欢迎的真相

original: The Amenable Host has requested your help.
translation: 随和的主管请求你的帮助。

original: {"2":"The Amenable Host would like you to remove a difficult guest from Magdalene's.","3":"You should return to the Amenable Host.","1":"The Amenable Host would like to talk to you about a difficult guest.","4":"You have done the Amenable Host a significant favour."}
translation: {"2":"随和的主管希望您能将一位难缠的客人从抹大拉之家赶走。","3":"你要回到随和的主管那里。","1":"随和的主管想和你谈谈一位难缠的客人。","4":"你已经帮了随和的主管一个大忙。"}

original: An Unwillingness to Leave
translation: 抗拒离开

original: Langley Hall draws guests and generally keeps them. Stay too long, and you might never want to leave. Or at least, always return.
translation: 兰利厅吸引着众多客人，并且能留住他们中的大多数。如果住得太久，你可能会不想离开。至少，返回此处的念头将永远萦绕在你的脑海。

original: {"1":"Your crew are growing comfortable in Langley Hall.","2":"The warmth of the Hall feels like a cosy blanket, settled around your shoulder. Outside is cold, inside is safe.","3":"Langley Hall feels increasingly like your home away from home.","4":"Why would you ever leave this place?","5":"Langley Hall is in your dreams. Each night you walk its hallways and descend its stairs."}
translation: {"1":"你的列车员在兰利厅里越来越舒服。","2":"大厅的温暖感觉就像一条舒适的毯子，裹在你的肩头。外面很冷，里面很安全。","3":"兰利厅越来越像你的家了。","4":"你为什么要离开这个地方？","5":"兰利厅就在你的梦中。每晚你都会走过它的门厅，走下它的楼梯。"}

original: {"5":"Langley Hall is in your dreams. Each night you walk its hallways and descend its stairs.","4":"When you close your eyes, you are in Langley Hall, drinking sweet wine among friends where you will always be welcome.","3":"You see the stars beyond Langley Hall when you sleep. Sometimes, in your dreams, you are restless.","2":"Langley Hall is more a memory now, something seen in the far distance, that tugs the heart like a chain.","1":"Langley Hall is fading from your mind. Sometimes your sleep is dreamless.","0":"You dream no more of Langley Hall."}
translation: {"5":"兰利厅就在你的梦中。每晚你都会走过它的门厅，走下它的楼梯。","4":"当你闭上眼睛时，你就在兰利厅，在朋友的陪伴中喝着甜酒，在那里你将永远受到欢迎。","3":"当你入眠，你看到兰利厅外的星星。有时，在你的梦中，你的心焦躁不安。","2":"兰利厅现在更像是一种记忆，在遥远的地方看到的东西，像一条链子一样牵动着心。","1":"兰利厅正在从你的脑海中消逝。有时你一夜无眠。","0":"你不再梦见兰利厅了。"}

original: Analytical Princess
translation: 理性的公主

original: A talented engineer who chose to don the immortal shed skin of the Incognito Princess.
translation: 一个有才华的工程师，选择穿上隐姓埋名的公主不朽的蜕落皮囊。

original: {"1":"You have acquired the Analytical Princess."}
translation: {"1":"你已经获得了理性的公主。"}

original: Another One, Lost
translation: 又失去了一名列车员

original: Your letters of regret are becoming rote.
translation: 你的悔恨信已经变得烂熟于心。

original: {"1":"Another crewmember, lost..."}
translation: {"1":"又失去了一名列车员……"}

original: {"Truth":{"0":"your memory of a childhood guilt that you never told anyone, petty and embarrassing.","1":"'I have let my crew die, while I lived.'","2":"'I have let my crew die, while I lived:' and then their names begin to scrawl themselves over one another like a grisly wordsearch.","12":"'I have lost count of how many of my crew have died. I cannot remember their faces.' Then the names of the crew that have died under your command begin to sear themselves into your skin, in a dense scribble."}}
translation: {"Truth":{"0":"你对童年的愧疚的记忆，你从来没有告诉过任何人，琐碎而尴尬。","1":"'我让我的列车员死去，而我却活着。","2":"'我让我的列车员死去，而我却活着：'然后他们的名字开始像一个可怕的字谜一样互相涂抹。","12":"'我已经记不清楚我的列车员死了多少人了。我不记得他们的脸。然后在你的指挥下死去的列车员的名字开始在你的皮肤上烙印，密密麻麻的涂鸦。"}}

original: Apostolic Theory
translation: 传教士理论

original: The Feckless Theologian is gathering evidence.
translation: 软弱的神学家正在收集证据。

original: {"1":"You have provided evidence in support of the Feckless Theologian's theory."}
translation: {"1":"你已经提供了支持软弱的神学家理论的证据。"}

original: {"Feckless Theologian":{"1":"“Things aren’t going as well as I’d hoped. According to the Legenda aurea, Saint John is sleeping at Ephesus until the end of the world. I suppose he means to see if he got it right in Revelation. As you may have noticed, we're not in Ephesus. But the apostles were scattered to the ends of the world. If anyone were to find their way to the stars, it would be him.\"","2":"“Thanks to you, we have evidence of cultic activity. Which, I’m sure would delight my colleague. But the iconography is distinctively Johannine. If we just had a little more - Summerset might be willing to take this seriously. Perhaps even help fund us through to the grave itself!”","3":"“We are so close, I can practically smell him! Will he thank us, I wonder? Accept us as his disciples and let us sit at his feet and hear tales of the death of saints? A cup such as the Catholics use to signify the miracle of communion. I must write to the College. Surely now, they’ll support us.”","0":"\"Tragically, things aren't going to plan. We can't afford another expedition, and so we languish here, making what we can out of what we've been able to find thus far. It will not do.\""}}
translation: {"Feckless Theologian":{"1":"“事情并没有像我希望的那样发展。据《黄金传说》所说，圣若望将在以弗所沉睡至世界的终结。我想他期望看到自己在启示录中是否说对了。正如你可能注意到的，我们并非在以弗所。但使徒们分散到世界的尽头。如果有人能找到通往恒星的路，那人一定是他。\"","2":"“多亏了你，我们有了邪教活动的证据。我确信，这会使我的同事们感到高兴的。但是，这些图画具有鲜明的约翰福音书风格。如果我们再多掌握一点--萨默塞特可能会愿意认真对待这个问题。也许甚至可以资助我们通过坟墓本身！”","3":"“我们已经非常接近了，我几乎可以闻到他的味道！他是否会感谢我们，我想知道？接受我们为他的弟子，让我们坐在他的脚下，听他讲述圣人之死的传说？一个像天主教徒用来象征圣餐奇迹的杯子。我必须给学院写信。现在，他们肯定会支持我们。”","0":"\"可悲的是，事情并没有按计划进行。我们没有能力再进行一次探险，所以我们在这里苦苦挣扎，用我们迄今为止所能找到的东西来做我们能做的事。这不可能成功。\""}}

original: Approaching Judgement Day
translation: 临近审判日

original: Soon.
translation: 很快。

translation: 被批准进入潘塞克里提斯的殿堂

original: This may be found at the Antechamber of the Pansekritis in the House of Days.
