translation: 领航员很忙

original: He's making progress without you.
translation: 没有你，他也在成事。

original: The Navigator's Friend
translation: 领航员的朋友

original: A terribly quiet chap, with adventurous dreams.
translation: 一个安静得可怕的家伙，怀着大胆的梦想。

original: {"1":"You have the corpse of the Navigator's friend.","0":"The Navigator's Friend has been given a fitting burial."}
translation: {"1":"你带着领航员朋友的尸体","0":"领航员的朋友已经得到了适当的安葬"。}

original: The Navigator's Promise
translation: 领航员的承诺

original: The Navigator made a promise. He will keep it, no matter what.
translation: 领航员做出了一个承诺。他将恪守这个诺言，无论如何。

original: {"10":"The Navigator has requested that you visit London.","50":"The Navigator would like you to help him steal his friend's body from a graveyard in Eagle's Empyrean.","1100":"The travelling magician requires a cat. It seems any will do.","1200":"You glimpsed a moment in Parabola, where every cat is a Big Cat.","20":"The Navigator has been welcomed home by his friend's mother.","40":"The Navigator made a promise to his friend when they were young.","60":"Altan's body lives with the Navigator in his cabin.","80":"The Navigator got to show Altan a battle with a monster of the skies.","90":"The Fortunate Navigator wishes to show his friend a tiger. The magician in Polmear and Plenty's might help. You'll need to go behind the big tent to speak with him.","100":"You'll need to find the travelling magician, if you wish to see a tiger. The Humiliated Magician has given you three places they might be found.","1000":"The travelling magician will meet you back at Polmear and Plenty's Inconceivable Circus. Bring money.","1400":"The Fortunate Navigator shrank from Death's Door.","70":"You can find Scorn Flukes, Senior Scriveners and Undeparted in Eleutheria.","30":"The Navigator has been given the key to Altan's family tomb, in the Eagle's Empyrean. Speak to him aboard your engine to continue.","1350":"The Fortunate Navigator has spoken with the Sedulous Devil. He knows which is the correct line for Altan to pass through Death's Door.","1300":"The Fortunate Navigator wants to take his friend to Death's Door, in the Blue Kingdom.","1600":"The Fortunate Navigator wishes to give his friend a sky burial in a Weft of Unravelling Time, found in Albion.","1700":"The Fortunate Navigator wishes to give his friend a sky burial on the Mother of Mountains, at Lustrum.","2000":"The Navigator gave his friend a sky burial in a Weft of Unravelling Time.","2100":"The Navigator gave his friend a sky burial at the Mother of Mountains."}
translation: {"10":"领航员要求你去伦敦。","50":"领航员想让你帮他从鹰之苍天上国的墓地里偷走他朋友的尸体。","1100":"巡回魔术师需要一只猫。似乎什么猫都可以。","1200":"你瞥了一眼帕布拉，里面的每只猫都是大猫。","20":"领航员受到了他朋友的母亲的欢迎。","40":"年轻时，领航员向他的朋友许下了一个承诺。","60":"阿尔坦的尸体和领航员一起待在他的车厢里。","80":"领航员向阿尔坦展示了一场与天空怪兽的搏斗。","90":"走运的领航员想向他的朋友展示一只老虎。波尔梅尔&普伦蒂的魔术师也许能帮上忙。你需要去大帐篷后面和他谈谈。","100":"如果你想看老虎，你需要找到巡回魔术师。蒙羞的魔术师给了你三个可能找到它们的地方。","1000":"巡回魔术师将在波尔梅尔&普伦蒂的不可思议马戏团与你见面。带钱来。","1400":"走运的领航员在死亡之门前退缩了。","70":"你可以在厄琉忒里亚找到轻蔑锚虫，高级纺书人和形影不离。","30":"领航员已经得到了阿尔坦家族墓的钥匙，在鹰之苍天上国。在你的车上和他说话来继续。","1350":"走运的领航员与兢兢业业的恶魔交谈过。他知道阿尔坦穿过死亡之门的正确路线","1300":"走运的领航员想把他的朋友带到蓝色王国的死亡之门。","1600":"走运的领航员希望在阿尔比恩找到解开的时间纬线，给他的朋友举行天葬。","1700":"走运的领航员希望在伍载镇的群山之母给他的朋友举行天葬。","2000":"走运的领航员希望在解开的时间纬线给他的朋友举行天葬。","2100":"走运的领航员希望在群山之母给他的朋友举行天葬。"}

original:
{"Chat":{"10":""Where am I from? Do you ask everyone that?" The Navigator laughs – he's just teasing. "No, I understand. It's the accent, isn't it? I'm an Empyrean, but my English is a Londoner's. I grew up there. Worked for the Empyreal Ambassador in London."

He straightens, proudly. "My master negotiated the deal that led to the opening of the Avid Horizon. Not many can say that."","30":""That was kind of you, Captain. I had hoped that having someone speak for me, show what I've made of myself, would help. Glad it wasn't needed, of course. But you were there in case it was."

He touches your arm. "I value that."","40":"It is hard to engage the Navigator's attention. He is rapt in thought. "Oh, the crew are doing well, Captain. They trust you. That's important."

He returns to reading, and will say nothing of himself.","60":"The body of the Navigator's friend sits in the Navigator's desk chair, by the window. The Navigator has taken a crate from the hold to serve as his own chair. 

"A good officer can always improvise!" The Navigator welcomes you into his cabin and offers you his bed to sit on. "I don't suppose you've any tweezers, have you? I keep getting splinters from my new stool." He laughs, warmly. "No matter. It's worth the discomfort. This is right."","70":""Are we close? Am I needed at my station?" The Navigator's eyes are bright; he's raring for battle. 

When you ask after the crew, his response is prepared. "I've just been round, Captain. They're as battle-ready as they'll ever be. Lead us to the fight and we'll give you our all."","80":""Oh, Captain! That was something." The Navigator is filled with nervous energy; he paces across his cabin. 

"My friend saw the whole thing – he watched from here. Saw us besting a creature vaster than us, more ancient, more experienced in surviving the inky expanse. We came together as a crew and were victorious. Truly, we are as any noble warrior."

He catches your eye and looks slightly abashed. "The crew fought well, Captain. That deserves recognition."","90":""Come in!" The Navigator has put his well-thumbed book of the 'Epic of King Gesar' to one side. He is mid-way through 'Scheherazade, or the One Thousand and One Nights'. He places a bookmark in it, and stands to greet you.

"Is there anything you miss, from before we came through? I always thought it would be the food. But it's not that. It's the stories. Before, when I read these, they needed magic to be real. Here... so much happens, they are more like someone's journal." He shrugs. "They're still exciting. But not the same."","100":""Good to see you, Captain." The Navigator's friend still sits by the window. A pillow has been placed behind his head, and a book is balanced on his lap. 

The Navigator catches your glance. "Thought I'd make him comfortable. Didn't know how long it would be till we found this magician, and his tiger." He blushes. "I haven't, ah, told the crew what we're looking for. My work needs their respect. I don't want them to think me silly."","1200":""Oh!" The Navigator hadn't responded to your knock; you'd been forced to let yourself in. He has moved his friend from the window, and was staring out of it in a reverie. "Did I thank you, Captain? For the big cat?" 

He's quiet for a long while. "Do you think all cats have that duality? That they contain two beings?" He turns to you. "Sometimes I feel like I'd have to be two people to meet the promises I made my friend. I still have to try, though. Because I love him. I have to try."","1300":"The Navigator reports on the crew the moment you enter. "I  haven't told them I requested we visit Death's Door. They wouldn't thank me. But they have noticed a change, despite my efforts. A stoker said I seemed 'determined'. 'Calmer'. That sounds like a good thing.

"There's something relaxing about having made a decision." He smiles fondly as he looks towards his friend, currently lying in his bunk. "No matter what it is."","1400":""Please, come in." The Navigator is quiet, and focused. He responds to your questions formally, providing concise and accurate details of the state of the crew and the engine. He steers away from anything about himself. 

As you leave, he meets your eye. "Does Death's Door wait for us all? I have to hope not. It's almost enough to make me devout, if it would give me a choice."","0":""I'm settling in nicely, thank you. You've a good crew here. And a sharp one. They've already realised it's wise not to bet against me at cards." 

He grins. "They demanded I stop being easy on them. They can tell when I aim to lose. I'm not an excellent liar."","50":""Have you ever made a promise, certain at the time you wouldn't be able to keep it? I've been thinking about it, ethically." There's a small pile of philosophy books by his bed. He must have found them at last port.

"I swore to my friend, so that he could die happy. Would he really mind if I failed him? I don't think that matters. He always trusted me. I couldn't live with letting him down."

It seems like your First Officer will not be able to focus until he has been to Eagle's Empyrean.","1700":""Are we making progress to Lustrum, Captain?" The Navigator is eager, but not anxious. "I am not eager to part with my oldest friend, but I've made a decision. The time has come to move on."

He is calmer than you have seen him. When you ask why, he is straightforward. "I've decided to believe that you can earn your own death. I will grant my friend the burial he deserves, then will live the best life I can." He laughs. "It was that, or to go mad."","1600":""Are we making progress to a Weft, Captain?" The Navigator is eager, but not anxious. "I am not eager to part with my oldest friend, but I've made a decision. The time has come to move on."

He is calmer than you have seen him. When you ask why, he is straightforward. "I've decided to believe that you can earn your own death. I will grant my friend the burial he deserves, then will live the best life I can." He laughs. "It was that, or to go mad."","2000":"The Navigator begins with a run down of the state of the crew. It is both concise, and thorough. He requests an update of your own status – that he might assist were you indisposed. Work done, he relaxes.

"Are you fond of poker, Captain? I hear a game has been arranged for after the shift change. We could join in. It would be interesting to see whether my luck holds.

"Otherwise, of course, if you wanted to take the engine exploring, I'm ready to plot a course. I'm up for any adventure." Did he actually wink?"},"Mother":{"0":"Mother","10":"The house is small, but is in an expensive location. It is well-kept: the windows are clean, the steps freshly swept. Asphodel is flourishing in an urn by the steps.

"It still feels like home." The Navigator gazes at the front door. "It feels strange to know I'm just visiting."","20":"The Grieving Matriarch is determined you'll join her for tea. She even refuses to let the servants assist. She is rushing towards the kitchen when the Navigator intervenes.

"We can't stay long. I mustn't impose on the captain. I promise I'll come back soon." He draws the Matriarch close, and lowers his voice. "I came to ask... May I borrow the key? I haven't been able to pay my respects." 

The Grieving Matriarch looks mortified."},"Magician":{"0":"Magician","1000":""I've surpassed my father, you know. And he could fill Mahogany Hall." She pats the Navigator's arm. "I'm certainly the only person who could do this as cheaply, and with as few accoutrements.

"In fact, I only need one more thing." She beams and looks at you, expectantly.","1100":"Miss Peppercorn stands by the brass framed mirror. While she waits for you to procure a cat, she practices sleight of hand. 

She is currently making a cane appear from thin air. The ease with which she makes it appear and disappear is in marked contrast to her fumbles as she tries to twirl it dramatically."},"Chat1":{"0":""I'm settling in nicely, thank you, Captain. You've a good crew here. And a sharp one." The Navigator already has visited every crewmember at their station.","30":"The Navigator takes his feet off his desk when you enter his cabin. He's been reading the Epic of King Gesar. "I always could get lost in it. Now, rereading it feels... more important."","1400":"The Navigator doesn't react when you knock. When you enter without permission, he apologises. "Sorry, Captain. I was thinking."","10":"The Navigator takes his feet off his desk when you enter his cabin. He's been reading. "I didn't realise how much I missed reading."","1300":"The Navigator is sitting at his desk. He holds up the Epic of King Gesar. "I've been reading it aloud to Altan. Figured it was finally my turn."","60":"The Navigator is sitting on his bunk – it's the only available seat. He holds up the Epic of King Gesar. "I've been reading it to Altan. Figured it was finally my turn.""}}
translation:
{"Chat":{"10":""我来自哪里？你会问每个人这个问题吗？"领航员笑了笑——他只是在跟你打趣，"不，我明白，是口音的问题，对吧？我是上国人，但我说的是伦敦腔的英语。我是在伦敦长大的，曾为上国驻伦敦大使馆工作。"

他挺直了身子，自豪地说："我的主人促成了使渴求之地平线开启的协定。世上能这么说的人可不多。"","30":""你那样做真是太好了，车长。我原本希望有人能替我说说话，展示我如今的样子，这样可能会比较好。当然，最后不需要也好。但你能在那儿，我很感激。"

他轻轻碰了碰你的手臂，"我很珍视这一点。"","40":"要引起领航员的注意不太容易。他陷入了沉思。"哦，列车员们很好，车长。他们信任你。那很重要。"

他重新投入到书中，不愿谈及自己。","60":"领航员的朋友的尸体坐在窗边的书桌椅上。领航员从货舱搬来一个箱子当作自己的椅子。

"一个好车务官总能即兴应变！"领航员欢迎你进入他的舱室，还请你坐到他的床上。"你有没有镊子？我坐这个新凳子总扎刺。"他愉快地笑着。"不过无所谓。这点不适我受得了。这是对的。"","70":""快到了吗？我该回我的岗上了吗？"领航员双眼发亮，急切地等待战斗。

当你问及列车员时，他早已准备好回答。"我刚刚巡视过，车长。他们已经做好了最充分的战斗准备。带我们去战斗吧，我们会全力以赴。"","80":""哦，车长！真是了不起的一战。"领航员浑身紧绷，在舱室里踱来踱去。

"我的朋友看到了全过程——他就在这儿目睹我们击败了一个比我们庞大、古老、在这片墨黑虚空中更为老练的存在。我们团结一心，最终取得胜利。我们堪比任何贵族战士。"

他与你对视时有些羞涩地低下头："列车员们打得很好，车长。他们值得被表彰。"","90":""进来吧！"领航员将翻得起皱的《格萨尔王史诗》放到一边，正在读《一千零一夜》。他插上书签，起身迎接你。

"你有没有怀念以前的生活？我一直以为我最怀念的是食物。但其实不是。是那些故事。以前读这些时，它们要靠魔法才变得真实。而在这里……发生的事情太多，这些故事更像是别人的日记。”他耸耸肩。“它们依然精彩。但感觉不同了。"","100":""很高兴见到你，车长。"领航员的朋友仍坐在窗边。头后放了一个枕头，腿上放着一本书。

领航员注意到你的目光。"我想让他舒服点。我不知道我们什么时候才能找到那位魔术师，还有他的老虎。"他脸红了，"我还没，嗯，告诉列车员我们在找什么。我的工作依赖于他们的尊敬。我不希望他们觉得我幼稚。"","1200":""哦！"你敲门他没应，最后你只好自己进来。他已经把朋友从窗边挪开，自己却正沉思地望着窗外。"我有没有谢谢你，车长？为了那只大猫？" 

他沉默了一会儿。"你觉得所有的猫都有双重性吗？它们体内有两个存在？"他转向你，"有时我觉得我也要变成两个人，才能实现对朋友做出的承诺。但我必须努力。因为我爱他。我必须努力。"","1300":"你一进门，领航员便汇报起列车员的状况："我还没告诉他们，是我要求去死亡之门的。他们不会对这一决定感到感激。但尽管我努力掩饰，他们还是察觉到我变了。一个司炉说我看起来‘坚定’、‘更平静’。听上去像是件好事。"

"做出决定本身就有种让人安心的感觉。"他温柔地看着床上的朋友，"无论那个决定是什么。"","1400":""请进。"领航员语气平静，神情专注。他以正式的语气回答你的提问，简洁准确地说明列车员与机车的状况。他避开一切与自己有关的话题。

你准备离开时，他与你对视："死亡之门会为我们所有人敞开吗？我只能祈祷不会。若信仰能让我做出选择，恐怕我都要开始信教了。"","0":""我过得还不错，谢谢你。你这里的列车员很不错，而且很聪明。他们已经意识到，在玩牌时不要和我打赌比较明智。" 

他咧嘴一笑："他们还要我别再放水了。他们能看出来我什么时候故意输。我不太擅长撒谎。"","50":""你有没有立过一个你明知道自己可能做不到的承诺？我最近一直在想这件事，考虑这方面的伦理问题。"他床边有一小堆哲学书，看来是在上一个车站找到的。

"我向我朋友起过誓，只为了让他能安心离去。他真的会介意我没做到吗？我觉得那不重要。他一直都信任我。我不能忍受让他失望。"

看起来你的大副直到去过雄鹰之苍天上国之前都无法专心。","1700":""我们离伍载镇还有多远，车长？"领航员充满期待，却并不焦虑。"我并不渴望与我最亲密的朋友告别，但我已经做出了决定。是时候向前走了。"

他比你以往见过的都要平静。当你问他原因时，他坦率地说："我决定相信，人可以赢得属于自己的死亡。我会给我的朋友一个应得的葬礼，然后过上我能过的最好的人生。"他笑了笑，"不然的话，我可能会疯掉。"","1600":""我们离纬线还有多远，车长？"领航员充满期待，却并不焦虑。"我并不渴望与我最亲密的朋友告别，但我已经做出了决定。是时候向前走了。"

他比你以往见过的都要平静。当你问他原因时，他坦率地说："我决定相信，人可以赢得属于自己的死亡。我会给我的朋友一个应得的葬礼，然后过上我能过的最好的人生。"他笑了笑，"不然的话，我可能会疯掉。"","2000":"领航员一开始便简明扼要地报告列车员状况。他要求了解你的状态——以便在你不适时提供协助。工作结束后，他放松下来。

"你喜欢扑克吗，车长？我听说换班后有一场游戏要开。我们可以一起去。看看我的运气是否还在。"

"当然，如果你想带机车去探险，我也可以马上设定航线。我随时准备好迎接冒险。"他刚才是不是在对你挤眉弄眼？"},"Mother":{"0":"母亲","10":"房子不大，但位于昂贵的地段。维护得很好：窗明几净，台阶刚打扫过。台阶旁的瓮中盛放着盛开的水仙花。

"这里依然有家的感觉。"领航员凝望着前门，"只是一想到我如今只是个访客，便感觉有些奇怪。"","20":"悲伤的族母坚持要你留下喝茶。她甚至不让仆人帮忙，自己匆匆忙忙地往厨房去，这时领航员拦住了她。

"我们不能久留。我不能给车长添麻烦。我保证很快会回来。\他把族母拉近些，压低声音说："我来是问您……能把钥匙借给我吗？我还没能去致敬。" 

悲伤的族母看上去很羞愧。"},"Magician":{"0":"魔术师","1000":""我已经超过我父亲了，你知道吗？他可是能让桃花心木厅座无虚席的人。"她拍了拍领航员的手臂，"我是唯一能用这么少的道具、花这么少的钱做到这一点的人。"

"事实上，我只还需要一样东西。"她满脸笑容地看着你，充满期待。","1100":"派伯康小姐站在一面黄铜边框的镜子旁。等待你带来一只猫的间隙，她在练习障眼法。

她现在正在凭空变出一根手杖。她变出又消失的动作行云流水，与她试图旋转手杖时的笨拙形成鲜明对比。"},"Chat1":{"0":""我已经适应得很好了，谢谢你，车长。你的列车员都很棒，也都很聪明。"领航员已经拜访过每一位列车员了。","30":"你走进他的舱室时，领航员放下了搁在桌上的双脚。他正在读《格萨尔王史诗》。"我总会在这本书里迷失自己。现在重读它……感觉更加重要了。"","1400":"你敲门时，领航员没有反应。你未经许可走进去，他才回过神来。"对不起，船长。我刚才在走神。"","10":"你走进他的舱室时，领航员放下了搁在桌上的双脚。他正在看书。"我没意识到自己有多怀念读书这件事。"","1300":"领航员坐在桌边。他举起手中的《格萨尔王史诗》："我一直在读给阿尔坦听。我想，是时候轮到我了。"","60":"领航员坐在铺位上——那是唯一的座位。他举起手中的《格萨尔王史诗》："我一直在读给阿尔坦听。我想，是时候轮到我了。""}}

original: The New Street Line's Gratitude
translation: 新巷线的感激

original: You have assisted the New Street Line with their endeavours.
translation: 你协助了新巷线的工作。

original: The Next Petition
translation: 下一份请愿

original: The Nun's Story
translation: 修女的故事

original: What really happened to keep her from passing through the Avid Horizon?
translation: 到底发生了什么事，使得她无法通过渴求之地平线？

original: {"1":"Go the Most Serene Mausoleum to find the convent the nun was travelling to.","10":"You have gathered information on the nun."}
translation: {"1":"去圣宁墓，找到修女所去的修道院。","10":"你已经收集了关于该修女的信息。"}

original: The Ombudsman is gone
translation: 监察员离开了

original: The 'Osiris' Patented Divider
translation: “奥西里斯”牌专利分割器

original: A wheeze of the renowned Blue Kingdom expert, Sir Francis FitzWilliam, this ingenious cannery cuts every morsel into exactly thirteen parts, and comes equipped with its own set of glass jars for easy collection.
translation: 著名蓝色王国专家弗朗西斯·菲茨威廉爵士的灵光一现。这款巧妙的装罐工具能将每一块肉精确切割为十三份，并配备专用玻璃罐，便于收集封存。

original: The Pain Experienced at Apogee
translation: 在 顶 峰 所 经 历 的 痛 苦

original: It quivers and burns in your vision.
translation: 它在你的视野中摇曳燃烧。

original: {"1":"You have found this sigil."}
translation: {"1":"你找到了这个符印。"}

original: The Pardoner's Tale
translation: 赦免者的说辞

original: The Acting Senior Probiter requested your aid in granting the single Pardon he'd been issued.
translation: 代理高级检察官请求你帮助他使用所得到的唯一赦免。

original: {"1":"The Acting Senior Probiter wants your help in pardoning a detainee.","4":"You have made your interviews. Time for a judgement.","10":"You pardoned a former courtier.","40":"You decided no one was worthy of pardon. All shall remain on the Avid Horizon.","20":"You pardoned a listless aristocrat.","30":"You pardoned a nun."}
translation: {"1":"代理高级检察官请求你协助赦免一名囚徒","4":"审讯已毕，裁决当行","10":"你赦免了昔日廷臣","40":"你裁定无人值得赦免。三人应继续关押在渴求之地平线","20":"你赦免了颓唐贵族","30":"你赦免了修女"}

original: The Parsimonious Chairman's Commission
translation: 吝啬鬼主席的委托

original: You have been commissioned to hunt Tackety ships in the Reach and retrieve their mangled name plates.
translation: 你受命在外野追捕钉鞋党的船只，并取回它们残破的铭牌。

original: {"1":"You've been tasked with hunting down Tackety engines for the Windward Company."}
translation: {"1":"你的任务是为迎风公司猎取钉鞋党的机车。"}

original: The Parsimonious Chairman's Delight
translation: 吝啬鬼主席的欢喜

original: An influential Company figure at Port Prosper. He will reward you for bringing him the nameplates of destroyed Tackety engines.
translation: 兴荣港的公司要员，权势显赫。将损毁的钉鞋党机车铭牌带给他以换取酬谢。

original: {"2":"You accepted his offer to hunt Tackety locomotives and bring their nameplates to him.","1":"You declined his offer, but his door is always open.","3":"You are earning the Chairman's favour."}
translation: {"2":"你接受了他的提议，开始猎取钉鞋党机车并将它们的铭牌带回。","1":"你拒绝了他的提议，但他的大门永远是敞开的。","3":"你正在赢得主席的青睐。"}

original: {"1":"You have used up a little of the Chairman's favour.","0":"You have used up the Chairman's favour."}
translation: {"1":"你略微消耗了主席的青睐。","0":"你已耗尽主席的青睐。"}

original: The Party Goes On
translation: 聚会继续

original: It's time to leave. But the party will still be going when you return.
translation: 是时候离开了。但当你回来时，聚会仍将继续。

original: {"1":"It's time to leave Langley Hall."}
translation: {"1":"是时候离开兰利厅了。"}

original: The Patchwork Devil
translation: 拼凑的魔鬼

original: A Patchwork Devil from Worlebury wishes to join the congregation at the Well of the Wolf.
translation: 来自滨海沃伯瑞的拼凑的魔鬼希望加入狼之井的会众

original: {"100":"The Patchwork Devil has joined the choir-congregation at the Well of the Wolf.","10":"You have agreed to take a Patchwork Devil to the Well of the Wolf, in Albion.","20":"The Patchwork Devil has asked you to bring her a chorister bee. You'll need to defeat a swarm in battle and lure one into a cage with nectar.","30":"You have captured a live chorister bee for the Patchwork Devil. Return to the Well of the Wolf."}
translation: {"100":"拼凑的魔鬼已加入狼之井的唱诗班集会。","10":"你已同意将拼凑的魔鬼带往阿尔比恩的狼之井。","20":"拼凑的魔鬼要求你带给她一只唱诗蜂。你需要在战斗中击败蜂群，并用唱诗蜂蜜将其中一只诱入笼中。","30":"你已为拼凑的魔鬼捕获一只活体唱诗蜂。返回狼之井。"}

original: The Pensive Clown's Comfort
translation: 忧郁的小丑的抚慰

original: How is he faring at the circus?
translation: 他在马戏团的表现如何？

original: The Pernickety Factor
translation: 挑剔的代理人

original: She has very precise tastes in tea, tea houses and tea cups. She is seeking several missing colonists.
translation: 她对茶、茶馆和茶杯的品味非常挑剔。她正在寻找几名失踪的殖民者。

original: {"1":"The Pernickety Factor is aboard your locomotive.","0":"The Pernickety Factor is gone."}
translation: {"1":"挑剔的代理人在你的机车上.","0":"挑剔的代理人离开了."}

original: The Petals Close
translation: 花瓣闭合

original: The flowers of the fields are not always in bloom.
translation: 田野里的花朵并不是常开的。

original: The Petrichor Price
translation: 石之灵液的价格

original: The Philosophy of Culmination
translation: 终焉哲学

original: You have agreed to help the Arbiter of Fates establish an embassy in the Reach.
translation: 你已经同意帮助命运仲裁者在外野建立大使馆。

original: {"3":"You have helped the Orator establish an embassy in Hybras. Now you can help him expand it.","2":"You must take the Mesmeric Orator to establish an embassy in Hybras.","1":"You have agreed to help the Arbiter of Fates establish an embassy in the Reach. You can meet her chosen diplomat, the Mesmeric Orator, in Death's Doorstop."}
translation: {"3":"你已经帮演说家在海波拉建立了一个大使馆。现在你可以帮忙发展它。","2":"你必须带上煽惑人心的演说家去海波拉建立大使馆","1":"你已经同意帮命运仲裁者在外野建立一个大使馆。你可以在死亡之门见到她选中的外交官，煽惑人心的演说家。}

original: {"quest_description":{"1":"","2":"","3":"","4":"","5":"","6":"","0":" \"There is a reason I have agreed to meet with you, traveller, despite our disparity in stature. I have a request.\""},"meeting_description":{"0":"\"The Arbiter of Fates has expressed an interest in meeting you also,\" says the Carefree Attendant. \"I trust I need not tell you the magnitude of the honour. But if you saw her in your current form, you would unravel. Follow me.\"","1":"\"The Arbiter of Fates has not tired of you yet,\" says the Carefree Attendant. \"A meeting can be arranged, but first you must take a more durable shape. Follow me.\""}}
translation: {"quest_description":{"1":"","2":"","3":"","4":"","5":"","6":"","0":" \"旅行者，我能无视你我之间的地位差异屈尊与你见面，是有理由的。我有一个请求。\""},"meeting_description":{"0":"\"命运仲裁者也表示有兴趣见你，\"无忧的侍从说道，\"我相信无需赘述这份殊荣的伟大。但如果你以现在的形态见她，你肯定会崩溃的。随我来。\"","1":"\"命运仲裁者还没有厌倦你，\"无忧的侍从说道，\"我可以安排见面，但你得先让自己变得更强健。随我来。\""}}

original: The Phlegmatic Researcher's Current Requests
translation: 淡漠的研究员目前的请求

original: What does he require for his research?
translation: 他的研究需要什么？

original: The Phlegmatic Researcher's Study into a Peculiar Malady
translation: 淡漠的研究员对一种奇特疾病的研究

original: All of his colleagues fell mysteriously ill. He wants to know why.
translation: 他所有的同事都神秘地病倒了。他想知道为什么。

original: {"1":"The Phlegmatic Researcher has requested a crate of munitions.","5":"Explore the Reserve in search of the cause of the scientists' obsessions.","40":"Take what you've found to the Phlegmatic Researcher.","50":"You helped the Phlegmatic Researcher identify what had caused the obsessions in his Colleagues."}
translation: {"1":"淡漠的研究员需要一箱弹药。","5":"探索保护区，寻找科学家痴迷的原因。","40":"把你发现的东西交给淡漠的研究员。","50":"你帮助淡漠的研究员确定了导致他的同事们产生痴迷的原因。"}

original: The Political Machine
translation: 政治机器

original: Your secretaries go about their business
translation: 你的秘书们着手于他们自己的事

original: {"0":"The political machine grinds on..."}
{"0":"The political machine grinds on..."}
The Popular Portraitist
translation: 受欢迎的肖像画家

original: His art is appreciated by some in the most fashionable sets.
translation: 他的艺术为一些最时尚的群体所青睐。

original: The Porphyry Court's Gratitude
translation: 斑岩大厅的感激

original: Approval from the Devils in the Toll-Tower.
translation: 来自渡灵塔中恶魔的批准

original: Available at the Court of Porphyry and Brass.
translation: 可以在黄铜斑岩法院获取

original: The Portrait of the Unseen Queen
translation: 无形女王的肖像

original: A silver-framed portrait hanging outside the door to your quarters. It depicts a noblewoman, face scratched out, sitting beneath a crescent moon. Your crew don't like it when you while away the hours in conversation with her.
translation: 一幅银框画像正挂在你的宿舍门外。它描摹了一位贵妇人，脸上带着擦伤，坐在新月之下。你豪掷了几个小时用来同她闲聊，而你的列车员对此并不乐见。

original: {"1":"You have the Portrait of the Unseen Queen.","0":"The Portrait of the Unseen Queen is gone."}
translation: {"1":"你持有无形女王的肖像。","0":"无形女王的肖像消失了。"}

original: {"0":"The portrait has changed."}
translation: {"0":"肖像已经变了。"}

original: The Priest is Triumphant
translation: 神父胜利了

original: {"wellmouth_desc":{"0":"Most of the silhouettes in the snow are statues, cracked and mutilated by age. A few are not statues but gaunt women in mourning veils, who skitter suddenly into motion as you come near, and fall into silent line behind you.","1":"After their bloody victory, the Psalmists have moved into the village. They are in the process of tearing down the innumerable age-ravaged statues, clearing the streets of snow, and hacking farm-plots in the frozen soil."}}
translation: {"wellmouth_desc":{"0":"雪地中的大多数身影都是因年久失修而龟裂、残破的雕像。细看起来，其中有些并非雕像，而是身形消瘦、身披丧纱的寡妇。当你靠近时，她们骤然动了起来，悄然无声地跟在你身后排成一列。","1":"在那场血腥的胜利之后，诗篇信徒进驻了村庄。他们正着手拆除无数因年代久远而破损的雕像，清理街道上的积雪，并在冰冻的土壤中开辟农地。"}}

original: The Princess' End
translation: 公主的结局

original: The Princess is Busy
translation: 公主在忙

original: The Princess is working her salon. It is for someone's benefit, but possibly not you nor the attendants.
translation: 公主正在她的沙龙工作。这是为了某人的利益，但可能不是你或服务员。

original: The Princess Recruited
translation: 公主被招募了

original: The Professor's Progress
translation: 教授的进展

original: {"Telescope":{"0":"'Nothing to report. Another day twiddling my thumbs. Hurry up and get me a permit from the Ministry if you want to actually learn something, you idle sot. Yours, the Professor.'","1":"'Progress! Slow and inexorable as the spinning of a spider's web, but progress all the same. A stray observation based on the patches of luminosity in the sky, and the correspondent darkness between others. The constellations are politic.'","2":"'A thought that has stricken me. Felled me almost. If the stars in their conjunctions are alliances, if the chain is across as well as above and below, what we have is in fact, a lattice. A matrix, if you will. A web.'","3":"'There are old prayers. I was thinking about this the other night, when I was at the telescope, alone. The other lazy blighters were long abed. And I was gazing up, where the stars lie enmeshed in their webs, like flies spun in silk, but who eats them? What spiders might crawl on what terrible legs and creep about the heavens, dangling on Correspondence like thread, inching closer and closer to their incandescent meat. But, of course, there are no such spiders. Unless they were introduced. And how do spiders breed, why, they lay eggs! A second thought: to whom, in this event, would the spiders pray?'"}}
translation: {"Telescope":{"0":"'无事可报。又是无所事事的一天。你这懒鬼，要是真想学点东西，就赶快去从公德部那里给我弄份许可来。此致，教授。'","1":"'有进展了！就像蜘蛛结网一样缓慢而不可阻挡，但进展毕竟是进展。一次偶然的观测记录了天空中明亮斑块的分布，以及其间对应的黑暗。星座之中存有政治。'","2":"'我突然产生了一个几乎让我瘫倒的念头。如果星辰之间的连结是一种联盟，如果巨链贯穿上下，那么我们所拥有的其实是一个格子。或者说，一个矩阵。一个网络。'","3":"'我知道一些古老的祷文。前些夜里我独自在望远镜前时想到的——其他那群懒骨头早早就去睡了。我一个人仰望星空，那些星辰被困在网中，如同蚊蝇缠绕于丝中。但又是谁吃掉它们？是哪些蜘蛛，长着可怖的腿，在天穹之上蠕行，借着信符的蛛丝悬挂前行，缓缓靠近它们那炽热的肉食？当然了，这世上是没有这种蜘蛛的……除非，它们是被引入的。蜘蛛如何繁殖？没错，它们产卵！第二个念头是：若真如此，这些蜘蛛又会向谁祷告？'"}}

original: The Psalmists are at the Well
translation: 诗篇信徒们在井边

original: The Psalmists are doomed
translation: 诗篇信徒灭亡了

translation: 诗篇信徒们的库存

translation: 诗篇信徒们总共需要20份补给。

original: The Psalmists' Strength
translation: 诗篇信徒们的力量

original: The Psalmists are rebuilding their church, but they can't recover their numbers. That's where you come in.
translation: 诗篇信徒们正重建他们的教会，但他们已经无力把信徒的人数恢复如初。你正是为此介入进来。

original: {"1":"The Psalmists' Strength is still very low. They may not survive another battle with the Widows.","2":"The Psalmists are back to their previous strength, but the Widows still outnumber them.","3":"The Psalmists' Strength is greater than ever before.","4":"The Psalmists' Strength is greater than ever before. They can overwhelm the Widows with sheer force of numbers."}
translation: {"1":"诗篇信徒们的力量仍然很弱。他们可能无法在与寡妇们的另一场战斗中幸存下来。","2":"诗篇信徒们恢复了他们以前的实力，但寡妇们的数量仍然超过他们。","3":"诗篇信徒们的力量比以前更强大。","4":"诗篇信徒们的力量比以前更强大。他们能以纯粹的人数优势压倒寡妇。"}

They may not survive another battle with the Widows.","2":"The Psalmists are back to their previous strength, but the Widows still outnumber them.","0":"You have not yet delivered any new followers to the Psalmists.","3":"The Psalmists' Strength is greater than it was. original: The Rat Brigade
translation: 老鼠大队

original: Scarper, lads. They've got guns!
translation: 伙计们，跑。他们有枪！

original: {"1":"You've recruited the Rat Brigade."}
translation: {"1":"你已经招募了老鼠大队。"}

original: The Ratronaut
translation: 宇航鼠

original: An intrepid and besuited daredevil, eager to prove its mettle out among the stars. Partial to Camembert.
translation: 一名无畏的敢死队员，它穿戴齐全，渴望在群星间证明自己的能力。它偏爱卡门贝尔奶酪。

original: The Ratty Reunion
translation: 团聚的鼠群

original: The Rat Brigade: mostly back together again, and causing thrice as much havoc. Luckily they're on your side.
translation: 老鼠大队：大部分的队员又重新团聚在了一起，搞出了三倍的乱子。幸运的是，它们站在你这一边。

original: {"1":"The Ratty Reunion will work on your locomotive."}
translation: {"1":"团聚的鼠群将在你的机车上工作。"}

original: The Ratty Revengers
translation: 复仇的鼠群

original: The meanest rats you're ever likely to meet this side of the Avid Horizon.
translation: 在渴求之地平线的这一侧，它们很可能就是你有望见到的最凶恶的老鼠了。

original: {"1":"The Ratty Revengers will work on your locomotive."}
translation: {"1":"复仇的鼠群将在你的机车上工作。"}

original: The Reformer is Imprisoned
translation: 无畏的改过者被囚禁

original: The Reformer's Secret
translation: 无畏的改过者的秘密

original: A depraver of worlds, an architect of extinctions: It transpires that the Gallant Reformer was once someone else entirely.
translation: 一位世界的破坏者，一位毁灭的缔造者。从前，无畏的改过者曾经是一个完全不同的人。

original: The Regent's Grave
translation: 摄政王之墓

original: Who lies at the centre of the wood? What do you believe?
translation: 位于树林中心的是谁？你怎么想？

original: {"2":"The evidence is in the Dismal Paleographer's favour. Summerset must take notice.","3":"The evidence is in the Vituperative Classicist's favour. Summerset must take notice.","4":"The evidence is in the Feckless Theologian's favour. Summerset must take notice.","5":"The secret of the barrow has been revealed. Who was right, in the end?","1":"You have encountered the academics of Traitor's Wood and learned of the king in the Regent's Grave,"}
translation: {"2":"证据对阴郁的古物学家有利。夏暮学院必会注意到。","3":"证据对挑剔的古典学者有利。夏暮学院必会注意到。","4":"证据对软弱的神学家有利。夏暮学院必会注意到。","5":"古墓的秘密被揭开了。到底谁才是正确的？","1":"你遇到了叛徒之林的学者，并得知了摄政王之墓中的国王，"}

original: {"BaseCamp":{"0":"BaseCamp","1":"The fire is low, fuelled only by damp twigs and the occasional monograph when someone thinks the others aren’t looking. The scholars cast mournful glances between the trees, ignoring their sodden equipment and dwindling supplies.","2":"The camp is abuzz with activity. Errant young medievalists flood the grove, busying themselves erecting tents and arguing the finer points of the ablative case. The Dismal Paleographer looks almost happy, lecturing his new flock on the principles of Chivalry and Feudalism. The Vituperative Classicist glowers by the fire. The Feckless Theologian looks tremendously put out.","3":"Young classicists in all manner of improbable costumes parade about the fire, sharing amphorae of wine, and quoting the worst bits of Catullus. The Vituperative Classicist charges about the place, correcting translations and cutting down theories. She is enormously enjoying herself. The Dismal Paleographer and the Feckless Theologian shiver by the fire, pointedly ignoring each other.","4":"The camp is alive with plainsong. Hymns sound through the incense-choked trees. Young theologians have converged on Traitor's Wood, debating the respective merits of Boethius and Aquinas. The Feckless Theologian is in the thick of the activity, providing wine and commentaries on the most daring heresies. The Vituperative Classicist and the Dismal Theologian sit at opposite ends of the camp, scowling at their gathered piles of evidence.","5":"The camp is deserted. A cold wind blows the ashes off the campfire. A few torn pages from a monograph, remorselessly scribbled over, are torn away. A nightingale calls from somewhere in the dark wood. Rain is beginning to fall, washing away the detritus left behind."},"Dismal Paleographer":{"0":"Dismal Paleographer","1":"“It is good to have another face about. I am heartily sick to death of that pair, and not for the first time. They are convinced of such utter rot. Any fool could tell you that this forest is the resting place of Charlemagne. Every legend and romance I’ve read convinces me of it.”","3":"“Ghastly, isn’t it? I’ve never been able to abide classicists. They’re entirely dogmatic about their Latin, and have never read anything besides Homer and Virgil. And she’s holding court, of course. Just like back when - well. But surely you can see it’s all for nothing? There’s absolutely no way Inanna is here. After all, the whole ruddy point of the legend is she gets up again!”","4":"“This is intolerable. If they’re not butchering poor Aquinas, they’re drinking themselves senseless. And I cannot imagine the nerve of that - that creature - to lecture anyone on sin and virtue! Leave them alone with enough wine, and they’ll soon forget all about Saint John and the barrow. That’s the whole problem with theology - it doesn’t have to prove anything!”","2":"“You see the dividends our work has produced! I have students of my own! Stipends! Grants! Though - between you and me - the College has not sent its best. And not nearly enough funds to cover further exploration. But we are making progress. My Charlemagne will be woken soon enough. And you shall have the credit of helping me find him.”"},"Vituperative Classicist":{"0":"Vituperative Classicist","1":"“We’ve been here positively months and have nothing to show for it. We’re all but out of funds. I’ve done my bit, making sure the other two can never be taken seriously again  - but we’ve no money for supplies for ventures into the wood. We believe the barrow is the resting place of a legendary monarch. We just can’t agree on which.”","2":"“You know I hold you responsible for this sepulchral bacchanalia.” She sniffs. “God, medievalists. Never seen so many corpses still walking about, and I’ve been to the Tomb-Colonies thrice. I simply cannot bear to see that fourth rate practitioner of a third rate discipline triumph.”","3":"“It's good to see you! Your work in the woods has borne fruit. Summerset has sent me students - and funds - though, of course, not enough to mount another expedition. But that they’re willing to invest at all suggests they’re intrigued by what I’m - we’re - finding here. We shall find her, you and I, and her songs will sound in the heavens again.”","4":"“Must he carry on so ridiculously? Well, of course he must. God forbid restraint ever enter his stupid head. They’re all prim and proper now,  of course, these awful milk and wafer students – but I know a bacchanal in the making when I see one.”"},"Feckless Theologian":{"0":"Feckless Theologian","1":"“Thank Christ. Someone new. We’ve been trying to reach that tomb on the hill for positively forever. It’s on the far side of the wood, and we’re rather strapped for cash. Summerset’s refusing to send us a penny more for another expedition. They did not appreciate my last monograph. Apparently I brought infamy to the college. I was merely reflecting on our student days.”","2":"“If another snot-nosed professor emeritus in the making explains to me the origin of St John’s cult in Milan, I shall scream. I shall be so cross if he’s right. Although I must say, it's been nice to hear him singing the Song of Roland again. He has a very nice voice, and that was one of his favourites, once.”","3":"“I’m glad someone’s decided to talk to me, at least. I’m waiting to see how long it’ll take her acolytes to realise how pig-headed she is. If I have to hear another lecture on the similarities between the greek heroes and the saints, however, I shall scream and scream until Saint John gets out of his grave by himself.”","4":"“Summerset’s been so excited by our findings they’ve sent me students! And a little money  – for their upkeep – and for an a proper study of our findings. Not enough for another expedition, of course. Too much material evidence frightens them. The Dean was an archaeologist, I think. He has quite a horror for it now. “"},"The Wood":{"0":"The Wood","1":"The Wood is vast and dark. Its silences are split by only the occasional downpour of rain from a passing stellar drift. Heavy firs bend in the wind. The Regent’s Grave broods over the forest from its high place.","3":"A bell sounds in the wood. The scent of incense and lotus carries with the breeze. The bronze of the Regent’s Grave shines in reflected starlight.","4":"Tall cedars bend before a fierce wind. The scent of sand carries from a nearby riverbed. The bulk of the Regent’s Grave casts long golden shadows across the brooding wood.","2":"Dark trees shrouded in snow sway in fierce winds. A horn sounds deep in the wood. The stones of the Regent’s Grave are dark like slate stained with the blood of felled kings."}}
translation: {"BaseCamp":{"0":"BaseCamp","1":"篝火几乎熄灭，仅靠潮湿的枯枝和偶尔有人趁他人不注意时丢进去的专著维持火势。学者们在林间投来忧伤的目光，任由设备被雨水浸透，补给渐渐耗尽。","2":"营地里一片喧嚣。稚气未脱的中世纪研究者挤满林间空地，忙着搭帐篷，并为夺格变化的细微差别争得面红耳赤。阴郁的古物学家看起来几乎称得上愉快，正向他的新门徒讲授骑士精神与封建主义的基本原则。挑剔的古典学者在火边怒目而视，软弱的神学家则显得极其不高兴。","3":"年轻的古典学者身穿奇装异服围着篝火游行，轮流饮用双耳瓶中的酒，并大声吟诵卡图卢斯最糟糕的诗句。挑剔的古典学者四处奔走，纠正翻译，驳斥理论，显然乐在其中。阴郁的古物学家与软弱的神学家瑟缩在火边，刻意无视对方的存在。","4":"营地中响起平调圣歌。圣歌声穿过烟雾缭绕的树林。年轻神学家聚集于叛徒之林，争论波伊修斯与阿奎那的思想孰优孰劣。软弱的神学家活跃其间，为最具胆识的异端思想提供酒水与注解。挑剔的古典学者与阴郁的古物学家则分坐营地两端，阴沉地盯着自己那一堆堆的证据。","5":"营地空无一人。一阵冷风将篝火上的灰烬吹散。几页潦草涂写的专著残页被风卷起。林中夜莺啼鸣。雨开始落下，冲刷着留下的残骸。"},"Dismal Paleographer":{"0":"Dismal Paleographer","1":"“有新面孔真好。我已经彻底受够那两个了，而且这也不是第一次。他们坚信着一些彻头彻尾的胡言乱语。任何傻瓜都能看出这片森林就是查理曼的长眠之所。每一则传说与骑士故事都让我深信不疑。”","3":"“真是糟透了，不是吗？我从来就受不了那些古典学者。他们在拉丁文上固执得要命，除了荷马与维吉尔什么都不读。而她还在那里大讲特讲，简直就像当年——呃。不过你总该能看出这根本毫无意义吧？伊南娜怎么可能在这里？她的整个神话核心就是‘她会再度苏醒’啊！”","4":"“我受不了了。他们不是在肢解可怜的阿奎那，就是在把自己灌醉。我真无法理解那家伙怎么还有脸向别人讲授罪行与德性！只要给他们足够的酒，他们很快就会把圣约翰和那座坟冢抛诸脑后。这就是神学的最大问题——它根本不用证明什么！”","2":"“你看看我们的工作成效！我有自己的学生了！有奖学金！有研究拨款！虽然——悄悄说——学院派来的可不是最顶尖的，而且拨款远远不够我们继续探索。但我们已经在进展中。我的查理曼很快就会醒来。到时你也能分享发现的荣耀。”"},"Vituperative Classicist":{"0":"Vituperative Classicist","1":"“我们在这里已经好几个月了，毫无所获。经费也快见底了。我已经尽力让那两个永远无法被学界当回事——但我们连再进森林一次的补给都没有。我们都相信那坟冢埋着一位传奇君主，只是各执一词，不知到底是谁。”","2":"“你知道我全怪你让这场死人狂欢节继续下去，”她哼了一声，“中世纪学者，天哪。我去过古墓殖民地三次，都没见过这么多走来走去的尸体。我实在受不了那个三流学科的四流从业者得逞。”","3":"“见到你真高兴！你在森林里的努力结出了果实。夏暮大学派来了学生——还有经费——当然，不够再组织一次探险。但他们愿意投资，说明他们对我——对我们——在此地的发现颇感兴趣。你我定能找到她，让她的歌声再度响彻天穹。”","4":"“他非得这么夸张不可吗？当然，他非得如此。节制这种事从未出现在他那愚蠢的脑袋里。现在他们都一副正襟危坐的模样，这些糟糕的牛奶与圣饼学生——但我一看就知道，这注定要变成一次酒神祭。”"},"Feckless Theologian":{"0":"Feckless Theologian","1":"“谢天谢地。终于来个新人。我们试图到达那座山丘上的坟冢已经太久了。它在林子的另一边，而我们几乎没钱可用了。夏暮拒绝再拨一分钱，说是我的上一篇专著给学院带来耻辱。但我只是回顾了我们的学生时代罢了。”","2":"“要是再来一个鼻子不好的教授来向我解释圣约翰崇拜在米兰的起源，我就要崩溃了。如果他说对了，我倒可真要生气。不过老实说，他又唱的《罗兰之歌》倒是挺好听。他嗓音不错，而且那曾是他的最爱之一。”","3":"“至少还有人愿意跟我说话。我倒要看看她的信徒要多久才会意识到她有多固执。可如果我再听到一场讲座，把希腊英雄与圣徒们相提并论，我就要尖叫到圣约翰自己从坟里爬出来为止。”","4":"“夏暮对我们的发现激动不已，他们派来了学生！还带来些许资金——用以他们的食宿——还有对我们发现的适当研究。当然，也不足以再发起一场探险。他们对实证材料实在太过惧怕。校长曾是考古学家，估计就是因此才对考古有了阴影。”"},"The Wood":{"0":"The Wood","1":"这片林地广阔而幽暗。只有星际流云带来的阵雨偶尔打破其沉寂。沉重的杉树在风中摇曳。摄政王之墓在高处俯瞰整座森林，阴郁沉思。","3":"林中响起钟声。焚香与莲花的气息随风飘散。摄政王之墓的青铜墓盖在星光照耀下泛着光辉。","4":"高大的雪松在狂风中弯下枝干。附近河床传来沙粒的气味。摄政王之墓的巨大身影将金色长影投向沉郁的树林。","2":"黑色树木被积雪包裹，在猛烈风中摇晃。林深处传来号角声。摄政王之墓的石块如同沾满被杀君王之血的板岩般漆黑。"}}

original: The Relict's approval
translation: 遗族的许可

original: The Matronly Relict has granted you permission to linger at the edge of the White Well. A dubious honour, at best.
translation: 威严的遗族已允许你逗留在白井的边缘。充其量只是一个可疑的荣誉。

original: {"1":"The Matronly Relict has given you permission to linger at Wellmouth.","0":"You have lost the Relict's approval."}
translation: {"1":"威严的遗族已允许你逗留在井口。","0":"你已经失去了遗族的认可。"}

original: The Researcher's Crusade
translation: 研究员的奋斗

original: Apollonian Cinders cause dangerous obsessions. The Researcher seeks to warn those to whom the Cinders are being marketed.
translation: 太阳灰将引发危险的执念。研究员试图警告那些被推销灰烬的对象。

original: {"1":"The Researcher is on a crusade against the Apollonian Cinders."}
translation: {"1":"研究者正在抵制太阳灰。"}

original: The Revelation That Uncertainty is Itself an Answer
translation: 不 确 定 本 身 亦 是 一 种 答 案

translation: 它在你的视野中摇曳燃烧。

original: The Romantic Ornithologist's Dream
translation: 浪漫的鸟类学家的梦想

original: There is a little bird, so they say.
translation: 有只小鸟，他们如是说。

original: The Romantic Ornithologist's Search for a New Vista
translation: 浪漫的鸟类学家寻找新的前景

original: He is looking for somewhere suitable to show you.
translation: 他正在找个合适的地方，打算带你去看看。

original: The Royal Society's Gratitude
translation: 皇家学会的感激

original: You are currently held in some esteem. The brilliant minds of the Society have, however, short memories.
translation: 你目前受到一些尊重。然而，学会的聪明才智们的记忆是短暂的。

original: The Rubbery Express
translation: 软体人快车

original: The Rubbery Men have a new home in Pan.
translation: 软体人在潘城有了新家。

original: The Salon Opens
translation: 沙龙开张

original: The Incognito Princess is on secondment in London.
translation: 隐姓埋名的公主正被借调于伦敦。

translation: 百兽先生的印章

original: It bears its name in the Correspondence.

original: The Seal of Mr Pennies
translation: 便士先生的印章

original: It bears its name in the Correspondence.
translation: 上面用信符刻着它的名字

original: The Seal of Mr Pipes
translation: 烟管先生的印章

original: It bears its name in the Correspondence.

translation: 皮拉内西的第二条规则

original: Don't give names to the nameless.
translation: 不要给无名的人起名字。

original: {"1":"You have learned the Second Rule of Piranesi."}
translation: {"1":"你已经学会了皮拉内西的第二条规则。"}

original: The Sequencer's Charity
translation: 新秩序者的慈善

original: The Dazzled Sequencer has enlisted you in his attempt to inflict kindness upon the needy.
translation: 目眩的新秩序者邀请你尝试对有需要的人施以善意。

original: {"1":"Deliver the Well-Intentioned Package to the Brabazon Workworld.","2":"Return to the Sequencer at the Clockwork Sun.","3":"Deliver the Well-Intentioned Package to London.","4":"Return to the Sequencer at the Clockwork Sun.","5":"Receive another charitable assignment from the Sequencer.","7":"Return to the Sequencer at the Clockwork Sun.","6":"Deliver the Well-Intentioned Package to Worlebury-juxta-Mare. You'll need to find the hidden side of the seaside port.","8":"Deliver the Well-Intentioned Package to a fence in London."}
translation: {"1":"在布拉巴宗交付包装精美的货物。","2":"回到发条太阳的新秩序者那里。","3":"在伦敦交付包装精美的货物。","4":"回到发条太阳的新秩序者那里。","5":"从新秩序者处接受另一项慈善任务。","7":"回到发条太阳的新秩序者那里。","6":"在滨海沃伯瑞交付包装精美的货物。你需要找到滨海车站隐藏的另一面。","8":"向伦敦的走私者交付包装精美的货物。"}

original: The Servitor's Liberation
translation: 灵仆的解放

original: The Brittle Servitor awaits its escape from Piranesi.
translation: 脆弱的灵仆等待着从皮拉内西中逃脱。

original: {"1":"You are closer to freeing the Servitor from Piranesi.","10":"Take the Servitor to start a new life in New Winchester.","9":"Take the Servitor back to the Blue Kingdom.","20":"You brought the Servitor to New Winchester."}
translation: {"1":"你离从皮拉内西中解放灵仆更近了一步。","10":"让灵仆在新温彻斯特开始新的生活。","9":"让灵仆返回蓝色王国","20":"你把灵仆带到了新温彻斯特。"}

original: The Settler Died
translation: 移民死了

original: Return him to Port Prosper.
translation: 把他送回兴荣港。

original: {"1":"Return the settler to Port Prosper."}
translation: {"1":"把移民送回兴荣港。"}

original: The Shed Skin of the Incognito Princess
translation: 隐姓埋名的公主蜕去的皮囊

original: The sloughed skin of the Incognito Princess. It slithers around the locomotive, scaring the crew.
translation: 隐姓埋名的公主蜕下的皮囊。它在机车周围蠕动，使列车员感到惊恐。

original: {"1":"You have acquired the shed skin of the Incognito Princess.","0":"You no longer have the shed skin of the Incognito Princess."}
translation: {"1":"你已经获得了隐姓埋名的公主蜕去的皮囊。","0":"你不再拥有隐姓埋名的公主蜕去的皮囊。"}

original: The Shield of the Star
translation: 星辰之盾

original: In the moonlight, it is a magical shield, engraved with the symbol of a heptagram symbol. In any other light, it is a nameplate ripped from the hull of The Parzifal.
translation: 在月光下，它是一个神奇的盾牌，上面刻着七芒星符号的符号。在任何其他光线下，它都是从帕西法尔号的车体上撕下来的铭牌。

original: The Shivering Jemmy
translation: 颤抖的杰米

original: A wheezing, sputtering, ramshackle engine dating from the first days of London's settlement. It gobbles fuel like a starved wolf and sulks worse than a cat kept in from the rain. It will, at best, suffice.
translation: 一台呼哧带喘、噼啪作响、摇摇欲坠的引擎，其历史可以追溯到伦敦建城之初。它吞噬燃料的架势犹如饿狼扑食，闹起脾气的程度更甚于被暴雨困在屋里的猫儿。这台机器充其量只能勉强派上用场。

original: The Signalman is busy
translation: 信号员正忙

original: He's working hard for you. Hopefully.
translation: 他在为你努力工作。希望如此。

original: {"1":"Come back in 30 days to receive the fruits of the Signalman's labours.","0":"The Signalman is finished with his labours."}
translation: {"1":"30天后再来，接收信号员的劳动成果。","0":"信号员已经完成了他的工作。"}

original: The Signalman's Labour
translation: 信号员的劳作

original: The Signalman is busy currying favour for you.
translation: 信号员正忙着为你钻营讨好

original: The Signalman's Work
translation: 信号员的工作

original: The Signalman is busy currying favour for you.
translation: 信号员正忙着替你钻营讨好

original: {"1":"The Signalman is attempting to garner favour with the Ministry of Public Decency.","2":"The Signalman is attempting to garner favour with London's captains of industry.","0":"The Signalman is finished with his labours."}
translation: {"1":"信号员正在尝试获得公德部的青睐。","2":"信号员正在尝试获得伦敦工业首脑的青睐。","0":"信号员已经完成了她的工作。"}

original: The Snuffing of Lanterns
translation: 灯笼熄灭

original: The lanterns have been lit. The wind will take them in time, but not yet.
translation: 灯笼已经被点亮了。风总会吹熄它们，但不是现在。

original: The 'Speciometer' Assaying Device
translation: “光谱仪级”勘查设备

original: A sophisticated machine for the sophisticated captain. Never be confounded by the wonders of the High Wilderness again!
translation: 为老练的车长打造的精密机器。再也不会被天野的奇观所迷惑！

original: The Spider-Sweeper
translation: 蜘蛛清扫工

original: It's one of the most ancient functions that a Yoked can perform at the White Well, and among the least prestigious.
translation: 这是在白井缚链灵所能承担的最古老的职责之一，同时也是最卑微的差事。

original: {"1":"You have learned of the existence of a long-defunct role at Wellmouth, known as the Spider-Sweeper.","2":"You have been given permission to perform the duties of the Spider-Sweeper."}
translation: {"1":"你已经了解到井口存在一个早已不存在的职责，称为蜘蛛清扫工。","2":"你已被允许履行蜘蛛清扫工的职责。"}

original: The Steward is Behaving Oddly
translation: 管家行为怪异

original: The Steward is Dazzled
translation: 管家目眩

original: The Steward is Fixing the Sun
translation: 管家正在修太阳

original: The Storm That Schemes
translation: 蓄谋之风暴神

original: The Unseen Queen has supplanted the Storm That Speaks. She wears her father's misery as a mantle, and schemes to bring an end to death.
translation: 无形女王取代了言语之风暴神。她披上了父亲的苦难外衣，密谋结束死亡。

original: {"1":"The Unseen Queen has supplanted her father's place in the heavens. She wears his lingering torment as her mantle."}
translation: {"1":"无形女王取代了她父亲在天穹的地位。她披戴着他挥之不去的折磨。"}

original: The Storm's Patience
translation: 风暴的耐心

original: There is not much of it.
translation: 并没有那么多。

original: The Strength of the Company
translation: 同伴的力量

original: Getting the Brigade back together.
translation: 让大队重新团结起来。

{"Boom":{"0":"Boom","101":"阿尔布雷希特吸引了离门最近的守卫注意。他的胡须颤动，抬起那双小爪子靠近鼻子，甚至还讨要奶酪。在地板上用粉笔匆匆计算过后，佩特罗内拉布置了炸药。薇安打开一瓶刺激性的液体，迅速制造出浓浓的黑雾。她将其投向看起来最昂贵的织机。工人和守卫一片混乱。最后，辛德斯叼着火柴冲进鼠洞。","102":"阿尔布雷希特吸引了离门最近的守卫注意。他的胡须颤动，抬起那双小爪子靠近鼻子，甚至还讨要奶酪。在地板上用粉笔匆匆计算过后，佩特罗内拉布置了炸药。安吉带着手榴弹和一副邪恶的表情扑向一台昂贵的织机。爆炸在工厂车间轰然响起。工人和守卫一片混乱。最后，辛德斯叼着火柴冲进鼠洞。","201":"威尔玛已经为这种情况策划了几个月的对策（"还有其他情况！我睡眠一直不好。"）不过，她也乐意听取你的建议。于是，计划开始执行。阿尔布雷希特吸引了离门最近的守卫注意。他的胡须颤动，抬起那双小爪子靠近鼻子，甚至还讨要奶酪。在地板上用粉笔匆匆计算过后，佩特罗内拉布置了炸药。薇安打开一瓶刺激性的液体，迅速制造出浓浓的黑雾。她将其投向看起来最昂贵的织机。工人和守卫一片混乱。最后，辛德斯叼着火柴冲进鼠洞。","202":"威尔玛已经为这种情况策划了几个月的对策（"还有其他情况！我睡眠一直不好。"）不过，她也乐意听取你的建议。于是，计划开始执行。阿尔布雷希特吸引了离门最近的守卫注意。他的胡须颤动，抬起那双小爪子靠近鼻子，甚至还讨要奶酪。在地板上用粉笔匆匆计算过后，佩特罗内拉布置了炸药。安吉带着手榴弹和一副邪恶的表情扑向一台昂贵的织机。爆炸在工厂车间轰然响起。工人和守卫一片混乱。最后，辛德斯叼着火柴冲进鼠洞。"},"Sneak":{"0":"Sneak","102":"阿尔布雷希特作为诱饵开始行动。他饰演一只走失的宠物老鼠，演技极其逼真。一群守卫争论着谁该把他带回家给孩子当宠物。与此同时，在安吉炸毁了一台时织机的机智掩护下，佩特罗内拉开始用开锁工具作业。她解除了三重顽固虱毒液瓶、防护转盘与带锯齿的解锁机关。辛德斯猛冲进门。","101":"阿尔布雷希特作为诱饵开始行动。他饰演一只走失的宠物老鼠，演技极其逼真。一群守卫争论着谁该把他带回家给孩子当宠物。与此同时，在维安释放的一瓶黑雾掩护下，佩特罗内拉开始用开锁工具作业。她解除了三重顽固虱毒液瓶、防护转盘与带锯齿的解锁机关。辛德斯猛冲进门。","201":"威尔玛早已为这种情况准备好应对方案。（"嗯，我睡得不好。"）阿尔布雷希特作为诱饵开始行动。他饰演一只走失的宠物老鼠，演技极其逼真。一群守卫争论着谁该把他带回家给孩子当宠物。与此同时，在薇安释放的一瓶黑雾掩护下，佩特罗内拉开始用开锁工具作业。她解除了三重顽固虱毒液瓶、防护转盘与带锯齿的解锁机关。辛德斯猛冲进门。","202":"威尔玛早已为这种情况准备好应对方案。（"嗯，我睡得不好。"）阿尔布雷希特作为诱饵开始行动。他饰演一只走失的宠物老鼠，演技极其逼真。一群守卫争论着谁该把他带回家给孩子当宠物。与此同时，在安吉炸毁了一台时织机的机智掩护下，佩特罗内拉开始用开锁工具作业。她解除了三重顽固虱毒液瓶、防护转盘与带锯齿的解锁机关。辛德斯猛冲进门。"},"Force":{"0":"Force","101":"破坏是今日的主旋律。阿尔布雷希特假装被捕鼠夹夹住——他可怜的“临终”哀鸣吸引了守卫与工头前来查看。佩特罗内拉开始在一条流水线和一把旋转锯上做小动作。空气中顿时布满四处反弹的钉子，为辛德斯冲向大门提供了掩护。她双枪开火，一举将门锁炸飞！薇安迅速赶去处理受伤的守卫和工人——她的治疗方式中掺杂了大量鸦片酊。在接下来一段时间里，不太可能有人打扰你们。","102":"破坏是今日的主旋律。阿尔布雷希特假装被捕鼠夹夹住——他可怜的“临终”哀鸣吸引了守卫与工头前来查看。佩特罗内拉开始在一条流水线和一把旋转锯上做小动作。空气中顿时布满四处反弹的钉子，为辛德斯冲向大门提供了掩护。她双枪开火，一举将门锁炸飞！安吉则在几台时织机上引发了一连串范围受控的爆炸。利润岌岌可危！在接下来一段时间里，不太可能有人打扰你们。","202":"威尔玛已经为这种情形筹谋了好几个月（"以及别的情形！我本来就睡不好。"）破坏是今日的主旋律。阿尔布雷希特假装被捕鼠夹夹住——他可怜的“临终”哀鸣吸引了守卫与工头前来查看。佩特罗内拉开始在一条流水线和一把旋转锯上做小动作。空气中顿时布满四处反弹的钉子，为辛德斯冲向大门提供了掩护。她双枪开火，一举将门锁炸飞！安吉则在几台时织机上引发了一连串范围受控的爆炸。利润岌岌可危！在接下来一段时间里，不太可能有人打扰你们。","201":"威尔玛已经为这种情形筹谋了好几个月（"以及别的情形！我本来就睡不好。"）破坏是今日的主旋律。阿尔布雷希特假装被捕鼠夹夹住——他可怜的“临终”哀鸣吸引了守卫与工头前来查看。佩特罗内拉开始在一条流水线和一把旋转锯上做小动作。空气中顿时布满四处反弹的钉子，为辛德斯冲向大门提供了掩护。她双枪开火，一举将门锁炸飞！薇安迅速赶去处理受伤的守卫和工人——她的治疗方式中掺杂了大量鸦片酊。在接下来一段时间里，不太可能有人打扰你们。"},"Lt":{"0":"Lt","101":"佩特罗内拉紧跟辛德斯冲了出去，只留下薇安和阿尔布雷希特留在房间里。"出去，"薇安对主席说道，后者丝毫不需要第二次提醒。","102":"佩特罗内拉紧跟辛德斯冲了出去，只留下安吉和阿尔布雷希特留在房间里。安吉面带慈爱地微笑着看向主席，后者立刻离开了房间。","201":"佩特罗内拉紧跟辛德斯冲了出去，只留下威尔玛、薇安和阿尔布雷希特留在房间里。威尔玛在吝啬鬼主席的耳边低语了几句，后者立刻拉开椅子，逃也似地离开了办公室。","202":"佩特罗内拉紧跟辛德斯冲了出去，只留下威尔玛、安吉和阿尔布雷希特留在房间里。威尔玛在吝啬鬼主席的耳边低语了几句，后者立刻拉开椅子，逃也似地离开了办公室。"},"Prep":{"0":"Prep","102":"辛德斯环视着她的队伍，终于点了点头。"我们准备好了。不管中士留下了什么东西，它都待得太久了。"老鼠们发出欢呼。"我们解决了早该解决的麻烦事。"欢呼声更大了。"他已经得到报应，现在轮到我们拿回属于自己的东西！"整个伙食间充斥着吱吱的喧闹声。"去伦敦！去拿那丰厚得要死的退休金！"","101":"辛德斯环视着她的队伍，终于点了点头。"我们准备好了。不管中士留下了什么东西，它都待得太久了。"老鼠们发出欢呼。"我们解决了早该解决的麻烦事。"欢呼声更大了。"他已经得到报应，现在轮到我们拿回属于自己的东西！"整个伙食间充斥着吱吱的喧闹声。"去伦敦！去拿那丰厚得要死的退休金！"","201":"辛德斯环视着她的队伍，终于点了点头。"我们准备好了。不管中士留下了什么东西，它都待得太久了。"老鼠们发出欢呼。"我们解决了早该解决的麻烦事。"欢呼声更大了。"他已经得到报应，现在轮到我们拿回属于自己的东西！"整个伙食间充斥着吱吱的喧闹声。"去伦敦！去拿那丰厚得要死的退休金！"在老鼠大队的后方，威尔玛紧盯着辛德斯。","202":"辛德斯环视着她的队伍，终于点了点头。"我们准备好了。不管中士留下了什么东西，它都待得太久了。"老鼠们发出欢呼。"我们解决了早该解决的麻烦事。"欢呼声更大了。"他已经得到报应，现在轮到我们拿回属于自己的东西！"整个伙食间充斥着吱吱的喧闹声。"去伦敦！去拿那丰厚得要死的退休金！"在老鼠大队的后方，威尔玛紧盯着辛德斯。","204":"她走到上尉面前。他的胡子耷拉着，但他迎上她的目光。"听好了：我不喜欢你。我不信任你。"辛德斯站得离他鼻尖不过寸许。"但你得到了一个号码，还愿意与我们分享。我们会把这事办到底。我们所有人。你最好别耍什么花招。"
 
上尉点头，"当然了，中——辛德斯。"辛德斯转过身去。维尔玛用审视的目光看着她。","205":"她走到上尉面前。他的胡子耷拉着，但他迎上她的目光。"听好了：我不喜欢你。我不信任你。"辛德斯站得离他鼻尖不过寸许。"但你得到了一个号码，还愿意与我们分享。我们会把这事办到底。我们所有人。你最好别耍什么花招。"
